Title: CRM & Data Analyst Intern
Description:
About The Job

For our‚ÄØDigial & Data Team team based‚ÄØin‚ÄØMilan‚ÄØwe are looking as of now for a CRM & Data Analyst Intern.‚ÄØ

During this‚ÄØexperience‚ÄØyou‚Äôll‚ÄØbe‚ÄØpart of a dynamic team, and‚ÄØyou‚Äôll have visibility‚ÄØin‚ÄØall company‚Äôs‚ÄØdepartments‚ÄØand you‚Äôll contribute to the achievements of your team.‚ÄØ

Job Description

DATA Execution


Use automatic tools to extract and analyze data from both primary and secondary sources (DTC, CRM, Website, IRI, Google Analytics, Helium, Profitero, etc) and track evolution accordingly with KPIs
Work with external stakeholders to optimize data visualization, propose changes and secure data are properly tracked
Prepare analysis reports for internal and external stakeholders, in order to support strategic choices and create monthly reports to evaluate performance based on main KPIs


CRM & DTCs Execution


Support CRM and Data team on roll-out of the CRM plan, including sending of newsletter campaigns
Monitor and secure right implementation of content and data among owned shop, propose optimization areas
Propose the basket of deals starting from sell-out data performances and monitor the implementation


About you

To be able to achieve the above and be successful in this‚ÄØjob, we believe you need to have‚ÄØ


Background computer science or economics studies
Good knowledge of Google Analytics
Knowledge of data visualization tools (eg. Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI)
Excellent knowledge of Excel or other statistical tools (SPSS, SAS)


Competencies & Skills


Strong mathematical skills to collect, measure and organize data
Passion for numbers
Logical and systematic approach to problem solving
Precision and attention to details
Creativity
Team Working
Proactivity


About us

About Us

As a world leading food company DANONE stands for international success. Around 104000 employees work on all five continents in the three Danone business areas Essential Dairy & Plant-Based, Specialized Nutrition and Water on one corporate mission ‚ÄúBringing health through food to as many people as possible‚Äù.

We want to invite people to join the movement for a healthier world. We recognize the power people have to impact the world through their daily choices. Each time we eat and drink, we vote for the world we want to live in. We believe a healthy body needs healthy food and healthy food needs a healthy planet this is what our new signature One Planet One Health embodies.

Do things your way. The way you work, the way you develop, the way you progress, it‚Äôs all up to you.

Working here you‚Äôll need to enjoy a fast-pace, complexity and it can get a little challenging. But it‚Äôs packed with opportunities. You‚Äôll work with some of the best-known brands in the world and we absolutely guarantee that you can just be yourself.

Be innovative and entrepreneurial and the impact you could make might just amaze you. Join our movement for a healthier world. One Planet One Health BY YOU.

We offer

We believe in a ‚ÄúPhygital‚Äù workplace.

Phisycal because our offices are centrally located and easily reached by public transportation. Free water, yogurt and fruits are of course benefits for our employees.

Digital as we work for objectives, without time or space constraints, in a responsible, autonomous and flexible way that helps to reconcile life and work times, improving productivity and focusing on results.

We offer you a culture, where you‚Äôll be welcomed to bring in ideas and take initiative. You‚Äôll learn from colleagues highly committed and passionate about what they do. We believe in learning something new each day as it means you keep growing every day!

We believe everyone has talent, something which comes natural to you. Your uniqueness is something which brings both excellence as well as energizes you.

In Italy we are Certified Great Place to Work and B Corp.

Inclusive Diversity

Danone is committed to create and live an inclusive & diverse environment, which will drive our growth as a business, as teams, as members of communities & as individuals. Valuing diversity is recognizing and respecting human differences and similarities. Our aim is to ensure that all employees and applicants are given equal opportunity and that our organization is representative of our consumers and society.

We commit to foster an inclusive working environment where we celebrate all types of diversity, both visible and invisible, which includes age, race, gender, nationality, disability, background, education, religion, beliefs, thinking style, perspectives and sexual orientation.

We believe that our differences will make the difference.

In Italy from march 2023 we are Certified for Gender Equality (UNI PDR 125/22).

What‚Äôs next?

Willing to start your meaningful journey? Hit the apply bottom!

Join us! Follow @idanoners_italia on Instagram! See life at Danone from the front row

Your personal data will be processed in compliance with the EU Regulation 2016/679.

La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006 ed √® aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, et√†, etnia e credo religioso.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Thanks to our innovative BuyNow PayLater payment solution, Scalapay is transforming the way more than 6.5 million customers buy online and in-store, empowering 8,000+ merchants (online and in-store) to give their customers magical shopping experiences.

Being only 3 years old didn‚Äôt stop us from becoming a unicorn ü¶Ñ We have raised over $700mln and we did this thanks to a team built around our 4 core values: #MakeItHappen #PlayAsATeam #StayCurious #FocusOnCustomer.

This is where your magic happens. If you love it, Scalapay it ‚ô•

Our data team seeks a Data Analyst who will champion a 'data-first' mindset, ensuring precise measurement and reporting of relevant metrics. This role collaborates closely with Scalapay‚Äôs key Business Units such as Product, Marketing and Sales, employing technical expertise to translate concepts into concrete outcomes.

You will:

  • Serve as the data point of reference for our key Business Units, providing them with necessary support;
  • Use advanced analytical tools to assess and interpret sales and marketing data, measuring the effectiveness of activities and pinpointing areas for improvement;
  • Build and maintain comprehensive reports and dashboards for our teams to facilitate data-driven decision-making;
  • Translate business questions into analytical solutions, providing actionable insights;
  • Ensure accuracy and reliability in measuring key performance indicators (KPIs) and the underlying data;
  • Identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement in order to propose data-driven recommendations to optimise marketing strategies and sales processes;
  • Conduct hands-on work with data, including data cleansing, transformation, and validation;
  • Help us extend a data-driven mindset throughout Scalapay;
  • Be an active member of the Data team, helping to develop and enhance our suite of Business Intelligence tooling.

You‚Äôll be great for this role if:

  • You have a minimum of 3 years of experience in a data-driven role, ideally with a background in startups or fintech;
  • You have strong SQL skills, Python is a plus;
  • You are proficient in data visualisation tools and data storytelling;
  • You have a background in statistics and can conduct experiments or validate hypotheses;
  • You are fluent in Italian and English: you must be totally confident talking and sharing results in English in a sharp and concise way;
  • You demonstrate outstanding communication skills, both verbally and in writing. You excel at simplifying complex topics into straightforward solutions and ideas;
  • You‚Äôre more than data-driven, you are obsessed with data!

Why you should join Scalapay:

  • Attractive packages based on skills and experience - the salary we have for this position is up to 40'000‚Ç¨ (Gross Annual Base);
  • International environment with significant challenges to be met every day;
  • Lots of opportunities to work with a team of industry tech leaders who are focused on delivering products that offer exceptional user experiences;
  • Personalised support to accelerate your professional growth and take ownership of the products you deliver: we want to help you grow!
  • Latest technologies and being encouraged to bring your flair to the role.

Recruitment Process:

  • Initial Chat: A brief conversation with our Talent Acquisition team;
  • Hiring Manager Interview: A deep dive into your experience and motivation for the role;
  • Case Study: A skills-based test with a debriefing session involving key stakeholders, conducted in our Milan office;
  • Final Chat with Simone (CEO): An opportunity to discuss Scalapay‚Äôs values and assess cultural alignment.

Want to learn more? Don't hesitate to explore our Careers website, our LinkedIn and Glassdoor pages.

Pro tip: send your CV in English üòâ

Super Pro tip: we know that application processes can be scary and frustrating but‚Ä¶ we look for talent, not people that tick all our boxes.

We believe in the power of diversity: Scalapay is an Equal Opportunity Employer for any minority, disability, gender identity or sexual orientation.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:

Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese

Competenze trasversali come problem solving, flessibilit√†, precisione, team working, analisi, organizzazione e coordinamento

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
L‚ÄôOpen Banking √® il nostro DNA!




Centrico ha le sue radici nelle rivoluzioni tecnologiche guidate dal gruppo Sella e dal 2019 √® una realt√† indipendente: creiamo innovazione per il mondo delle banche e della finanza con un sistema informativo aperto, veloce, modulabile e conveniente.




Il nostro obiettivo √® diventare una data driven company!

Per vincere questa sfida, la persona che cerchiamo far√† parte dell‚Äôarea Data Management di Centrico in qualit√† di Data Analyst e si occuper√† di analizzare i dati per fornire insights utili a supporto dei processi decisionali interni al Gruppo.




Responsabilit√†:

Analizzerai grandi quantit√† di dati per identificare trend, pattern e insights utili
Creerai report e dashboard per visualizzare i dati in modo chiaro e comprensibile
Collaborerai con team multidisciplinari (Business, IT, Compliance, Risk) per comprendere le esigenze di analisi dei dati e fornire soluzioni data-driven
Supporterai l‚Äôindividuazione di regole e di livelli di controllo dell'accesso ai dati
Contribuirai al miglioramento continuo della piattaforma dati del Gruppo tramite l‚Äôimplementazione di best practice e standard di settore




Requisiti:

Esperienza di almeno 4 anni nel medesimo ruolo o in ruolo affine
Laurea in discipline STEM
Conoscenza avanzata di strumenti di analisi dati (es. SQL, Python, R)
Buona conoscenza di strumenti di visualizzazione dati (es. Power BI, Tableau)
Ottime capacit√† relazionali sia verso interlocutori tecnici sia di business
Spiccate capacit√† analitiche e di problem solving




Nice to have:

Esperienza con tecnologie di big data (es. Hadoop, Spark)
Conoscenza di tecniche di machine learning e data mining
Esperienza con strumenti di ETL (es. Talend, Informatica)
Certificazioni professionali in ambito data analysis (es. Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate)
Conoscenza di metodologie Agile e Scrum




Cosa offriamo:

Un ambiente positivo e in cui il tuo contributo venga apprezzato, la tua opinione √® importante e vogliamo che tu la esprima
Piattaforma e-learning Microsoft: per non smettere mai di imparare e di certificarti
Attivit√† di engagement (tornei di Beach Volley, Padel, Calcetto) e di volontariato aziendale
Contratto con CCNL del Credito
Cura della persona anche con la polizza sanitaria - per te e il tuo nucleo familiare - e polizza TCM
Supporto al benessere psicologico attraverso Stimulus, uno sportello esterno di ascolto a disposizione dei colleghi e dei loro famigliari
Uno sguardo al tuo futuro attraverso il contributo aziendale al fondo pensione
Policy di lavoro flessibile




Sede di lavoro: Milano o Torino o Biella con modalit√† ibrida.

Title: Data Analyst Stage (Ufficio Studi) - Milano [IFS]
HTML:
Trasforma le tue aspirazioni professionali in una storia di successo, entra in PwC come:

Data Analyst Intern (Ufficio Studi)

Your Perspectives

L‚ÄôUfficio Studi si occupa di elaborare studi originali su tematiche di interesse politico, economico e sociale.

PwC √® alla ricerca di un Analista da inserire all‚Äôinterno del team con l‚Äôobiettivo di supportare le attivit√† di ricerca e analisi nel campo della geo-economia.

Nello specifico si occuper√† di fornire supporto al Manager e al team nell‚Äôattivit√† di:

  • Ricerca e analisi economiche e di mercato sui temi di interesse;
  • Raccolta, analisi ed elaborazione di dati con approfondimento di tematiche a 360¬∞;
  • Interpretazione dei dati per estrarre insight strategici e supportare la reportistica ricorrente;
  • Visualizzazione e comunicazione dei dati tramite la creazione di report e presentazioni con PowerPoint/Power BI.

Your Unique Strengths

  • Laurea Triennale o Magistrale in ambito economico, o discipline affini, con focus su analisi quantitativa ed economia applicata;
  • buona conoscenza del pacchetto Office (Word, Power Point e Excel);
  • ottima capacit√† di manipolazione e analisi dei dati, con padronanza di software di data analysis (Excel, STATA)
  • buona conoscenza della lingua inglese;
  • gradita conoscenza delle dinamiche macroeconomiche, politiche e sociali e della loro interconnessione;
  • attitudine positiva e curiosa al lavoro, oltre ad una predisposizione per le attivit√† in gruppo, attenzione ai dettagli e precisione.

Set Your Expectation Higher

Il tuo talento e la tua curiosit√† avranno tutto lo spazio che meritano e, attraverso l‚Äôidentificazione delle migliori risorse, contribuirai a garantire la qualit√† dei servizi che offriamo ai nostri clienti. In questo percorso di crescita sarai accompagnato da colleghi esperti e da una formazione continua e su misura grazie alla quale potrai mettere le tue competenze a disposizione dei clienti interni.

Feel At Home

Ci prendiamo cura delle nostre persone mettendole nelle condizioni di crescere ed esprimere al meglio il proprio potenziale. Ci impegniamo a creare valore per i clienti, le persone e la comunit√†, nel rispetto dell'ambiente.

GIVE YOUR LIFE A DIFFERENT PERSPECTIVE!!!

Title: Customer Data Analyst
HTML:
Vuoi essere al centro di prospettive di crescita uniche? Entra nella practice Customer Transformation di PwC e diventa:

Customer Data Scientist

Your Perspectives

Ti unirai al gruppo di Customer Transformation di PwC su sfidanti progetti di Customer Advance Analytics e Data Science in ambito Consumer Markets, Financial Services, Energy&Utilities e Telco&Media, per supportare le organizzazioni nel valorizzare il patrimonio informativo sui propri Clienti e Consumatori finali, utilizzando i dati a disposizione per sviluppare soluzioni innovative basate su Machine Learning.

Grazie all‚Äôaccesso alle vaste competenze del nostro network internazionale, potrai dare spazio alle tue idee e fornire il contributo innovativo che hai sempre desiderato.

Sarai Coinvolto Con Crescenti Responsabilit√† Nelle Seguenti Attivit√†

  • Disegno, sviluppo, test e misurazione delle performance di modelli di Machine Learning e di modelli statistici in ambito Marketing: segmentazioni, Customer scoring, modelli di classificazione, modelli predittivi, modelli di propensione/raccomandazione;
  • Analisi dati avanzate sul comportamento dei Clienti sia su canale fisico che digitale attraverso esplorazione di dati strutturati e destrutturati, al fine di derivare insight di business;
  • Sviluppo di analisi quantitative e modelli di Machine Learning a supporto di progettualit√† di data-driven Strategy & Decision Making;
  • Attivit√† di targeting evoluto e valutazione quantitativo-statistica delle campagne di Marketing;
  • Raccolta dei requisiti progettuali a diretto contatto con il cliente per il disegno e l‚Äôelaborazione di soluzioni data-driven;

Your unique strengths

  • Stai concludendo o hai concluso il percorso di studi o possiedi una laurea magistrale preferibilmente ad indirizzo scientifico (es. Data Science, Informatica, Statistica, Matematica, Fisica);
  • Hai un‚Äôottima conoscenza di almeno uno tra i linguaggi Python ed R;
  • Possiedi una buona conoscenza dei database relazionali e del linguaggio SQL;
  • Hai forti competenze analitiche e ti interessa usare i dati per trovare soluzioni funzionali, creative ed innovative a problemi complessi;
  • Parli e scrivi in inglese fluentemente;
  • Ti interessa lavorare in team e crescere in un ambiente di lavoro stimolante e positivo;
  • Sei flessibile e hai forte motivazione ad intraprendere una carriera professionale in consulenza;

Saranno considerate un plus, le conoscenze, anche a livello base di:

  • Framework Spark e piattaforme Cloud come Amazon Web Services, Azure e Google Cloud Platform;
  • Artificial Intelligence in ambito Speech Analytics, Natural Language Processing o Computer Vision;

Title: E-commerce & Omnichannel Data Analyst
Description:
Country: Italy

City: Milan, Piazza Einaudi, 4

Contract Type: Regular

Department: E-commerce & Omnichannel

Mode: Hybrid




Versace is one of the most recognizable names in the world. The luxury House immediately became a leader in fashion and culture following its founding in 1978.

Versace is led by Emmanuel Gintzburger as CEO and the design team is under the leadership of the Chief Creative Officer, Dario Vitale. Donatella Versace remains the Chief Brand Ambassador for Versace since April 1st, 2025.




Your Opportunity:

The E-commerce & Omnichannel Data Analyst will join the Data Analytics Team, reporting into the Global Ecommerce & Omnichannel Data Science & Business Analytics Manager.

This role is crucial in supporting the business through in-depth and insightful data analysis, generating reports and recommendations for top management and the E-commerce & Omnichannel team.




Your Contribution:

Analyze digital and omnichannel business and digital marketing performance, creating reports and dashboards to share results with a wide range of stakeholders.
Monitor web analytics and KPIs related to the e-Commerce channel to track performance, generate valuable insights, and identify areas for improvement.
Collaborate with multiple teams (Merchandising, Media, CRM, Regional teams) to consolidate findings, provide actionable insights, and drive data-informed decisions.
Manage and organize work, including collaboration with the digital agencies on the data visualization platforms.
Analyze key business KPIs using Versace's analytics tools (GA4, Adobe Analytics, OBIEE, etc.).
Proactively identify business challenges, develop data-driven solutions, and communicate recommendations effectively.
Leverage data analysis skills to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies that can inform business strategy and improve performance.
Build and maintain data models and datasets to support reporting and analysis needs.
Analyze large datasets using SQL and similar languages to derive actionable insights and build insightful dashboards and reports.




Your Skills:

2+ years of experience in a similar role within the Fashion & Luxury industry or at a major consulting firm, demonstrating a strong understanding of the business and its unique challenges.
Demonstrated experience working with data as a Data Analyst, including data manipulation, cleaning, analysis, and visualization.
Passion for the fashion and luxury world.
University degree in Business, Management, Digital Marketing, Data Science, or a related field.
Data-oriented mindset with advanced Excel and BI skills. Exceptional analytical skills, accuracy, and attention to detail are essential.
Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Domo, Looker Studio, Power BI, Tableau or similar).
Strong understanding of statistical concepts and methods
Experience with SQL.
Excellent written and spoken English (will be tested during the interview process).
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with a proactive approach and the ability to thrive in Versace's diverse and multicultural team.
Team player, highly organized, and flexible, with the ability to adapt to a fast-paced, ever-changing environment.




Diversity and inclusion are integral to Versace's DNA. We promote an inclusive environment where employees and customers from diverse backgrounds are welcomed, valued, and celebrated. We take pride in our commitment to diversity, equality, and inclusion, and will continue to uphold these principles wherever we do business. Our doors are open to all.

WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER M/D/F

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We‚Äôre all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they‚Äôre looking for in their local communities ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.

What You‚Äôll Do & Who You Are

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Subito‚Äôs team. Our mission is to turn data into insights, and get a clear understanding of the Italian market and marketplace industry.

The Data Analyst will be part of the Business Analytics team mainly supporting the Management Team, Finance, Marketing and Sales departments in the decision making process.

The Data Analyst will study user behaviour, evaluate strategic initiatives and new features. Above all, your work will impact the growth of our business.

Your Typical Day


Mash up and analyse different data sets to support the business with high-value insights (we have some data engineering heroes, so it‚Äôs more analysing than mashing up!) and structure presentations showing the findings to a variety of stakeholders
Formulate/test hypotheses to explain underlying reasons about business dynamics
Design clear, automated reports to democratise data access to the whole company
Work in a cross functional team, mostly focusing on the business insights generation in collaboration with colleagues of Marketing, Finance and Sales departments
Contribute both on short term analysis and long term initiatives, either local or global
Dig deep in our data lake and build Machine Learning models to make Subito a smarter product and enhance business understanding


Skills Required


4+ years of experience as Data Analyst / Data Scientist
Highly proficient with SQL
Knowledge of one or more analytics languages, ideally Python
Applied knowledge of statistical techniques
Data visualization and presentation skills to match a wide range of audiences


Plus


Good English proficiency level
Prior experience in a digital company
Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP...)
Hands on experience on Data Science projects


Benefits


Competitive compensation package
Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
‚ÄòWork from anywhere‚Äô weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more


For each working day, you will be eligible for a ‚Ç¨8 meal voucher., You can use our local provider Fitprime to maintain physical well-being., You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don‚Äôt meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don‚Äôt meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

Descrizione azienda

Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?

Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attivit√†, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. realizzando report su misura;

Questa √® CPM, una realt√† internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunit√† di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un‚Äôesperienza che ti metter√† a contatto con i brand e le aziende pi√π importanti in Italia.

Candidati e‚Ä¶ magari ci vediamo a bordo!

Posizione

Ti offriamo di diventare il guru dei nostri dati.

Per te abbiamo una posizione come Data Analyst in un settore, il field marketing, dove la tua competenza pu√≤ davvero fare la differenza.

Potrai mettere in luce le tue capacit√† di analisi e interpretazione del dato al servizio di tanti brand diversi. Annoiarsi? Impossibile. Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Perch√© in CPM Italy siamo convinti che i tuoi risultati passino anche attraverso la qualit√† della tua vita.

Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?

Il tuo ruolo riguarda l‚Äôanalisi e la presentazione dei dati riguardanti la vendita, il posizionamento e la valutazione di campagne promo e di comunicazione in store dei brand delle nostre aziende clienti.

Come?

  • realizzando report su misura;
  • utilizzando indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);
  • sviluppando e gestendo un avanzato sistema di business intelligence e dashboard online;
  • collaborando con i colleghi del team.


Requisiti

Sei tu la persona giusta?

Per entrare nel nostro reparto di Data Analyst √® richiesta un‚Äôesperienza di almeno 1 anno in questo ruolo. Essere positivi, proattivi e precisi √® un ottimo requisito ma i veri must sono la passione per i numeri e la voglia di partecipare sempre a nuove sfide.

In pi√π √® fantastico se‚Ä¶

  • ti piace trasformare dati in informazioni;
  • Excel √® il tuo pane quotidiano;
  • hai una conoscenza base di PowerBI ed SQL;
  • ti entusiasma lavorare in team;
  • sei flessibile sia come orari che di mentalit√†;


Altre informazioni

Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999 n.68, Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.

Title: BOTTEGA VENETA Business Intelligence Assistant
HTML:
Summary

 Inspiring individuality with innovative craftmanship since 1966, creativity lies at the heart of Bottega Veneta. Born in Vicenza, the house is rooted in Italian culture yet maintains a truly global outlook. An inclusive brand with exclusive products, Bottega Veneta is as much of a feeling as it is an aesthetic.

Job Description

We are currently seeking a Business Intelligence Assistant as part of our dynamic team in Milan, with a starting temporary agency contract.

How you will contribute:
  • Be a partner for the business users for every BI activity, to respond in the most effective and efficient way to the business needs of the Finance and Merchandising areas;
  • Support users in the day-by-day activities and collect the internal requests, translating them into technical specifications and provide assistance;
  • Foster a data culture by keeping documentation up to date and provide the right education to end-users;
  • Cooperate with Kering group for specific projects rollout.


Who you are:
  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Statistics or a related field;
  • Excellent knowledge of the Office suite, especially Excel;
  • Knowledge of Business Intelligence tools such as MicroStrategy, PowerBI and QlikSense;
  • Experience in a similar position within international environment will be considered as a plus;
  • PowerBI dashboard development will be considered a plus;
  • Good knowledge of English both written and spoken;
  • Attitude to problem solving combined with strong professional relational skills to be able to translate business needs into technical terms;
  • Be a team player;
  • Curious, open-minded and focus on team success, high attention to detail.


Why work with us?

This is a fabulous opportunity to join the Kering adventure and to actively contribute to the development of the business by becoming part of a global Luxury Group that offers endless possibilities to learn and grow. Talent development is a managerial principle at Kering and we are committed to fostering internal mobility. Our common vision promotes leadership skills and helps every employee to reach their full potential in a stimulating and fulfilling workplace environment.

Kering is committed to building a diverse workforce. We believe diversity in all its forms ‚Äì gender, age, nationality, culture, religious beliefs and sexual orientation ‚Äì enriches the workplace. It opens up opportunities for people to express their talent, both individually and collectively and it helps foster our ability to adapt to a changing world. As an Equal Opportunity Employer we welcome and consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of their background. 

Job Type

 Agency

Start Date

 2025-04-14

Schedule

 Full time

Organization

 Bottega Veneta S.R.L

Title: Junior Digital Data Analyst
Description:
Do you enjoy analysing data, but also love to interact with non-technical stakeholders to present business-oriented insights?

Do you strive for excellence, but are also capable to find the right trade-off between time taken to deliver and the quality of the end result?

Do you perform best when working in a team, but are also willing to go solo when needed?

If you answered ‚Äúyes - that‚Äôs me!‚Äù to the questions above, then you should join Softlab‚Äôs Digital Marketing & Sales Practice as Digital Data Analyst (remote-first role, contractually based in Milano): you‚Äôll be working closely with our clients‚Äô teams to provide key data insights, using state-of-art digital analytics tools, that drive business decisions impacting both online and offline channels.

In Softlab, you‚Äôll be free to express your full potential working with our top-tier clients and having a real impact on the growth of our company.




What you‚Äôll do

Bring together data from multiple sources, leverage it to identify unspotted behaviours and drive changes based on actionable insights
Use available digital & non-digital data for answering any analytics-related question coming from business stakeholders
Translate high-level commercial requests into meaningful KPIs, and then in metrics and dimensions that can be measured
Present the results of your analyses being able to summarize the key insights, but also to drill down in the details
Proactively push to improve the status quo by experimenting with data analysis




What you bring

Good knowledge of Excel
Good knowledge of SAS, SQL, R, Python or similar solution for data analysis
Preferred: hands-on experience with digital analytics tools usage (e.g. Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics)
Good experience with other office tools (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint)
Attention to details, ability to meet deadlines, manage multiple priorities, and work in a team
Proficiency in Italian and English languages (written & spoken)
Preferred: statistics, mathematics, engineering, or similar STEM university background




What we offer

Stimulating experience in a dynamic consulting company: you will learn a lot and grow based on your performance
Pleasant environment, where the team generates value for our clients and builds strong relationships: you will always receive support and feel welcomed as a member of the Softlab family
Exciting work with innovative technologies and solutions: you will develop hard and soft skills that will always come handy, and will help defining advanced standards and best practices
Remote-ready work: if the project allows it, you‚Äôll have the possibility to work wherever there is a reliable Internet connection (the role will be contractually based in Milano)




We are a company certified for Gender Equality (Uni/PdR 125:2022). This position is open to all individuals who meet the technical requirements, regardless of gender.




Diversity, uniqueness, inclusion, equality




We believe that teams composed of diverse individuals generate better ideas and help us understand and support our clients more effectively. That‚Äôs why we ensure equal opportunities for everyone.

At Softlab S.p.A., we accompany every person from the moment they submit their application throughout their time with us, along a career path that does not consider or discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any form of disability.

As a company, we take responsibility for playing an active role in supporting a cultural and social shift that recognizes equal opportunities for all and a life free from discrimination.

Title: Business & Data Analyst
HTML:
Dove lavorerai

Per la nostra sede di Milano cerchiamo candidati interessati ad un percorso professionale all'interno della Direzione Generation & Energy Management.

Su cosa lavorerai

La persona che stiamo cercando avr√† la responsabilit√† per le seguenti attivit√†:

  • analizzare i dati;
  • identificare inefficienze di processo;
  • proporre soluzioni e monitorare i progressi;
  • collaborazione con le altre aree di business nei progetti di sviluppo di modelli, strumenti e applicazioni volti al continuo miglioramento dei processi.

Cosa pu√≤ esserti utile per valutare se candidarti

  • Laurea in Informatica, Economia, Ingegneria materie STEM;
  • Perfetta conoscenza del pacchetto Office;
  • Gradita la conoscenza di strumenti di programmazione (R, Python, Qlik, ...);
  • Conoscenza dell‚Äôinglese;
  • Spirito di iniziativa;
  • Capacit√† di lavoro in team;
  • Ottime capacit√† relazionali.

La tua sede di lavoro

Lavorerai nel nostro HQs di Milano in Via A. Algardi 4 insieme al resto del tuo team di riferimento. Ci impegniamo a favorire il tuo work-life balance e quindi avrai la possibilit√†, se lo desideri, di lavorare anche in modalit√† ibrida organizzandoti con il tuo team.

Sorgenia

Nati nel 1999, siamo una Green Tech Energy Company e oggi il principale operatore energetico privato nazionale.

Scopri di pi√π su Sorgenia su www.sorgenia.it.

Cosa significa far parte di Sorgenia

Cerchiamo nuovi colleghi che, con spirito pionieristico e innovativo, siano pronti a gestire con proattivit√† e concretezza progetti sfidanti contribuendo alla continua crescita di Sorgenia.

In Sorgenia offriamo l‚Äôopportunit√† di imparare ogni giorno attraverso percorsi di formazione continua e eventi interni informali; siamo attenti al benessere delle nostre persone e per questo offriamo flessibilit√† oraria, smart working e una palestra aziendale se vuoi tenerti in forma.

Se vuoi scoprire cos‚Äôaltro offriamo in Sorgenia, candidati, non vediamo l‚Äôora di conoscerti!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
MainStreaming¬Æ is an intelligent media delivery company that empowers enterprises, media and gaming companies to ensure the best Quality of Experience to their audience, through its revolutionary AI-powered technology.

It optimizes the viewing experience with its Intelligent Media Deliver Platform (iMDP), the first platform designed to guarantee full governance over the streaming process, the highest Quality of Service and the best Return on Investment




Data Analyst




Job Description:




We seek a results-driven Data Analyst to spearhead our company's performance management and analytical initiatives. In this key role, you will define KPIs across the organization, develop comprehensive performance frameworks, and deliver critical insights to our C-Level leadership team through data-driven analyses and quarterly business reviews.




Key Responsibilities:




Define and implement Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) across all departments to drive data-informed decision-making.
Develop and maintain a comprehensive performance management framework to monitor company objectives, analyze current operational performance metrics, and track progress against strategic goals.
Perform complex cross-functional analyses by extracting, combining, and interpreting data from multiple sources to uncover actionable insights.
Design and deliver quarterly business review presentations for C-Level executives, highlighting performance trends, identifying areas for improvement, and recommending data-driven solutions.
Extract, transform, and clean data from various sources and databases to ensure data integrity and consistency for analysis. Collaborate with stakeholders across departments to understand business requirements and translate them into analytical frameworks.
Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to visualize key metrics and facilitate data-driven discussions.




Qualifications:




Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, or related field; Master's degree preferred.
3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or similar analytical roles.
Experience in conducting analyses and analyzing performance data within the Content Delivery Network (CDN) or ISP industry is a plus.




Skills:




Strong analytical skills with demonstrated ability to transform complex data into actionable insights.
Proficient in SQL for data extraction and manipulation from various database systems.
Working knowledge of Python for data cleaning, analysis, and visualization (pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib).
Experience in designing and implementing KPIs and performance-tracking frameworks
Excellent data visualization skills and experience with BI tools (such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker).
Fluent English and outstanding written and verbal communication abilities are required.




Competencies:




Execution & Precision: Strong attention to detail, ability to meet deadlines, and accuracy in financial reporting.
Ownership & Accountability: Taking responsibility for work, following through on commitments, and delivering high-quality results.
Adaptability & Resilience: Thriving in a fast-paced environment, responding well to change, and maintaining professionalism under pressure.
Collaboration & Influence: Working effectively across teams, promoting knowledge sharing, and fostering a culture of transparency.
Continuous Learning: Proactively seeking opportunities to enhance financial expertise and industry knowledge.




What we offer:




A young, dynamic and entrepreneurial environment that promotes self-development and growth.
Flexible working hours.
Breakfast, lunch and snacks in the office.
Access to E-Learning platform.
Health Insurance




Salary and benefits will be assessed in relation to the candidate's experience and skills




In MainStreaming you will be part of a dynamic, flexible, young, tight-knit and international environment and will have the chance to work in a company that values innovation, out of the box thinking, its employees and is committed to making the world a better place.

MainStreaming is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

I candidati interessati possono inviare un curriculum vitae con l'autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali ai sensi del D.Lgs 196/03 e ‚ÄúCodice in materia di protezione dei dati personali‚Äù e dell‚Äôart. 13 GDPR 679/16 ‚Äì ‚ÄúRegolamento europeo sulla protezione dei dati personali‚Äù.

Title: Data Analyst | MILANO
Description:
Descrizione azienda

Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?

Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attivit√†, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa √® CPM, una realt√† internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunit√† di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un‚Äôesperienza che ti metter√† a contatto con i brand e le aziende pi√π importanti in Italia.

Candidati e‚Ä¶ magari ci vediamo a bordo!

Posizione

Ti offriamo di diventare il guru dei nostri dati.

Per te abbiamo una posizione come Data Analyst in un settore, il field marketing, dove la tua competenza pu√≤ davvero fare la differenza.

Potrai mettere in luce le tue capacit√† di analisi e interpretazione del dato al servizio di tanti brand diversi. Annoiarsi? Impossibile. Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Perch√© in CPM Italy siamo convinti che i tuoi risultati passino anche attraverso la qualit√† della tua vita.

Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?

Il tuo ruolo riguarda l‚Äôanalisi e la presentazione dei dati riguardanti la vendita, il posizionamento e la valutazione di campagne promo e di comunicazione in store dei brand delle nostre aziende clienti.

Come?


realizzando report su misura;
utilizzando indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);
sviluppando e gestendo un avanzato sistema di business intelligence e dashboard online;
collaborando con i colleghi del team.



Requisiti

Sei tu la persona giusta?

Per entrare nel nostro reparto di Data Analyst √® richiesta un‚Äôesperienza di almeno 1 anno in questo ruolo. Essere positivi, proattivi e precisi √® un ottimo requisito ma i veri must sono la passione per i numeri e la voglia di partecipare sempre a nuove sfide.

In pi√π √® fantastico se‚Ä¶


ti piace trasformare dati in informazioni;
Excel √® il tuo pane quotidiano;
hai una conoscenza base di PowerBI ed SQL;
ti entusiasma lavorare in team;
sei flessibile sia come orari che di mentalit√†;



Altre informazioni

Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999 n.68, Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.

Title: Junior ‚Äì Operations Excellence AI/GenAI
Description:
Stiamo cercando una figura junior da inserire nel team di Operations Excellence di Deloitte sulla sede di Milano, che lavorer√† in modalit√† Hybrid.

All‚Äôinterno del team avrai l‚Äôoccasione di crescere occupandoti di supportare la trasformazione delle istituzioni finanziarie per le quali lavoriamo a seguito di esigenze che possono nascere dal business e contesto di mercato del cliente e/o da adeguamenti degli stessi dettati dal rispetto e aderenza alle normative bancarie/assicurative. In particolare ti occuperai di concretizzare le esigenze strategiche dei nostri clienti attraverso progetti fortemente innovativi che coprono tutta la value chain aziendale e spaziano su molteplici ambiti di competenze eterogenee e multidisciplinari.

Your Role

La risorsa Junior sar√† inserita all'interno di un team di lavoro, affiancando colleghi senior e occupandosi di:


Lavorare a stretto contatto con il team e con i clienti per comprendere le esigenze di business e tradurle in metodologie ed approcci coerenti ad esse;
Sviluppo e gestione dell‚Äôinnovazione tecnologica e strategica;
Lavorare in ambito analytics ed in progetti di digitalizzazione utilizzando strumenti e tecnologie di tendenza come data management, automatizzazione dei processi, Gen AI ecc‚Ä¶
Supportare i clienti nell‚Äôanalisi attraverso l‚Äôelaborazione e la gestione delle basi informative per identificare trend, pattern e insight rilevanti; e nella visualizzazione dei dati attraverso il disegno e lo sviluppo di report e dashboard.


Winning Requirements


Laurea/Master in ambito STEM;
Interesse per tecnologie e strumenti di AI/Gen AI, Data Management, Data Visualization (Tableau, Power BI o Qlik); e cloud computing;
Conoscenza di almeno un linguaggio di programmazione (tra SQL, Python, R). Rappresenterebbe un must la conoscenza di librerie specifiche, come Pandas, Numpy, Scikit-learn, SciPy ecc‚Ä¶
Buona conoscenza della‚ÄØlingua‚ÄØinglese;
Buona conoscenza del Pacchetto Office (Excel, PPT);
Forte motivazione a sviluppare competenze nel campo dei dati, dall'acquisizione all'analisi e presentazione e curiosit√† per le nuove tecnologie e le tendenze del settore.


Make An Impact That Matters

Deloitte √® un network leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, presente in oltre 150 Paesi con 457 mila professionisti. Offriamo soluzioni innovative e sostenibili in Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory, Tax e Legal. Il nostro obiettivo √® supportare le aziende nello sviluppo e nell'implementazione di strategie al passo con il mercato.

In Deloitte la sostenibilit√† √® un tema centrale. Per questo, attraverso le strategie e le progettualit√† legate alle tematiche Environmental, Social e Governance (ESG), ci impegniamo a promuovere una crescita responsabile, sostenibile e inclusiva per il Pianeta, le nostre persone e la societ√†. Scopri di pi√π sulle nostre strategie di Corporate Sustainability, tra cui Well-being, la strategia volta a migliorare il benessere fisico, mentale e sociale delle nostre persone, affinch√© siano felici e piene di energia in tutti gli ambiti della loro vita e WorldClimate, la strategia globale di Deloitte per diventare un‚Äôorganizzazione Net Zero e per guidare scelte responsabili all‚Äôinterno e all‚Äôesterno dell‚Äôorganizzazione.

Sei pront* a #MakeAnImpactThatMatter insieme? Candidati ora!

Le persone interessate possono inviare la propria candidatura con autorizzazione ai sensi del dlgs. 196/2003. La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed √® aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, et√†, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio √® stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell‚Äôinclusivit√†.

Title: Financial Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
We are looking for a brilliant and tech-savvy Financial Data Analyst Trainee to join our Milan HQ. The Financial Data Analyst Trainee will support the FP&A team in ensuring accurate financial and operational data management through advanced reporting, dashboarding, and analytics. He/she will contribute to transforming data into actionable insights to support strategic decisions.

Do you match this profile?


Bachelor/Master‚Äôs degree in Business Analytics and Big Data, possibly with Finance and Economics insights
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Power BI; Programing in Python (Pandas, NumPy); experience with ERP systems (SAP) is a strong plus.
Strong analytical and quantitative skills, with a structured and data-driven mindset
Previous experience (or internship) in FP&A, Data Analysis, or similar finance roles with strong exposure to data tools is a strong plus
Ability to manage large datasets and extract business insights through data visualization and storytelling
Proactive, detail-oriented, and eager to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment
Fluency in English (spoken and written); Italian is a plus.


If so, apply for this job!

What do we expect from you?


Contribute to the automation and digitalization of FP&A processes, improving efficiency and data accuracy through data modeling, automated reports and dashboard creation
Deliver ad hoc and structured analysis leveraging data science techniques to identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities.


The Recruitment Process


Apply online
If your profile matches our search, you will be contacted by our HR team for a first exploratory interview. Otherwise, you will receive an e-mail to inform you that we will not proceed with your application.
If the first interview turns out to be successful, you‚Äôll meet the Head of FP&A and the Senior Controller

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Who We Are

At Heritage, we are dedicated to being at the forefront of the alternative investment industry by creating a next-generation fund that combines traditional investment sourcing and evaluation strategies with proprietary technology solutions and data-driven approaches.

Our mission is to connect elite families and entrepreneurs globally with carefully vetted top-performing private market opportunities, leveraging our digital products to make the alternative investment market more accessible, efficient, and connected. Furthermore, we embrace the principles of "skin in the game" as we co-invest with our partners, and "innovation" as we work to create lasting value through continually advancing the investment sector.

Our team comprises of a diverse international group of individuals from leading organisations and with diverse backgrounds, including private equity, venture capital, banking, software development, law, and entrepreneurship. We are committed to attracting top-notch talent and providing opportunities for growth and development based on their individual strengths and interests

Your role

About

Are you passionate about leveraging technology to drive financial innovation? We‚Äôre on the hunt for energetic individuals to provide exceptional operational support and insight, helping propel our team to new heights. During your time at Heritage, you will gain exposure to a wide range of activities at the intersection of finance and technology:


Be a data expert ‚Äì Use your analytical mindset to work with complex data sets. Analyze daily transactions and bank statements to build clear, compelling visualizations of client net worth‚Äîincluding both public and private assets.
Own the account aggregation tool ‚Äì Take full ownership of the tool, ensuring the database remains accurate and efficient. Continuously identify areas for improvement and lead innovation initiatives.
Leverage Bloomberg ‚Äì Use Bloomberg tools to conduct deep analysis of public securities and extract actionable insights.



Who We Are Looking For


A fast-paced, analytical, numerical thinker who thrives in a dynamic environment
Committed to excellence, with a proven track record of achieving results through data-driven decision-making
An exceptional problem-solver with strong analytical and critical thinking skills
Intellectually curious, constantly seeking new knowledge and skills in analytics and programming
Independent yet collaborative, ready to make a difference within our team
Ideally, you have experience working with Tableau, Power BI, Python or R
Fluency in English
Available for a 6-month internship starting in May 2025



What We Offer

A paid internship in the heart of Milan lasting six enriching months, will help shape you into a well-rounded professional. You will join an international team from 10+ nationalities whom you will interact with daily and at quarterly team-building events.

Join us for an experience that combines professional growth with a positive work environment. Your journey begins here!

Hiring Process

The Hiring Process At Heritage Includes The Following Stages


CV Screening
English and Critical Thinking Assessment
Cultural Fit Interview
Technical Interview
Logic & Attitude Assessment
Final Interview with the Department Manager
Offer



At Heritage, we are proud to have a diverse team representing over 15 nationalities, with all communication conducted in English. We are deeply committed to providing equal opportunities and work actively to remove potential biases in our hiring process by involving a Hiring Committee in all decision-making.

By applying to this job offer, you confirm that you have read and understood Heritage's privacy policy: http://bit.ly/privacypolicy121.

Furthermore, we embrace the principles of "skin in the game" as we co-invest with our partners, and "innovation" as we work to create lasting value through continually advancing the investment sector.

Our team comprises of a diverse international group of individuals from leading organisations and with diverse backgrounds, including private equity, venture capital, banking, software development, law, and entrepreneurship. We are committed to attracting top-notch talent and providing opportunities for growth and development based on their individual strengths and interests

Your role

About

Are you passionate about leveraging technology to drive financial innovation? We‚Äôre on the hunt for energetic individuals to provide exceptional operational support and insight, helping propel our team to new heights. During your time at Heritage, you will gain exposure to a wide range of activities at the intersection of finance and technology:

  • Be a data expert ‚Äì Use your analytical mindset to work with complex data sets. Analyze daily transactions and bank statements to build clear, compelling visualizations of client net worth‚Äîincluding both public and private assets.
  • Own the account aggregation tool ‚Äì Take full ownership of the tool, ensuring the database remains accurate and efficient. Continuously identify areas for improvement and lead innovation initiatives.
  • Leverage Bloomberg ‚Äì Use Bloomberg tools to conduct deep analysis of public securities and extract actionable insights.


Who We Are Looking For

  • A fast-paced, analytical, numerical thinker who thrives in a dynamic environment
  • Committed to excellence, with a proven track record of achieving results through data-driven decision-making
  • An exceptional problem-solver with strong analytical and critical thinking skills
  • Intellectually curious, constantly seeking new knowledge and skills in analytics and programming
  • Independent yet collaborative, ready to make a difference within our team
  • Ideally, you have experience working with Tableau, Power BI, Python or R
  • Fluency in English
  • Available for a 6-month internship starting in May 2025


What We Offer

A paid internship in the heart of Milan lasting six enriching months, will help shape you into a well-rounded professional. You will join an international team from 10+ nationalities whom you will interact with daily and at quarterly team-building events.

Join us for an experience that combines professional growth with a positive work environment. Your journey begins here!

Hiring Process

The Hiring Process At Heritage Includes The Following Stages

  • CV Screening
  • English and Critical Thinking Assessment
  • Cultural Fit Interview
  • Technical Interview
  • Logic & Attitude Assessment
  • Final Interview with the Department Manager
  • Offer


At Heritage, we are proud to have a diverse team representing over 15 nationalities, with all communication conducted in English. We are deeply committed to providing equal opportunities and work actively to remove potential biases in our hiring process by involving a Hiring Committee in all decision-making.

By applying to this job offer, you confirm that you have read and understood Heritage's privacy policy: http://bit.ly/privacypolicy121.

Title: REVENUE MANAGEMENT & BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST
HTML:
Lactalis Nestl√© Prodotti Freschi √® alla ricerca di un/a Revenue Management & Business Intelligence Analyst da inserire all‚Äôinterno della Direzione Sales.

La risorsa riportando al Revenue Management & Business Intelligence Senior Coordinator avr√† le seguenti responsabilit√†:

  • Fornire alla forza vendita una serie di reportistiche volumi e spesa promo per monitorare stime a 3 mesi per cliente/prodotto e leva (con focalizzazione volumi promo) e per seguire l‚Äôavanzamento effettivo giornaliero delle vendite vs le stime;
  • Fornire su base mensile reportistiche ex post di consuntivazione vendite e di precisione di stime per singolo responsabile commerciale/prodotto/leva;
  • Monitorare sistematicamente le principali leve commerciali con il fine la costruzione di un conto economico mensile per business e canale da fornire al Controllo di Gestione per il monitoraggio settimanale del risultato aziendale;
  • Concorrere alla costruzione del Forecast mensile per prodotto in cooperazione con le altre funzioni aziendali (Planning e Trade Marketing), fornendo il fabbisogno informativo promozionale; fornire un continuo monitoraggio dell‚Äôandamento dei volumi promo vs stime, evidenziandone gap o opportunit√†;
  • Monitorare in maniera strutturata l‚Äôattuazione delle politiche commerciali, soprattutto in termini promozionali (sconti promo);
  • Supportare la forza vendita attraverso analisi ed approfondimenti per lo sviluppo di progetti ad hoc o simulazioni di conto economico; supportare, inoltre, lo sviluppo di analisi di Revenue Management prodotto/cliente, per migliorare profittabilit√† su pdt/clienti.


REQUISITI RICHIESTI

  • Laurea in Scienze Economiche o percorsi affini;
  • Esperienza professionale pregressa di 1 anno in contesti strutturati;
  • Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese, la conoscenza del francese sar√† considerata un plus.
  • Ottima padronanza del pacchetto Office, in particolare Excel, e dei principali applicativi utilizzati in ambito Sales;
  • Ottime capacit√† analitiche, di interpretazione dei dati e di sintesi;
  • Orientamento al risultato;
  • Proattivit√†, flessibilit√†, precisione, autonomia;
  • Spiccate capacit√† relazionali e comunicative.


INFORMAZIONI CHIAVE SULLA POSIZIONE

  • Tipologia contrattuale: Tempo Determinato di 12 mesi;
  • Sede di lavoro: Milano (MI).


La ricerca √® rivolta a candidature di entrambi i sessi (L. 903/77).

Title: DATA CONTRACT MANAGEMENT - ANALYST
Description:
Chi cerchiamo

Per la nostra sede di Milano siamo alla ricerca di una risorsa da inserire come DATA CONTRACT MANAGEMENT ‚Äì ANALYST¬†all‚Äôinterno del team ‚ÄúData Quality‚Äù. La struttura ha la principale responsabilit√† di attuare e gestire i processi di data quality e remediation dei domini dati che gli vengono affidati, nonch√© di gestire i contratti di approvvigionamento di dati a servizio delle strutture di business.¬†

Per quale Business Unit

L‚Äôattivit√† della Business Unit Generazione e Trading √® relativa alla gestione del portafoglio impianti di generazione del Gruppo con il duplice scopo di massimizzare la disponibilit√† e l‚Äôefficienza degli impianti, minimizzando i costi di esercizio e manutenzione (O&M) e di massimizzare il profitto derivante dalla gestione del portafoglio energetico attraverso l‚Äôattivit√† di compravendita di energia elettrica, di combustibili (gassosi e non gassosi) e di titoli ambientali sui mercati all‚Äôingrosso nazionali ed esteri. Rientra nell‚Äôambito della Business Unit anche l‚Äôattivit√† di trading sui mercati nazionali ed esteri di tutte le commodity energetiche (gas, energia elettrica, titoli ambientali).

Ti occuperai di


Gestire il processo di apertura e monitoraggio delle Richieste di Acquisto per servizi di fornitura dati e servizi
Interfacciarsi con il Business per la raccolta delle esigenze e degli input necessari
Relazionarsi con i Fornitori per la richiesta e negoziazione delle offerte economiche e per la gestione degli aspetti contrattuali
Predisporre la documentazione necessaria per l‚Äôinserimento delle richieste sui portali aziendali
Collaborare con gli Uffici coinvolti nel processo di acquisto per l‚Äôavvio e la finalizzazione dei contratti, coinvolgendo il team Legal in caso di negoziazioni contrattuali
Gestire l‚Äôapprovazione periodica delle fatture¬†
Gestire le attivit√† di budgeting e di consuntivazione
Supportare le attivit√† di Data Quality e Data Remediation


Sei la persona giusta se ti riconosci in questo profilo


Laurea (anche triennale) in Economia, Ingegneria Gestionale o discipline affini
Buona conoscenza del pacchetto Microsoft Office, in particolare di Excel
Una precedente esperienza in ambiti affini sar√† considerata requisito preferenziale
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese
Ottime capacit√† organizzative, attenzione al dettaglio e orientamento al risultato
Buone doti comunicative e capacit√† di interfacciarsi con interlocutori eterogenei
Attitudine al problem solving e capacit√† di lavorare in autonomia e in team


Che cosa offriamo


Flessibilit√†:¬†settimana lavorativa con venerd√¨ a orario ridotto, flessibilit√† negli orari di entrata/uscita e pausa pranzo; Smartworking sino al 60% dell‚Äôorario di lavoro su base bimestrale
Buoni pasto elettronici
Salute e benessere: assistenza sanitaria integrativa,¬†supporto psicologico attraverso counseling, webinar dedicati al benessere psicofisico e vaccino antinfluenzale
Famiglia: A2A Life Caring, iniziativa a supporto della genitorialit√† attraverso un mese aggiuntivo retribuito al 100% per maternit√†/paternit√†, rimborsi spese per figli, convenzioni con asili nido, team coaching per neogenitori; spazio caregiver,¬†offriamo webinar e uno spazio di ascolto dedicati a chi si prende cura di persone fragili o non autosufficienti
Formazione e sviluppo: programma di induction dedicato ai nuovi assunti,¬†gestione dei talenti, corsi di formazione e possibilit√† di crescita interna e job rotation tramite candidatura interna
Risparmio e tempo libero: oltre 300 convenzioni, tra cui trasporti pubblici, attivit√† sportive, viaggi, eventi culturali, e offerte speciali per luce e gas. Opzioni per il car sharing e la conversione del premio di risultato in benefit di welfare
Ambiente di lavoro:¬†promuoviamo una cultura che valorizza la diversit√†, l‚Äôequit√† e l'inclusione (DE&I); potrai inoltre avere la possibilit√† di unirti a un team dedicato allo sviluppo di iniziative e progetti su queste tematiche. Sosteniamo l'evoluzione tecnologica e offriamo strumenti e risorse per promuovere il lavoro digitale.


Saranno valutate esclusivamente le candidature inviate tramite il Sito Carriere aziendale.

Ci impegniamo ogni giorno per creare un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo e innovativo, fondato sul rispetto, sull‚Äôetica e sulle pari opportunit√† garantendo la valorizzazione delle diversit√†.

La selezione √® rivolta a candidati e candidate in linea con le competenze richieste. I dati personali raccolti verranno trattati nel rispetto del Regolamento Ue 2016/679 (GDPR).

Title: TECNICO/A ANALISI PERFORMANCE
HTML:
In Gruppo CAP gestiamo il servizio idrico integrato per la Citt√† metropolitana di Milano, impegnandoci ogni giorno nel promuovere la qualit√†, il controllo e il continuo miglioramento della nostra acqua, lavorando sempre al servizio della sostenibilit√† e investendo costantemente nel nostro team e nelle nostre persone. Chi stiamo cercando?


TECNICO/A ANALISI PERFORMANCE

Unisciti al team dell'Ufficio Analisi Performance all'interno della Funzione Asset & Facility Management - Analisi Performance avrai l'opportunit√† di contribuire attivamente alla supervisione, al monitoraggio e alla reportistica di tutti i dati aziendali inerenti alla qualit√† tecnica del Servizio Idrico Integrato. Riporterai al Responsabile Analisi Performance e curerai le relazioni con tutti gli stakeholder coinvolti nei processi gestiti.


Ecco di cosa ti occuperai:

  • Analisi e monitoraggio delle performance: Elaborerai e analizzerai i dati aziendali per monitorare mensilmente gli indicatori di qualit√† tecnica e di performance, producendo report periodici per la Funzione e gli enti preposti;
  • Reportistica e tracciabilit√†: Assicurerai l'accuratezza e la tracciabilit√† dei dati, fornendo report dettagliati agli enti nazionali e regionali (ARERA, EGATO CMM) per garantire la conformit√† normativa;
  • Controllo e previsione: Preparerai report di controllo delle performance, identificando tempestivamente eventuali scostamenti e proponendo azioni correttive, anche attraverso elaborazioni grafiche e di sintesi;
  • Collaborazione e conformit√†: Parteciperai a gruppi di lavoro interfunzionali, interpretando e implementando le disposizioni normative e regolatorie relative alla qualit√† tecnica e alle performance del Servizio Idrico Integrato.


Il nostro profilo ideale:

  • Hai una Laurea Magistrale in Ingegneria, Economia o discipline affini;
  • Hai maturato un‚Äôesperienza almeno biennale nell'analisi dati e performance, preferibilmente in contesti di Public Utilities o aziende strutturate di grandi dimensioni;
  • Hai una solida conoscenza delle principali metodologie di analisi dati e performance e una forte passione per i dati;
  • Hai un‚Äôottima padronanza del Pacchetto Microsoft Office in particolare Excel, PowerPoint e possiedi una buona conoscenza della normativa ARERA. La conoscenza di Power BI sar√† considerata un plus;
  • Possiedi ottime doti organizzative, precisione, orientamento ai risultati, spirito di squadra, capacit√† di gestire le scadenze e lo stress.



Sede di lavoro: MILANO - In considerazione della dislocazione dei siti del Gruppo sul territorio √® preferibile il possesso di patente B.



Cosa offriamo:

Contratto di lavoro subordinato, categoria professionale ‚ÄúTECNICI‚Äù, C.C.N.L. Settore Gas Acqua. Forma contrattuale, livello di inquadramento e trattamento economico commisurati alle caratteristiche professionali della risorsa individuata.

Pacchetto benefit che include premio di risultato legato al raggiungimento di obiettivi, buoni pasto elettronici, welfare e wellbeing, possibilit√† di smart working, formazione continua e possibilit√† di crescita interna.


Vuoi fare la differenza e diventare parte del cambiamento con Gruppo CAP?


Candidati entro e non oltre il 7/05/2025 allegando un CV completo e aggiornato in formato pdf e autorizzando il trattamento dei dati personali (art. 13 del D. Lgs. 196/2003 e art. 13 GDPR 679/16). Le candidature inviate oltre il termine non saranno prese in considerazione. Il processo di selezione sar√† effettuato ai sensi del vigente Regolamento per il reclutamento del personale. Valuteremo attentamente tutte le candidature ricevute e contatteremo i candidati maggiormente in linea con il nostro profilo ideale.


La ricerca √® rivolta a candidati ambosessi (L.903/77). Gruppo CAP ha l‚Äôobiettivo di abbattere ogni barriera e pregiudizio, offrendo un ambiente di lavoro accessibile, accogliente ed inclusivo in osservanza degli obblighi di legge. Il rispetto della diversit√† alimenta i valori del Gruppo. L‚Äôassunzione √® subordinata all‚Äôaccertamento dell‚Äôidoneit√† alla mansione da parte del medico competente ai sensi del D.Lgs. n. 81/08.

Title: Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Are you an Automotive fan and you have a passion for data analysis? Do you enjoy collecting and analyzing data to detect improvements, and in this way support dealers to reach growth opportunities? Would you like to be part of a renowned Automotive company, applying your professional skills and gain experience? Then we might be looking for you!

Purpose Of The Position

The main purpose of the Data Analyst is:


support the parts sales team and Parts Managers
collect, collate and analyse various internal and external composite data
identify and prioritise parts sales growth opportunities at National & Dealer levels.


Duties


Identification and collation of key data from both internal and external sources
Analysis of data, identifying key opportunities for parts sales growth at both National and Dealer levels.
Collect and provide market intelligence and analysis to assist formulation of current and future parts sales marketing strategy
Ongoing analysis and reporting from all programme channels and activities
Focus at all times to achieve nationally set KPI and ‚Ç¨‚Äôs growth objectives
Assist in the building of MSX programme tools, ensuring ongoing correct usage and fit for purpose
Direct communications link between programme activity and client management
Attend and contribute to regular programme meetings
Ensure effective communication and feedback with all parts (MSXI ‚Äì MSX Italy team ‚Äì BMW)
Ensure timely and accurate reporting as per programme requirements
Attend other meetings as required, providing results, feedback and market intelligence


Responsability

People:


Cooperate and collaborate (Team working and team building)
Training for new analyst (training on the job)
Inform the Sales Reps, Parts Manager, Project Coordinator and Project Manager about the critical situations


Finance: none

Asset & Tools

Take care of the company assets (usage in line with company policies, managing and maintenance)

Process


Correct and professional implementation of the project
Apply system management procedures
Propose project improvements (new implementation tools and activities, training material, etc.)


Customer


Provide a good level of job
Cooperate with BMW
Inform Parts Managers, Project Coordinator, PM and BMW on achievements or concerns within ongoing activities


Authorities: None

Knowledge, Skills And Competencies Required


Interpersonal skills
Initiative
Results orientation
Flexibility
Planning and organizing
High adaptability
Time Pressures & Changing priorities
Analytic approach
Team working ability
Proactive approach -
High level of literacy and numeracy -
High level of computer literacy, especially MS Excel and MS Access
Ability to design and deliver Microsoft Word and PowerPoint Presentations


Qualifications


Degree in engineering, economics, business administration or statistic.


Experience:


Previous experiences in the same role are appreciated.


Languages:


Italian native English fluent


Additional Information

MSX is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy or maternity. As users of the disability confident scheme, we guarantee to interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for the vacancy.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About Satispay

At Satispay, we're not just reimagining payments; we're pioneering a movement toward simplicity and accessibility. Picture yourself at the forefront of innovation, leading the way in revolutionizing payments - and beyond! - across Europe, alongside a vibrant community of like-minded individuals driven by a shared vision: simplifying payments to improve everyone‚Äôs life.

Are you ready to be part of something bigger? Satispay is the place for you! Come be part of our dynamic team and help us shape the future of payments in Europe.

üöÄ Join us as Senior Data Analyst and let's make magic happen together.

Role Overview

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will join the Growth Intelligence team and collaborate closely with stakeholders from the Product Marketing, CRM, Business Development, and Engineering teams to identify business needs and uncover analytics opportunities.

Your Mission


Deliver real impact. Bring concrete impact to the Growth team and business line through analysis and implementation of rigorous data-driven solutions.
Analyze and drive. Analyze and interpret large datasets to derive actionable insights and support decision-making processes.
Design and optimize experiments. Develop and manage A/B tests to optimize and guide product and processes enhancements.
Create and maintain descriptive outcomes. Track key metrics and assist in the creation of visual representations (dashboards, maps) to communicate analytical insights effectively.
Manage analytic solutions. Modernize, standardize, troubleshoot, and maintain existing analytic solutions to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Cooperate. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data into broader business strategies.
Stay current with industry trends. Continuously evolve the organization by adopting best-in-class technologies and techniques.
Enhance data-driven culture. Support decision-making and promote a data-driven culture through ad-hoc analyses and insights.


Your Ideal Profile


Proven experience and analytical skills. You have 5+ years of working experience in Business Intelligence or Data Analytics and can apply high-level analytical, statistical, and quantitative problem-solving skills to various scenarios. If you have a passion for working with data and a deep understanding of marketing campaigns, attribution, and web analytics, this is the perfect opportunity for you.
Expertise in programming. You possess advanced knowledge of SQL and query optimization, as well as extensive knowledge of Python or R. Additionally, you have experience with Looker, Tableau, or similar technologies.
Detail-oriented and communicative. You have a maniacal attention to detail and enjoy executing complex projects. You can communicate in a structured and convincing manner, adapting your style to build trust in a positive and professional way with various stakeholders.
Passion for fintech or startup environments. You are enthusiastic about working in dynamic, innovative settings.
Language proficiency. You are fluent in Italian and English.


Don't let a checklist hold you back - at Satispay, we thrive on diverse perspectives and unique strengths. Your individuality could be the missing piece to our puzzle! Even if you don't meet every skill listed above, we encourage you to apply if you're passionate about the role and believe you can contribute to our team's success.

Your Perks as a Satisperson

üôÜüèª Join an international team to grow with

üè° Hybrid working policy

üçΩÔ∏è Fuel your day with our meal vouchers

üåê Preply language platform access to expand your language skills

‚≠ê Benefit from our 1.2k company welfare budget

üöÄ Own part of Satispay‚Äôs success with our Stock Option Plan

üë©üèª‚Äçüíª Gear up with our tech equipment

ü•≥ Join us in the fun with team-building events, parties, trips, and more!

Our selection process is tailored to each role and includes at least a call with our Talent Acquisition Team, a remote technical evaluation, and a final in-person meeting. Your recruiter will share more insights during your first meeting with us!

Equal Opportunity Employer

At Satispay, we're proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and inclusion, welcoming individuals of all backgrounds. This opportunity is open to everyone, regardless - for instance - of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, and national origin. Join us in a workplace where everyone belongs!

Title: Data Analyst - Senior Specialist
Description:
Responsabilit√† della posizione:




All'interno della Direzione Consumer nell'area Customer Base Analytics ricerchiamo una figura di Data Analyst, che si occuper√† delle attivit√† di analisi dei comportamenti dei clienti per tipologia di profilo e di utilizzo dei prodotti Sky, al fine di identificare e valutare interventi volti a migliorare il trade-off tra valore ed esperienza del cliente.




Principali attivit√†




In particolare, si occuper√† di costruire, analizzare e arricchire costantemente la base dati per:

comprendere i gusti, i bisogni, i percorsi sui differenti touchpoint con Sky e i comportamenti di utilizzo dei prodotti Sky ;
segmentare la customer base al fine di individuare il potenziale di crescita del valore del cliente a seconda delle sue esigenze e del suo profilo,
identificare, attraverso l‚Äôanalisi quantitativa, eventuali inefficienze, fault di processo o aree di insoddisfazione del cliente
comprendere le reazioni dei clienti a specifici eventi e campagne (ad es. palinsesto, nuovi prodotti e servizi, comunicazioni, interventi tecnologici,‚Ä¶)
quindi, definire, proattivamente o a supporto delle altre strutture interne o esterne alla direzione, le opportune azioni di intervento
consuntivare, i risultati delle azioni messe in campo, sia in fase di test che a regime
infine, interpretare, sintetizzare ed esporre nel modo pi√π appropriato i risultati analitici




Requisiti




Eccellenti capacit√† di data analysis, processing e mining
buona conoscenza dei software R e/o Python
conoscenza di Tableau
ottime capacit√† di rappresentazione dei dati analizzati e di esposizione
ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese
appassionato di dati, ma con forte business acumen
orientato a prendere decisioni basate sui dati
capacit√† di comunicazione dei risultati analitici per finalit√† di business
capacit√† relazionali e di team building
energia e pro-attivit√†
