Title: Campus - Internship Programme - ICS - Digital Data Analyst Intern - 2025 (Milan)
Description:
You Lead the Way. We‚Äôve Got Your Back.

At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we‚Äôre supporting our customers‚Äô financial confidence to move are constantly redefining what‚Äôs possible ‚Äî and we‚Äôre proud to back each other every step of the way.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ¬†

American Express is one of the world‚Äôs leading payments companies and provides customers with access to products, insights and experiences that enrich lives and build businesses. Our ‚Äúclosed-loop‚Äù network includes card-issuing, merchant-acquiring and card network businesses. Around the world we provide financial products and services to a broad range of customers, including consumers and businesses of all sizes. Founded in 1850 and headquartered in New York, American Express has a heritage built on service and sustained by innovation.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ¬†

When you join‚ÄØ#TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse global community of over 60,000 colleagues. Your contributions to supporting, promoting and enhancing our brand will have a significant impact on how we continue to back our customers, communities and colleagues now and into the future.‚ÄØ¬†

You‚Äôll have the opportunity to develop a range of skills and networks, collaborate on challenging projects‚ÄØthat deliver value to our business and customers, learn about our award-winning culture and network across our diverse business units and regions. You‚Äôll become part of a collaborative and inclusive workplace as you build on your technical and interpersonal skills, hear from senior leadership through our Global Speaker Series, be responsible for your own live project, and learn first-hand how we deliver for our customers.‚ÄØ¬†

AMEX is seeking a Digital Data Analyst Intern in our Milan office. We are searching for a student interested in Digital Data, Media Data and Customer Journey analysis who would like to work alongside our Business Intelligence Team. This is a paid internship opportunity that will provide the intern with an excellent, hands-on introduction to a thriving, high-growth, entrepreneurial environment.¬†¬†

Key Projects:¬†

An intern will be offered an opportunity to be involved in meaningful work/projects, be exposed to daily team tasks such as data monitoring and visualization, internal reporting, alignment meetings and cross team/function appointments. The intern will be introduced to useful tools and resources that will help the intern grow both professionally and personally.¬†

He/She will be involved in projects that include supporting the Business Intelligence to reach a Data Driven strategy, analyze internal data to improve results and achieve the monthly targets, collaborate cross team for a constant support. The intern also can support the creation of new and innovative projects with the aim to expand the data knowledge.¬†

The intern will gain experience in the following areas:¬†

Identify and interpret digital data trends
Develop best practices in data collection and analysis
Analyze data to identify and recommended improvements to digital acquisition funnel
Monitor website performance
Execute insights & prepare reports for internal stakeholders in excel and PowerPoint;
Monitor digital metrics and KPIs ¬†

Skills & Experience Required:¬†

Current undergraduate or graduate students and recent college graduates are encouraged to apply (Digital Marketing/Business Management/Economics/Statistics)
Meticulous attention to detail and organizational skills
Digital mindset and good level of IT tools (e.g. MS Excel, PowerPoint)
Fluent spoken and written English¬†

Team working¬†

You‚Äôre able to proactively solve problems¬†

Self-starting, innovative thinker who can provide team with suggestions and recommendations for process improvement¬†

¬†

American Express is a global organization and as part of your application, please submit your CV in English, as this role requires candidates to demonstrate proficient English writing, reading, and oral communication skills.‚ÄØ

More information:‚ÄØ¬†

Location: Milan
Starting Date: Monday 16 June 2025‚ÄØ
Duration: 6 months internship + with potential 6 months renewal‚ÄØ
Hours: 35 hours per week‚ÄØ‚ÄØ¬†

We back our colleagues and their loved ones with benefits and programs that support their holistic well-being. That means we prioritize their physical, financial, and mental health through each stage of life. Benefits include:
Competitive base salaries¬†
Bonus incentives¬†
Support for financial-well-being and retirement¬†
Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability benefits (depending on location)¬†
Flexible working model with hybrid, onsite or virtual arrangements depending on role and business need¬†
Generous paid parental leave policies (depending on your location)¬†
Free access to global on-site wellness centers staffed with nurses and doctors (depending on location)¬†
Free and confidential counseling support through our Healthy Minds program¬†
Career development and training opportunities

Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Description:
Quality, innovation, sustainability, and strong brands make FrieslandCampina one of the world‚Äôs largest dairy companies. With more than 18,000 employees across over 100 countries, we are united by our purpose to nourish the world with high-quality, nutritious dairy products.

We are currently looking for an experienced Business Intelligence Specialist to join our team in Agrate. In this role, you will be a strategic partner to multiple departments, transforming data into actionable insights that drive value across the organization.

What We Ask

To excel in this role, you should have:


A Master‚Äôs degree in Applied Sciences, Economics, or Statistics.
Proven experience in a similar Business Intelligence or Data Analytics role.
Expert-level Excel skills for advanced data manipulation and analysis.
Proficiency in SQL and Python for querying, data wrangling, and automation.
Hands-on experience in designing and implementing data models.
Strong English communication skills, both written and spoken.
A proactive mindset, with attention to detail and a collaborative approach.



What We Offer


Competitive salary based on experience
Hybrid working model
Lunch Voucher
In-house training



Vacancy Description

As a Business Intelligence Specialist, you will:


Collect, prepare, and analyze quantitative and qualitative data from internal and external sources.
Translate complex datasets into clear, impactful dashboards and reports that support business decision-making.
Provide insights and recommendations to business partners across Sales, Marketing, Supply Chain, and Finance.
Maintain and develop BI tools (such as Power BI or Tableau) and ensure data quality and integrity across systems.
Monitor and assess new developments in BI and data analytics tooling to match evolving business needs.
Identify and drive process improvements by leveraging data trends and insights.
Collaborate cross-functionally to define KPIs and standardize reporting methodologies.



Staying true to who you really are, that is your starting point at FrieslandCampina. Because it is precisely by embracing our differences that we can grow together. We want to create a working environment that allows all employees to bring their best and authentic selves. If who we are suits you, but you're not sure if you're the best fit for the role, we still encourage you to apply so we can help you find the role that fits you best.

Team Details

At FrieslandCampina, we work together to produce healthy and sustainable food for people every day. Our consumers are central to what we do, not only as consumers but also as colleagues. We aim to reflect the diversity of our consumers in our personnel policy. The world is changing rapidly and becoming more complex. We are one of the largest dairy companies in the world, and our unique structure means our farmers are both suppliers and owners of the company. We excel at adding value to our milk, both commercially and in terms of nutritional value. We create an environment focused on equality, inclusion, and respect. Everyone is unique but equally important, regardless of our differences. We believe our differences make the difference and that an inclusive work environment leads to greater acceptance and growth. FrieslandCampina stands for equality and advocates for an inclusive and safe work environment for everyone, enabling them to bring out their best. We operate in highly competitive markets and must continue to innovate and take risks to remain relevant. Both we and our farmers believe in fair business practices with a long-term focus. For us, sustainability naturally follows from this approach.

Title: Data Analytics and Insights Analyst
Description:
DATA INSIGHTS and ANALYTICS ANALYST




PURPOSE OF THE JOB:




‚Ä¢ Support with data and insights, align inputs to the Segmented Execution use case (products OOS, overstock, key challenges/opportunities)

‚Ä¢ Support Data Analytics & AI Manager and colleagues on delivering updates and organizing communications to end users with involved stakeholders (mainly sales & TM)

‚Ä¢ Reporting and Data Visualization & Dashboarding for cases (PowerBI based reports)

‚Ä¢ Support data inventory and data managements processes (coordinating and archiving data mapping activities)

‚Ä¢ Get knowledge about and act as SME of data sources towards the organization (both corporate and local)




SKILLS & KNOWLEDGE:




‚Ä¢ Management of data sources

‚Ä¢ Strong analytical skills which will allow the generation of strong recommendations based on insights

‚Ä¢ Customer centric approach and knowledge of Company priorities.

‚Ä¢ Ability to use and communicate data

‚Ä¢ Relationship building - Strong ability to form effective working partnerships with all functions

‚Ä¢ IT and Advanced analytics literacy (PowerBI or equivalent)

‚Ä¢ Analytical mindset

‚Ä¢ Experience in analytics related departments

‚Ä¢ Excel power functions: Map/View/Pivot/Query

‚Ä¢ MS Office ‚Äì deep knowledge and experience




EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:




1) University degree, ideally business/economics related

2) Strong business acumen backed by a comfort in dealing with analysis and numbers.

3) Previous 2/3 years' experience in advanced analytics, business insights and project management considered as a plus




WHERE WILL YOU WORK




Sesto San Giovanni (MI)




DISCOVER WHO WE ARE




Coca-Cola HBC Italia, part of the Coca-Cola HBC Group, is the leading bottler and distributor of The Coca-Cola Company's branded products in Italy.




We employ around 2,000 people and operate through 6 facilities: 3 dedicated to the production of soft drinks located in Nogara, Oricola, and Marcianise, 2 mineral water bottling sites, Fonti del Vulture in Rionero in Vulture and Lurisia in Roccaforte Mondov√¨, and an innovative hub in Gaglianico dedicated to the production of recycled plastic (rPET) bottles for the bottling of the company's products.




Coca-Cola HBC Italia is on the market as a 24/7 Total Beverage Partner, this means that with our products we can cover all consumption occasions, from breakfast, to after dinner.




Customer first, We over I, Deliver Sustainable, Make It Simple: these are the values that define Coca-Cola HBC.




AT COCA-COLA HBC WE FOSTER DIVERSITY




At Coca-Cola HBC, we are an inclusive employer that thrives on diversity. This means our environment provides equal opportunities for all, regardless of race, color, religion, age, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. Join us in nurturing a culture where everyone belongs and contributes to our collective success.




Searches are open to male and female candidates (Law 903/77 and Law 125/91). Candidates are invited to read our privacy notice on our website: www.cocacolahellenic.it/Privacystatement/ in compliance with D. Lgs. 196/2003.

‚Ä¢ Get knowledge about and act as SME of data sources towards the organization (both corporate and local)


SKILLS & KNOWLEDGE:


‚Ä¢ Management of data sources

‚Ä¢ Strong analytical skills which will allow the generation of strong recommendations based on insights

‚Ä¢ Customer centric approach and knowledge of Company priorities.

‚Ä¢ Ability to use and communicate data

‚Ä¢ Relationship building - Strong ability to form effective working partnerships with all functions

‚Ä¢ IT and Advanced analytics literacy (PowerBI or equivalent)

‚Ä¢ Analytical mindset

‚Ä¢ Experience in analytics related departments

‚Ä¢ Excel power functions: Map/View/Pivot/Query

‚Ä¢ MS Office ‚Äì deep knowledge and experience


EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:


1) University degree, ideally business/economics related

2) Strong business acumen backed by a comfort in dealing with analysis and numbers.

3) Previous 2/3 years' experience in advanced analytics, business insights and project management considered as a plus


WHERE WILL YOU WORK


Sesto San Giovanni (MI)


DISCOVER WHO WE ARE


Coca-Cola HBC Italia, part of the Coca-Cola HBC Group, is the leading bottler and distributor of The Coca-Cola Company's branded products in Italy.


We employ around 2,000 people and operate through 6 facilities: 3 dedicated to the production of soft drinks located in Nogara, Oricola, and Marcianise, 2 mineral water bottling sites, Fonti del Vulture in Rionero in Vulture and Lurisia in Roccaforte Mondov√¨, and an innovative hub in Gaglianico dedicated to the production of recycled plastic (rPET) bottles for the bottling of the company's products.


Coca-Cola HBC Italia is on the market as a 24/7 Total Beverage Partner, this means that with our products we can cover all consumption occasions, from breakfast, to after dinner.


Customer first, We over I, Deliver Sustainable, Make It Simple: these are the values that define Coca-Cola HBC.


AT COCA-COLA HBC WE FOSTER DIVERSITY


At Coca-Cola HBC, we are an inclusive employer that thrives on diversity. This means our environment provides equal opportunities for all, regardless of race, color, religion, age, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. Join us in nurturing a culture where everyone belongs and contributes to our collective success.


Searches are open to male and female candidates (Law 903/77 and Law 125/91). Candidates are invited to read our privacy notice on our website: www.cocacolahellenic.it/Privacystatement/ in compliance with D. Lgs. 196/2003.

Title: Data Analyst | MILANO
Description:
Descrizione azienda

Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?

Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attivit√†, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa √® CPM, una realt√† internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunit√† di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un‚Äôesperienza che ti metter√† a contatto con i brand e le aziende pi√π importanti in Italia.

Candidati e‚Ä¶ magari ci vediamo a bordo!

Posizione

Ti offriamo di diventare il guru dei nostri dati.

Per te abbiamo una posizione come Data Analyst in un settore, il field marketing, dove la tua competenza pu√≤ davvero fare la differenza.

Potrai mettere in luce le tue capacit√† di analisi e interpretazione del dato al servizio di tanti brand diversi. Annoiarsi? Impossibile. Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Perch√© in CPM Italy siamo convinti che i tuoi risultati passino anche attraverso la qualit√† della tua vita.

Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?

Il tuo ruolo riguarda l‚Äôanalisi e la presentazione dei dati riguardanti la vendita, il posizionamento e la valutazione di campagne promo e di comunicazione in store dei brand delle nostre aziende clienti.

Come?


realizzando report su misura;
utilizzando indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);
sviluppando e gestendo un avanzato sistema di business intelligence e dashboard online;
collaborando con i colleghi del team.



Requisiti

Sei tu la persona giusta?

Per entrare nel nostro reparto di Data Analyst √® richiesta un‚Äôesperienza di almeno 1 anno in questo ruolo. Essere positivi, proattivi e precisi √® un ottimo requisito ma i veri must sono la passione per i numeri e la voglia di partecipare sempre a nuove sfide.

In pi√π √® fantastico se‚Ä¶


ti piace trasformare dati in informazioni;
Excel √® il tuo pane quotidiano;
hai una conoscenza base di PowerBI ed SQL;
ti entusiasma lavorare in team;
sei flessibile sia come orari che di mentalit√†;



Altre informazioni

Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999 n.68, Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Who We Are

At Heritage, we are dedicated to being at the forefront of the alternative investment industry by creating a next-generation fund that combines traditional investment sourcing and evaluation strategies with proprietary technology solutions and data-driven approaches.

Our mission is to connect elite families and entrepreneurs globally with carefully vetted top-performing private market opportunities, leveraging our digital products to make the alternative investment market more accessible, efficient, and connected. Furthermore, we embrace the principles of "skin in the game" as we co-invest with our partners, and "innovation" as we work to create lasting value through continually advancing the investment sector.

Our team comprises of a diverse international group of individuals from leading organisations and with diverse backgrounds, including private equity, venture capital, banking, software development, law, and entrepreneurship. We are committed to attracting top-notch talent and providing opportunities for growth and development based on their individual strengths and interests

Your role

About

Are you passionate about leveraging technology to drive financial innovation? We‚Äôre on the hunt for energetic individuals to provide exceptional operational support and insight, helping propel our team to new heights. During your time at Heritage, you will gain exposure to a wide range of activities at the intersection of finance and technology:


Be a data expert ‚Äì Use your analytical mindset to work with complex data sets. Analyze daily transactions and bank statements to build clear, compelling visualizations of client net worth‚Äîincluding both public and private assets.
Own the account aggregation tool ‚Äì Take full ownership of the tool, ensuring the database remains accurate and efficient. Continuously identify areas for improvement and lead innovation initiatives.
Leverage Bloomberg ‚Äì Use Bloomberg tools to conduct deep analysis of public securities and extract actionable insights.



Who We Are Looking For


A fast-paced, analytical, numerical thinker who thrives in a dynamic environment
Committed to excellence, with a proven track record of achieving results through data-driven decision-making
An exceptional problem-solver with strong analytical and critical thinking skills
Intellectually curious, constantly seeking new knowledge and skills in analytics and programming
Independent yet collaborative, ready to make a difference within our team
Ideally, you have experience working with Tableau, Power BI, Python or R
Fluency in English
Available for a 6-month internship starting in May 2025



What We Offer

A paid internship in the heart of Milan lasting six enriching months, will help shape you into a well-rounded professional. You will join an international team from 10+ nationalities whom you will interact with daily and at quarterly team-building events.

Join us for an experience that combines professional growth with a positive work environment. Your journey begins here!

Hiring Process

The Hiring Process At Heritage Includes The Following Stages


CV Screening
English and Critical Thinking Assessment
Cultural Fit Interview
Technical Interview
Logic & Attitude Assessment
Final Interview with the Department Manager
Offer



At Heritage, we are proud to have a diverse team representing over 15 nationalities, with all communication conducted in English. We are deeply committed to providing equal opportunities and work actively to remove potential biases in our hiring process by involving a Hiring Committee in all decision-making.

By applying to this job offer, you confirm that you have read and understood Heritage's privacy policy: http://bit.ly/privacypolicy121.
Show more

Title: Internship - Data Science
Description:
At ION

We want to innovate the financial services offered by commercial/retail banks in Italy in the areas of wealth management, credit lending, risk management and compliance. Building on our consolidated expertise and product offering in the Capital Markets domain, we want to scale our solutions and frameworks to the commercial/retail banking industry. To do so, we start from the quantitative modelling and analysis of the current processes put in place by our customers, so that we can profile opportunities of automation and prioritize client needs on manual/painful workflows. The resource will be involved in business process analyses of Italian commercial/retail financial institutions and is expected to integrate structured information extracted from interviews with the analysis of literature and documentation to build a quantitative picture of the AS-IS. The analysis will then be complemented with a consequent implementation analysis and product roadmap definition to design the TO-BE and drive product evolutions and developments. The project entails modelling complex business contexts, extracting structured information from unstructured sources, performing quantitative analyses, presenting findings and recommendations to external clients and internal stakeholders, contributing to the definition of product backlogs.

What You Will Learn During Your Intern


Quantitative modelling of business processes
Codification of customer requirements, needs, activities
Business intelligence with PowerBI/Excel - Packaging high-quality deliverables for external clients ‚Äì
Data manipulation with Pandas or Spark/Hive


What You Need To Know


Hands-on experience with BI tools (Excel, PowerBI)
Experience with Python data science libraries (pandas, pyspark, sklearn) is nice to have
Fluent English


We Are Looking For Someone Who


is passionate about modelling unknown business contexts with a quantitative approach
can find a good trade-off between quality and speed of delivery
proactively contribute your insights and ideas in a way that fits existing frameworks of the firm
is fond of sharing knowledge with colleagues and documenting your work
Show more

Title: Data Science Analyst
Description:
For the Central Team of Generali Global Corporate & Commercial (GC&C), we are looking for a Data Science Analyst to join our Insurance Department. Reporting to the Head of Technical Excellence, this position is key to leveraging data insights for comprehensive technical analysis, pricing strategies, and effective portfolio management. With a dynamic, cross-functional approach, the role includes demanding data integration across key domains such as Underwriting, Risk Engineering, and Claims, thereby contributing significantly to the company's strategic objectives. In addition, you will contribute to the development of the sustainability agenda of GC&C, working on carbon emission, green energy, and climate change initiatives.




Main responsibilities:




Portfolio Management

Supporting the analysis of the overall GC&C portfolio results, trends and patterns;
Designing and deploying the portfolio management discipline;
Implementing the portfolio monitoring tools;
Assisting BU in the target setting and supporting BU in achieving targets;
Performing data quality checks at all stages of portfolio management;
Preparation and steering of Portfolio review meetings;
Assisting UW functions in steering the business accordingly.

Innovation

Working collaboratively on pioneering new actuarial tools, integrating Machine Learning algorithms to enhance predictive capabilities;
Actively participate in defining business requirements to evolve the TechEx technology stack, in partnership with Operations;
Facilitate training sessions for the GC&C underwriting community on the TechEx tool suite, promoting skill enhancement and tool.

Sustainability and Net Zero Transition

Driving forward GC&C sustainability initiatives also in collaboration with Group Head Office;
Contributing to the development of a technical framework to embed Net Zero targets into GC&C underwriting strategy.




Requirements

The ideal candidate will meet the following requirements:




Studied Actuarial Science, Mathematics or Statistics or other quantitative disciplines, e.g. Engineering, Physics etc.
Quantitative, analytical mindset, problem solving skills
Insurance business processes knowledge experience is welcome
Ability to build lasting relationships
Strong communication and presentation skills
Familiarity with Python and R is valued
Must be fluent in Italian, English, additional languages are an advantage




Company Profile

Generali is a major player in the global insurance industry ‚Äì a strategic and highly important sector for the growth, development and welfare of modern societies.

Over almost 200 years, we have built a multinational group that is present in more than 50 countries, with 470 companies and nearly 82,000 employees. Our group aims to become the standard bearer and industry leader in the European retail insurance market, building on our existing base of 50 million retail clients, out of an overall total of 72 million.

Global Corporate & Commercial is the Generali Group unit developing P&C business and insurance services for medium and large companies. The unit acts on a global scale and deploys an integrated approach at Group level with a central management team and specialized teams active in individual countries. Through GC&C, Generali aims to become a key world player in the corporate-commercial segment.




Generali is proud to be an inclusive employer that considers applicants regardless of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, disability, religion, political views, marital status or philosophy of life.

If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation or assistance, we will support you during the selection process.

Title: Business & Data Analyst
HTML:
Dove lavorerai

Per la nostra sede di Milano cerchiamo candidati interessati ad un percorso professionale all'interno della Direzione Generation & Energy Management.

Su cosa lavorerai

La persona che stiamo cercando avr√† la responsabilit√† per le seguenti attivit√†:

  • analizzare i dati;
  • identificare inefficienze di processo;
  • proporre soluzioni e monitorare i progressi;
  • collaborazione con le altre aree di business nei progetti di sviluppo di modelli, strumenti e applicazioni volti al continuo miglioramento dei processi.

Cosa pu√≤ esserti utile per valutare se candidarti

  • Laurea in Informatica, Economia, Ingegneria materie STEM;
  • Perfetta conoscenza del pacchetto Office;
  • Gradita la conoscenza di strumenti di programmazione (R, Python, Qlik, ...);
  • Conoscenza dell‚Äôinglese;
  • Spirito di iniziativa;
  • Capacit√† di lavoro in team;
  • Ottime capacit√† relazionali.

La tua sede di lavoro

Lavorerai nel nostro HQs di Milano in Via A. Algardi 4 insieme al resto del tuo team di riferimento. Ci impegniamo a favorire il tuo work-life balance e quindi avrai la possibilit√†, se lo desideri, di lavorare anche in modalit√† ibrida organizzandoti con il tuo team.

Sorgenia

Nati nel 1999, siamo una Green Tech Energy Company e oggi il principale operatore energetico privato nazionale.

Scopri di pi√π su Sorgenia su www.sorgenia.it.

Cosa significa far parte di Sorgenia

Cerchiamo nuovi colleghi che, con spirito pionieristico e innovativo, siano pronti a gestire con proattivit√† e concretezza progetti sfidanti contribuendo alla continua crescita di Sorgenia.

In Sorgenia offriamo l‚Äôopportunit√† di imparare ogni giorno attraverso percorsi di formazione continua e eventi interni informali; siamo attenti al benessere delle nostre persone e per questo offriamo flessibilit√† oraria, smart working e una palestra aziendale se vuoi tenerti in forma.

Se vuoi scoprire cos‚Äôaltro offriamo in Sorgenia, candidati, non vediamo l‚Äôora di conoscerti!

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Description:
Quality, innovation, sustainability, and strong brands make FrieslandCampina one of the world‚Äôs largest dairy companies. With more than 18,000 employees across over 100 countries, we are united by our purpose to nourish the world with high-quality, nutritious dairy products.

We are currently looking for an experienced Business Intelligence Specialist to join our team in Agrate. In this role, you will be a strategic partner to multiple departments, transforming data into actionable insights that drive value across the organization.

What We Ask

To excel in this role, you should have:


A Master‚Äôs degree in Applied Sciences, Economics, or Statistics.
Proven experience in a similar Business Intelligence or Data Analytics role.
Expert-level Excel skills for advanced data manipulation and analysis.
Proficiency in SQL and Python for querying, data wrangling, and automation.
Hands-on experience in designing and implementing data models.
Strong English communication skills, both written and spoken.
A proactive mindset, with attention to detail and a collaborative approach.



What We Offer


Competitive salary based on experience
Hybrid working model
Lunch Voucher
In-house training



Vacancy Description

As a Business Intelligence Specialist, you will:


Collect, prepare, and analyze quantitative and qualitative data from internal and external sources.
Translate complex datasets into clear, impactful dashboards and reports that support business decision-making.
Provide insights and recommendations to business partners across Sales, Marketing, Supply Chain, and Finance.
Maintain and develop BI tools (such as Power BI or Tableau) and ensure data quality and integrity across systems.
Monitor and assess new developments in BI and data analytics tooling to match evolving business needs.
Identify and drive process improvements by leveraging data trends and insights.
Collaborate cross-functionally to define KPIs and standardize reporting methodologies.



Staying true to who you really are, that is your starting point at FrieslandCampina. Because it is precisely by embracing our differences that we can grow together. We want to create a working environment that allows all employees to bring their best and authentic selves. If who we are suits you, but you're not sure if you're the best fit for the role, we still encourage you to apply so we can help you find the role that fits you best.

Team Details

At FrieslandCampina, we work together to produce healthy and sustainable food for people every day. Our consumers are central to what we do, not only as consumers but also as colleagues. We aim to reflect the diversity of our consumers in our personnel policy. The world is changing rapidly and becoming more complex. We are one of the largest dairy companies in the world, and our unique structure means our farmers are both suppliers and owners of the company. We excel at adding value to our milk, both commercially and in terms of nutritional value. We create an environment focused on equality, inclusion, and respect. Everyone is unique but equally important, regardless of our differences. We believe our differences make the difference and that an inclusive work environment leads to greater acceptance and growth. FrieslandCampina stands for equality and advocates for an inclusive and safe work environment for everyone, enabling them to bring out their best. We operate in highly competitive markets and must continue to innovate and take risks to remain relevant. Both we and our farmers believe in fair business practices with a long-term focus. For us, sustainability naturally follows from this approach.
Show more
HTML:
Quality, innovation, sustainability, and strong brands make FrieslandCampina one of the world‚Äôs largest dairy companies. With more than 18,000 employees across over 100 countries, we are united by our purpose to nourish the world with high-quality, nutritious dairy products.

We are currently looking for an experienced Business Intelligence Specialist to join our team in Agrate. In this role, you will be a strategic partner to multiple departments, transforming data into actionable insights that drive value across the organization.

What We Ask

To excel in this role, you should have:

  • A Master‚Äôs degree in Applied Sciences, Economics, or Statistics.
  • Proven experience in a similar Business Intelligence or Data Analytics role.
  • Expert-level Excel skills for advanced data manipulation and analysis.
  • Proficiency in SQL and Python for querying, data wrangling, and automation.
  • Hands-on experience in designing and implementing data models.
  • Strong English communication skills, both written and spoken.
  • A proactive mindset, with attention to detail and a collaborative approach.


What We Offer

  • Competitive salary based on experience
  • Hybrid working model
  • Lunch Voucher
  • In-house training


Vacancy Description

As a Business Intelligence Specialist, you will:

  • Collect, prepare, and analyze quantitative and qualitative data from internal and external sources.
  • Translate complex datasets into clear, impactful dashboards and reports that support business decision-making.
  • Provide insights and recommendations to business partners across Sales, Marketing, Supply Chain, and Finance.
  • Maintain and develop BI tools (such as Power BI or Tableau) and ensure data quality and integrity across systems.
  • Monitor and assess new developments in BI and data analytics tooling to match evolving business needs.
  • Identify and drive process improvements by leveraging data trends and insights.
  • Collaborate cross-functionally to define KPIs and standardize reporting methodologies.


Staying true to who you really are, that is your starting point at FrieslandCampina. Because it is precisely by embracing our differences that we can grow together. We want to create a working environment that allows all employees to bring their best and authentic selves. If who we are suits you, but you're not sure if you're the best fit for the role, we still encourage you to apply so we can help you find the role that fits you best.

Team Details

At FrieslandCampina, we work together to produce healthy and sustainable food for people every day. Our consumers are central to what we do, not only as consumers but also as colleagues. We aim to reflect the diversity of our consumers in our personnel policy. The world is changing rapidly and becoming more complex. We are one of the largest dairy companies in the world, and our unique structure means our farmers are both suppliers and owners of the company. We excel at adding value to our milk, both commercially and in terms of nutritional value. We create an environment focused on equality, inclusion, and respect. Everyone is unique but equally important, regardless of our differences. We believe our differences make the difference and that an inclusive work environment leads to greater acceptance and growth. FrieslandCampina stands for equality and advocates for an inclusive and safe work environment for everyone, enabling them to bring out their best. We operate in highly competitive markets and must continue to innovate and take risks to remain relevant. Both we and our farmers believe in fair business practices with a long-term focus. For us, sustainability naturally follows from this approach.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Founded in 1913 in Italy, the Prada Group was built on a tradition of excellence and with a vision of innovation. Our Iconic Brands include PRADA, Miu Miu, Church's, Car Shoe and Pasticceria Marchesi and we are currently operating in more than 45 Countries, embracing employees of more than 100 nationalities.

Joining our Company means working in a creative and international environment, with teams of people motivated by curiosity and the quest for excellence. The engine of our success is the importance and value that we place on the talent and passion of our people leading to their own professional growth.

Job Purpose

We are seeking an experienced and results-driven Marketing Data Analyst to join our Marketing Insights team. As a Data Analyst, will play a crucial role in analyzing and interpreting data to provide actionable insights that drive strategic decision-making within our marketing department. The successful candidate will have a strong analytical mindset, the ability to translate complex data into meaningful recommendations, and a deep understanding of the luxury fashion industry.

Responsibilities


Analyze marketing performance data from various channels, including digital, social media, email, and traditional marketing efforts.
Interpret key performance indicators (KPIs) to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement.
Develop and produce comprehensive reports on marketing campaign performance, audience engagement, and ROI.
Design A/B testing strategies to optimize marketing campaigns and improve overall performance.
Provide recommendations for adjustments based on testing outcomes
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including marketing, sales, and product development, to align insights with overall business objectives.
Identify and recommend effective communication and marketing channels to reach target audience segments.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in marketing strategy and communication channels.
Collaborate with internal teams, external agencies, and vendors to ensure the successful execution of marketing initiatives.
Prepare reports and presentations to communicate campaign results, insights, and recommendations to key stakeholders.


Knowledge And Skills

Master's degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics or a related field.

Proven work experience as a Marketing Measurement Specialist or in a similar marketing role.

Strong knowledge of various communication and marketing channels, including digital advertising, social media, email marketing, content marketing, events and traditional media.

Experience in projects like Marketing Attribution models.

Solid understanding of market research methodologies and data analysis techniques.

Familiarity with DMP (Data Management Platform) and CDP (Customer Data Platform) concepts and implementation.

Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and strategic thinking skills.

Knowledge of programming languages for data analysis (Python, R, SQL, ecc..)

Strong project management and organizational abilities, with the ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.

Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex ideas clearly and effectively.

Collaborative mindset with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.

Creative and innovative mindset, with a passion for staying ahead of marketing trends and technologies.

Fluency in written and spoken English
Show more

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a Marketing Data Analyst to join our Marketing team in Milan and play a key strategic role in data interpretation and advanced analytics.

This role will work at the intersection of Marketing and Tech, with the mission to ensure data accuracy, unlock actionable insights, and support data-driven decision making across channels, brand partners and ventures.

As a key analytical partner, you will manage tracking systems, improve the quality of data flows, and collaborate on advanced analysis, modeling, and visualization to optimize marketing performance and strategic outcomes.

What you'll do:

Ensure the quality, consistency, and reliability of all collected data, and guarantee they‚Äôre correctly visualized across platforms (GA4, dashboards, BI tools) and ready for reporting needs.
Monitor tracking anomalies on GA4, escalate technical issues to the Tech team, and support their resolution.
Configure and maintain custom GA4 reports to analyze website performance and user interactions (e.g., scrolls, videos, wishlists, product rankings) and extract strategic insights.
Partner with Brand Marketing and Channels teams to set up advanced analysis frameworks and test alternative attribution models.
Research, propose, and contribute to the implementation of predictive models, including customer segmentation and behaviours, using machine learning and statistical algorithms.
Collaborate with Tech team to develop and manage customized dashboards, integrating GA4 events and performance metrics, to deliver deep insights into user journeys and conversion funnels.
Encourage data literacy through regular training sessions and process documentation/standardization.

What we're looking for:

3+ years of experience in data analysis, preferably in a marketing, e-commerce, or digital environment.
Educational background in Data Science, Economics, Data analysis, or related fields.
Strong command of GA4 and digital analytics tools; experience with BigQuery and Google Tag Manager is a plus.
Familiarity with data visualization and BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Looker Studio, Tableau).
Solid understanding of marketing performance metrics, attribution models, and user behavior analytics.
Proactive mindset, attention to detail, and the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders.
Experience with predictive modeling, statistical methods, and machine learning techniques is highly valued.
Proficiency in Italian and English.

What we offer:

Benefits: monthly lunch tickets, company laptop, discounts to our owned brands and brand partners, and additional perks in the form of local discounts and offers.
Learning & Development Programs: continuous learning experience with TLG University and The Breakfast Club projects.
Be part of the young (31 on avg.) and international (30 nationalities) #TLGpeople group and work in a dynamic and fast-moving environment.

Title: Coverage & Data Analysis Engineer
Description:
CHI SIAMO

Il 31 Dicembre 2024 Swisscom, per il tramite della propria controllata Fastweb, ha finalizzato l'acquisizione di Vodafone Italia in vista di una integrazione delle due aziende.

Fastweb e Vodafone Italia da oggi lavoreranno insieme per creare un operatore convergente leader del mercato mettendo il meglio delle rispettive reti fisse e mobili e delle proprie competenze e capacit√† per offrire alle famiglie, alle aziende e al Paese servizi innovativi e a prezzi competitivi per continuare a promuovere la trasformazione in chiave digitale dell‚ÄôItalia.

Cosa troverai in Fastweb + Vodafone?

WE FEEL CLOSE #belonging

Insieme lavoriamo ogni giorno per creare un ambiente di lavoro informale e accogliente, in cui ogni persona possa portare il proprio contributo. Mostriamo apertura e curiosit√† nello sperimentare nuove soluzioni per noi e per i nostri clienti in un clima orientato alla collaborazione e al rispetto.

WE ARE SMART #flexibility

Smart working, autonomia nella gestione delle attivit√† e lavoro per obiettivi. Mettiamo le relazioni e i risultati al centro e promuoviamo una cultura di empowerment e collaborazione puntando su fiducia e responsabilit√†.

WE LEARN #impact

In Fastweb + Vodafone possiamo coltivare il nostro talento. Ciascuna persona √® alla guida del proprio sviluppo grazie a programmi innovativi e a percorsi professionalizzanti per costruire la propria crescita.

WE FEEL GOOD #wellbeing

In Fastweb + Vodafone le persone sono la nostra priorit√†. C‚Äô√® una grande attenzione al benessere fisico e psicologico e al mantenimento di un sano work life balance, oltre alla disponibilit√† di tanti servizi utili, gratuiti e innovativi per semplificare la quotidianit√† e coltivare passioni e interessi.

WE ARE UNIQUE #inclusion

In Fastweb + Vodafone l‚Äôinclusione √® una scelta, che rende l‚Äôambiente positivo, dinamico e ricco di stimoli. Facciamo tesoro delle differenze perch√© caratterizzano noi, la nostra clientela e il mondo che ci circonda: dall‚Äôincontro delle nostre unicit√† nascono creativit√†, innovazione e crescita continua.

WE ARE SUSTAINABLE #sustainability

In Fastweb + Vodafone l‚Äôattenzione verso un futuro pi√π sostenibile √® un impegno quotidiano.

Contribuiamo in modo concreto e misurabile al raggiungimento degli obiettivi globali, al benessere del pianeta e della societ√†. Integriamo la sostenibilit√† nelle nostre attivit√† di business, utilizzando energia elettrica proveniente al 100% da fonti rinnovabili e abilitando attraverso le nostre tecnologie la trasformazione ecologica e il superamento del digital divide.

WE CARE #customer

La nostra missione √® conquistare nel quotidiano la fiducia e la credibilit√† dei nostri clienti, garantendo esperienze di valore. Il nostro impegno consiste nel realizzare servizi sempre migliori, con l'obiettivo di offrire ai clienti soluzioni che rispondano alle loro esigenze e contribuiscano a costruire un futuro migliore.

CHI STIAMO CERCANDO ?

In Fastweb+Vodafone stiamo cercando un profilo di Coverage & Data Analysis Engineer per il Team Technology.

Il tuo obiettivo √® fornire analisi e proposte volte a garantire la migliore copertura tecnologica possibile, l'ottimizzazione delle risorse tecnologiche, l'efficienza degli investimenti necessari. Supporterai la valutazione e lo sviluppo di progetti strategici aziendali e di business (B2C,B2B, Wholesale).

In un ambiente dinamico puoi metterti alla prova e incrementare le tue competenze tecniche, collaborare con diversi team aziendali e contribuire direttamente alla crescita e all'innovazione dell'azienda.

DESCRIZIONE DEL RUOLO

In qualit√† di Coverage & Data Analysis Engineer nel Team Technology le tue attivit√† e responsabilit√† saranno le seguenti:


Analizzare la disponibilit√† delle diverse tecnologie di accesso sul territorio nazionale
Pianificare e gestire le risorse della rete di accesso in relazione alla copertura e al budget per progetti a medio e lungo termine
Supportare e proporre progetti strategici di deployment di rete in accordo con i vari dipartimenti aziendali
Fornire analisi e viste a supporto dei piani di capacity e decommissioning di rete
Creare reportistiche e dashboard relative a copertura, pianificazione ampliamenti e aperture di rete
Supportare la messa in campo dei servizi di copertura sui tool di produzione


REQUISITI ESSENZIALI


Laurea in discipline STEM preferibilmente ingegneria TLC, gestionale, informatica
Esperienza in ambito Data Analisys e Telecomunicazioni
Conoscenza di tool di data visualization (es. Tableau e/o Power Bi e/o Qlik Sense)
Ottima conoscenza del pacchetto office (Power Point, Excel)
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese
Eccellenti capacit√† analitiche e di sintesi
Forte orientamento al risultato
Proattivit√† e autonomia


ALTRE INFORMAZIONI

SEDE DI LAVORO E INQUADRAMENTO

Milano modalit√† ibrida

Full Time

Tempo Indeterminato

Siamo un luogo di lavoro inclusivo ed attento a garantire pari opportunit√† senza distinzione di genere, identit√† di genere, orientamento sessuale, etnia, et√†, religione e disabilit√†.

Title: DATA CONTRACT MANAGEMENT - ANALYST
Description:
Chi cerchiamo

Per la nostra sede di Milano siamo alla ricerca di una risorsa da inserire come DATA CONTRACT MANAGEMENT ‚Äì ANALYST¬†all‚Äôinterno del team ‚ÄúData Quality‚Äù. La struttura ha la principale responsabilit√† di attuare e gestire i processi di data quality e remediation dei domini dati che gli vengono affidati, nonch√© di gestire i contratti di approvvigionamento di dati a servizio delle strutture di business.¬†

Per quale Business Unit

L‚Äôattivit√† della Business Unit Generazione e Trading √® relativa alla gestione del portafoglio impianti di generazione del Gruppo con il duplice scopo di massimizzare la disponibilit√† e l‚Äôefficienza degli impianti, minimizzando i costi di esercizio e manutenzione (O&M) e di massimizzare il profitto derivante dalla gestione del portafoglio energetico attraverso l‚Äôattivit√† di compravendita di energia elettrica, di combustibili (gassosi e non gassosi) e di titoli ambientali sui mercati all‚Äôingrosso nazionali ed esteri. Rientra nell‚Äôambito della Business Unit anche l‚Äôattivit√† di trading sui mercati nazionali ed esteri di tutte le commodity energetiche (gas, energia elettrica, titoli ambientali).

Ti occuperai di


Gestire il processo di apertura e monitoraggio delle Richieste di Acquisto per servizi di fornitura dati e servizi
Interfacciarsi con il Business per la raccolta delle esigenze e degli input necessari
Relazionarsi con i Fornitori per la richiesta e negoziazione delle offerte economiche e per la gestione degli aspetti contrattuali
Predisporre la documentazione necessaria per l‚Äôinserimento delle richieste sui portali aziendali
Collaborare con gli Uffici coinvolti nel processo di acquisto per l‚Äôavvio e la finalizzazione dei contratti, coinvolgendo il team Legal in caso di negoziazioni contrattuali
Gestire l‚Äôapprovazione periodica delle fatture¬†
Gestire le attivit√† di budgeting e di consuntivazione
Supportare le attivit√† di Data Quality e Data Remediation


Sei la persona giusta se ti riconosci in questo profilo


Laurea (anche triennale) in Economia, Ingegneria Gestionale o discipline affini
Buona conoscenza del pacchetto Microsoft Office, in particolare di Excel
Una precedente esperienza in ambiti affini sar√† considerata requisito preferenziale
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese
Ottime capacit√† organizzative, attenzione al dettaglio e orientamento al risultato
Buone doti comunicative e capacit√† di interfacciarsi con interlocutori eterogenei
Attitudine al problem solving e capacit√† di lavorare in autonomia e in team


Che cosa offriamo


Flessibilit√†:¬†settimana lavorativa con venerd√¨ a orario ridotto, flessibilit√† negli orari di entrata/uscita e pausa pranzo; Smartworking sino al 60% dell‚Äôorario di lavoro su base bimestrale
Buoni pasto elettronici
Salute e benessere: assistenza sanitaria integrativa,¬†supporto psicologico attraverso counseling, webinar dedicati al benessere psicofisico e vaccino antinfluenzale
Famiglia: A2A Life Caring, iniziativa a supporto della genitorialit√† attraverso un mese aggiuntivo retribuito al 100% per maternit√†/paternit√†, rimborsi spese per figli, convenzioni con asili nido, team coaching per neogenitori; spazio caregiver,¬†offriamo webinar e uno spazio di ascolto dedicati a chi si prende cura di persone fragili o non autosufficienti
Formazione e sviluppo: programma di induction dedicato ai nuovi assunti,¬†gestione dei talenti, corsi di formazione e possibilit√† di crescita interna e job rotation tramite candidatura interna
Risparmio e tempo libero: oltre 300 convenzioni, tra cui trasporti pubblici, attivit√† sportive, viaggi, eventi culturali, e offerte speciali per luce e gas. Opzioni per il car sharing e la conversione del premio di risultato in benefit di welfare

HTML:
Chi cerchiamo

Per la nostra sede di Milano siamo alla ricerca di una risorsa da inserire come DATA CONTRACT MANAGEMENT ‚Äì ANALYST all‚Äôinterno del team ‚ÄúData Quality‚Äù. La struttura ha la principale responsabilit√† di attuare e gestire i processi di data quality e remediation dei domini dati che gli vengono affidati, nonch√© di gestire i contratti di approvvigionamento di dati a servizio delle strutture di business. 

Per quale Business Unit

L‚Äôattivit√† della Business Unit Generazione e Trading √® relativa alla gestione del portafoglio impianti di generazione del Gruppo con il duplice scopo di massimizzare la disponibilit√† e l‚Äôefficienza degli impianti, minimizzando i costi di esercizio e manutenzione (O&M) e di massimizzare il profitto derivante dalla gestione del portafoglio energetico attraverso l‚Äôattivit√† di compravendita di energia elettrica, di combustibili (gassosi e non gassosi) e di titoli ambientali sui mercati all‚Äôingrosso nazionali ed esteri. Rientra nell‚Äôambito della Business Unit anche l‚Äôattivit√† di trading sui mercati nazionali ed esteri di tutte le commodity energetiche (gas, energia elettrica, titoli ambientali).

Ti occuperai di
  • Gestire il processo di apertura e monitoraggio delle Richieste di Acquisto per servizi di fornitura dati e servizi
  • Interfacciarsi con il Business per la raccolta delle esigenze e degli input necessari
  • Relazionarsi con i Fornitori per la richiesta e negoziazione delle offerte economiche e per la gestione degli aspetti contrattuali
  • Predisporre la documentazione necessaria per l‚Äôinserimento delle richieste sui portali aziendali
  • Collaborare con gli Uffici coinvolti nel processo di acquisto per l‚Äôavvio e la finalizzazione dei contratti, coinvolgendo il team Legal in caso di negoziazioni contrattuali
  • Gestire l‚Äôapprovazione periodica delle fatture 
  • Gestire le attivit√† di budgeting e di consuntivazione
  • Supportare le attivit√† di Data Quality e Data Remediation


Sei la persona giusta se ti riconosci in questo profilo
  • Laurea (anche triennale) in Economia, Ingegneria Gestionale o discipline affini
  • Buona conoscenza del pacchetto Microsoft Office, in particolare di Excel
  • Una precedente esperienza in ambiti affini sar√† considerata requisito preferenziale
  • Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese
  • Ottime capacit√† organizzative, attenzione al dettaglio e orientamento al risultato
  • Buone doti comunicative e capacit√† di interfacciarsi con interlocutori eterogenei
  • Attitudine al problem solving e capacit√† di lavorare in autonomia e in team


Che cosa offriamo
  • Flessibilit√†: settimana lavorativa con venerd√¨ a orario ridotto, flessibilit√† negli orari di entrata/uscita e pausa pranzo; Smartworking sino al 60% dell‚Äôorario di lavoro su base bimestrale
  • Buoni pasto elettronici
  • Salute e benessere: assistenza sanitaria integrativa, supporto psicologico attraverso counseling, webinar dedicati al benessere psicofisico e vaccino antinfluenzale
  • Famiglia: A2A Life Caring, iniziativa a supporto della genitorialit√† attraverso un mese aggiuntivo retribuito al 100% per maternit√†/paternit√†, rimborsi spese per figli, convenzioni con asili nido, team coaching per neogenitori; spazio caregiver, offriamo webinar e uno spazio di ascolto dedicati a chi si prende cura di persone fragili o non autosufficienti
  • Formazione e sviluppo: programma di induction dedicato ai nuovi assunti, gestione dei talenti, corsi di formazione e possibilit√† di crescita interna e job rotation tramite candidatura interna
  • Risparmio e tempo libero: oltre 300 convenzioni, tra cui trasporti pubblici, attivit√† sportive, viaggi, eventi culturali, e offerte speciali per luce e gas. Opzioni per il car sharing e la conversione del premio di risultato in benefit di welfare
  • Ambiente di lavoro: promuoviamo una cultura che valorizza la diversit√†, l‚Äôequit√† e l'inclusione (DE&I); potrai inoltre avere la possibilit√† di unirti a un team dedicato allo sviluppo di iniziative e progetti su queste tematiche. Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and Italian.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Italy.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Italy for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







Apply Online Today!

Title: BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE DATA ANALYST
Description:
The successful candidate will join the Business Intelligence team in the data analyst role with the following responsibilities:


Requirements collection from business users and analysis of necessary information to be integrated into the DWH
Evolution of DWH data model in accordance with Group guidelines
ETL procedure management and development with azure data factory tool
Monitoring of data quality for appropriate use in business reporting
Setting and monitoring business KPIs to improve business performance
Develop reports and dashboards with Business Intelligence tools
Support users to perform analysis on DWH data and functional support for data navigation


Key Requirements/Skills/Experience


Proven experience (e.g. 2-3 years) as a Data Analyst or Data Engineer
University degree in scientific-technological studies
Strong Experience with cloud based infrastructures, Microsoft Azure platform will be preferred.
Knowledge of scripting languages, such as Python, R.
Strong knowledge of and experience with databases (SQL language and MS SQL Server)
Experience in design, implementation, maintenance of ETL pipelines in cloud environments to collect data from different sources
Strong knowledge of and experience of Azure Data Factory
Knowledge and experience of messaging system (Kafka)
Experience in data manipulation and Business Intelligence tools , Power BI will be preferred
Knowledge and experience of Azure Databricks
Communication and Interpersonal Skills
Analytical and problem-solving skills
Accuracy and attention to detail
Fluent in Italian and English
Work Experience in the insurance industry will be preferred


Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us.

We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in.

We therefore welcome applications regardless of race, ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation, or any other characteristics protected under applicable local laws and regulations.

Join us. Let's care for tomorrow.

Both genders may apply in accordance with the L. 903/77 (s.m.i).

Title: Data Scientist Analyst
Description:
Company Description.

Moviri started as a research spinoff at Politecnico of Milan and was incubated at its startup accelerator.

Data and experimentation are part of our DNA: it is for this reason that we continuously focus on research, emerging ideas, and new technologies, routinely partnering with top academic and engineering research institutions.

Moviri Consulting is the first company of Moviri and its foundation. Moviri‚Äôs professionals use data, software, and insights to solve substantial business challenges for Fortune 500 corporations, multinational banks, global media conglomerates and some of the most respected brands in a variety of industries. The Moviri Consulting Performance Engineering team optimizes performance of IT systems to make them responsive, infinitely scalable, reliable, resilient and cost-effective.




Job Description.

As a Junior Data Scientist in the Moviri Consulting Analytics team, you will be involved in a project related to:

Have the ability to work autonomously, solve complex data science problems, design and code scalable, maintainable solutions.
Leverage machine learning and statistical methods to develop, train, optimize, and evaluate models in the areas of Advanced Analytics, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, and Generative AI.
Own the process of data collection, extraction, and aggregation from various sources using main Big Data paradigms, ensuring data is properly formatted, synthesized, and validated for accuracy.
Deploy AI models and systems into production environments, ensuring smooth integration with existing infrastructures and workflows.
Enhance algorithms and models for optimal performance, efficiency, and reliability in real-world applications.




Full-time position at the Milan Office on Hybrid Mode.




Qualifications:

If you share our passion for consulting in the Data & AI field and possess the following characteristics, we are waiting for you:

Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Engineering, Physics or STEM related field;
Experience on software development and programming (e.g., Python, C++, Java, R); experience on Data Science libraries (Pandas, Scikit Learn, Keras, TensorFlow, Matplotlib, fastAPI);
Familiarity with GIT, AGILE methodology, and Continuous Integration and Delivery;
Familiarity with data management and related languages/tools, database programming in SQL and NoSQL;
Familiarity with Cloud Platforms (e.g. AWS, GCP, or Azure) and Big Data Domains (e.g. Hadoop, Spark);
Familiarity with Cloud Orchestration tools to automate deployment, scaling, and management of containers (e. g. Kubernetes) and containerization technologies (e. g. Docker);
Passionate about development of Machine Learning models (e.g. Time Series Analysis, Clustering, Classification, Anomaly Detection), Computer Vision, NLP, and Generative AI.




Compensation & Benefits

Make a Real Impact joining Moviri: we're on the lookout for dynamic individuals who want to be a driving force in their field, making a significant difference from day one.
Flexibility and Trust: from the moment you step in, you're not just an employee, but you're part of the team of talented colleagues. Moviri value freedom and responsibility, giving you the autonomy to excel and contribute your best in Hybrid mode
Competitive Salary and Company Welfare: Your hard work deserves recognition! Enjoy a competitive salary that reflects your skills and dedication. As a part of our team, you'll also receive a company welfare package of ‚Ç¨600, useful for fuel, bills, as well as wellness and well-being!
Sustainability: in our office, you will always have access to fresh fruit thanks to Cortilia. In Moviri, we are committed to connecting conscious customers with local products and producers, all while prioritizing environmental and social responsibility.
Tech Your Way: choose your weapon in the tech battle! Whether you're team Mac or team Windows, we believe in equipping you with the tools that spark joy. After all, the only thing better than coding your next big idea is doing it on a laptop that suits your style!




Join our team

We cannot realize any of our ambitions or achieve any of our goals without the right talent. If this sounds like you, please apply now. It may be the start of your next chapter!

Title: Team Lead Data Analytics
Description:
About Satispay

At Satispay, we're not just reimagining payments; we're pioneering a movement toward simplicity and accessibility. Picture yourself at the forefront of innovation, leading the way in revolutionizing payments - and beyond! - across Europe, alongside a vibrant community of like-minded individuals driven by a shared vision: simplifying payments to improve everyone‚Äôs life.

Are you ready to be part of something bigger? Satispay is the place for you! Come be part of our dynamic team and help us shape the future of payments in Europe.

üöÄ Join us as a Team Lead Data Analytics and let's make magic happen together.

Role Overview

As a Team Lead Data Analytics, you will join the Growth Intelligence team and collaborate closely with stakeholders from the Product Marketing, CRM, Business Development and Engineering teams to identify business needs and uncover analytics opportunities.

Your Mission


Coordinate and lead. Manage a team of 4+ skilled data analysts, coordinating their work to ensure alignment with business goals and maximizing the value they bring to the company.
Deliver real impact. Bring concrete impact to the Growth team and business line through analysis and implementation of rigorous data-driven solutions. Analytics, revenue forecasting, budgeting, customer insights will be part of the main projects you will manage using data solutions.
Manage analytic solutions. Modernize, standardize, troubleshoot, and maintain existing analytic solutions to ensure accuracy and reliability. Create and maintain descriptive outcomes. Track key metrics and coordinate the creation of visual representations (dashboards, maps) to communicate analytical insights effectively.
Partner with data engineering. Work closely with data engineers to define and improve Satispay‚Äôs data structure, pipelines, and visualization layers, ensuring that analytics can scale and support business decisions effectively.
Stay current with industry trends. Continuously evolve the organization by adopting best-in-class technologies and techniques.
Enhance data-driven culture. Support decision-making and promote a data-driven culture through ad-hoc analyses and insights.


Your Ideal Profile


Proven experience and analytical skills. You have 5+ years of working experience in Business Intelligence or Data Analytics and can apply high-level analytical, statistical, and quantitative problem-solving skills to various scenarios.
Team leadership. You have at least 1+ years of experience in a leadership role, with a demonstrated ability to guide, motivate, and grow a team of analysts.
Expertise in programming. You possess advanced knowledge of SQL and query optimization, as well as extensive knowledge of Python or R. Additionally, you have experience with Looker, Tableau, or similar technologies.
Detail-oriented and communicative. You have a maniacal attention to detail and enjoy executing complex projects. You can communicate in a structured and convincing manner, adapting your style to build trust in a positive and professional way with various stakeholders.
Passion for fintech or startup environments. You are enthusiastic about working in dynamic, innovative settings.
Language proficiency. You are fluent in Italian and English.


Don't let a checklist hold you back - at Satispay, we thrive on diverse perspectives and unique strengths. Your individuality could be the missing piece to our puzzle! Even if you don't meet every skill listed above, we encourage you to apply if you're passionate about the role and believe you can contribute to our team's success.

Your Perks as a Satisperson

üôÜüèª Join an international team to grow with

üè° Hybrid working policy

üçΩÔ∏è Fuel your day with our meal vouchers

üåê Preply language platform access to expand your language skills

‚≠ê Benefit from our 1.2k company welfare budget

üöÄ Own part of Satispay‚Äôs success with our Stock Option Plan

üë©üèª‚Äçüíª Gear up with our tech equipment

ü•≥ Join us in the fun with team-building events, parties, trips, and more!

Our selection process is tailored to each role and includes at least a call with our Talent Acquisition Team, a remote technical evaluation, and a final in-person meeting. Your recruiter will share more insights during your first meeting with us!

Equal Opportunity Employer

At Satispay, we're proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and inclusion, welcoming individuals of all backgrounds. This opportunity is open to everyone, regardless - for instance - of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, and national origin. Join us in a workplace where everyone belongs!

Learn More About Us

Curious about our core values? Explore them here.

  • Detail-oriented and communicative. You have a maniacal attention to detail and enjoy executing complex projects. You can communicate in a structured and convincing manner, adapting your style to build trust in a positive and professional way with various stakeholders.
  • Passion for fintech or startup environments. You are enthusiastic about working in dynamic, innovative settings.
  • Language proficiency. You are fluent in Italian and English.

Don't let a checklist hold you back - at Satispay, we thrive on diverse perspectives and unique strengths. Your individuality could be the missing piece to our puzzle! Even if you don't meet every skill listed above, we encourage you to apply if you're passionate about the role and believe you can contribute to our team's success.

Your Perks as a Satisperson

Title: EMEA Marketing Operations Specialist and Data Analyst
Description:
We are Lenovo. We do what we say. We own what we do. We WOW our customers.

Lenovo is a US$57 billion revenue global technology powerhouse, ranked #248 in the Fortune Global 500, and serving millions of customers every day in 180 markets. Focused on a bold vision to deliver Smarter Technology for All, Lenovo has built on its success as the world‚Äôs largest PC company with a full-stack portfolio of AI-enabled, AI-ready, and AI-optimized devices (PCs, workstations, smartphones, tablets), infrastructure (server, storage, edge, high performance computing and software defined infrastructure), software, solutions, and services. Lenovo‚Äôs continued investment in world-changing innovation is building a more equitable, trustworthy, and smarter future for everyone, everywhere. Lenovo is listed on the Hong Kong stock exchange under Lenovo Group Limited (HKSE: 992) (ADR: LNVGY).

This transformation together with Lenovo‚Äôs world-changing innovation is building a more inclusive, trustworthy, and smarter future for everyone, everywhere. To find out more visit www.lenovo.com, and read about the latest news via our StoryHub.

The Position will support Marketing Operations Director and Marketing Management Team at EMEA Level, with real time data and investment analysis to provide a clear view of the investment status and base for decisions.

These Are Your Detailed Responsibilities


Set Up and maintenance of Business and Marketing related Dashboards
Budgets Loading in systems and related Control for all Business Units in Lenovo EMEA
Budget Allocation Tracker Updating
Budget Review for all EMEA HQ Functions with Weekly/Bi-Weekly calls
EMEA HQ Activities Management in Marketing Systems
Management of Business Partners Payments Processes
Management of EMEA Alliances Claims Tracker
Communication of details of budget usage with Alliances
Marketing DATA Validation
KPI Set Up and Measurement
Support the Company beyond the current understanding of our marketing ROI and in defining proper KPI Structure
Develop positive relationships within the marketing leadership team and across critical cross-functional teams
Support annual and quarterly planning for Marketing and Revenue operations
Implementation of AI solution for Marketing and Business Planning within EMEA Marketing Organization


Position Requirements


Ability to develop/deliver solutions to complex problems where analytics, process change/development are keys to success
1-3 years of related experience in an analytics, consulting, or strategy role
Past experience engaging with executives; including preparing strategic analysis, crafting recommendations, and implementing the proposed solutions
Experience running mid-to-large cross-functional projects with varying degrees of complexity
A strong collaborator and communicator capable of working in a cross-functional environment to achieve success
A person with the energy, drive, passion, and enthusiasm to do and be motivated, creative, results-oriented, and possess the ability to communicate complex ideas in ways that are simple to understand
Strong attention to detail
Very high level of usage of Microsoft tools + capability of working with complex IT systems
Fluency in both written and spoken English is essential


What Do We Offer


Life Insurance
Pension/ Retirement Plan
Health Coverage Plan
Meal Vouchers
Employee Referral Bonus
Children of Lenovo Employees Scholarship Program
Lenovo and Motorola Product Discounts
Employee Assistance Program, e.g., for health, legal financial consultancy
Internal E-learning Development Platform Available for Employees


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any federal, state, or local protected class.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Silbing is working with a leading organisation in Brussels looking for a Data Analyst to join on a 6-month contract (with likely extension). A great chance to shape high-impact projects in a fast-paced, international setting.

You‚Äôll work with large datasets, build dashboards, and deliver insights that directly support strategic decisions

Analyse complex data to uncover trends and insights
Build and optimise dashboards (Power BI, Tableau, etc.)

Translate data into clear recommendations
Support data quality initiatives

Excellent communication ‚Äì English essential, Dutch/French a bonus
Proactive and independent mindset

Title: Data Analyst - Power BI
Description:
Wij zoeken een Data Analyst / Power BI-expert om ons Microsoft-team te versterken!




Over LACO

LACO is een toonaangevend Belgisch data-intelligencebedrijf met meer dan 35 jaar ervaring in business intelligence en data-analyse. Als trotse Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner beschikken we over diepgaande expertise in Microsoft BI, Data Governance en meer.




Met een team van meer dan 120 gepassioneerde consultants ondersteunen we bedrijven in hun volledige datatraject ‚Äî van strategie tot implementatie. Wat ons uniek maakt? Onze focus op langetermijnrelaties en een bedrijfscultuur waar plezier en professionaliteit hand in hand gaan.




Door de groei van ons klantenportfolio en nieuwe boeiende projecten zijn we op zoek naar een gedreven Power BI-professional die samen met ons team impactvolle end-to-end dataoplossingen wil realiseren.




Jouw rol

Als Data Analyst/Power BI-expert bij LACO ben je verantwoordelijk voor:

Het begrijpen en in kaart brengen van de bedrijfsvereisten.
Het verzamelen, opschonen en voorbewerken van gegevens uit diverse bronnen.
Het nauw samenwerken met multifunctionele teams en je expertise in Power BI inzetten om overtuigende visualisaties en rapporten te maken.
Het ontwerpen, optimaliseren en ontwikkelen van Power BI-rapporten en dashboards die voldoen aan de bedrijfsbehoeften en -vereisten.
Het samenwerken met stakeholders om gegevensvereisten te verzamelen en te begrijpen, en zorgen voor nauwkeurige en consistente data.
Het oplossen van problemen met Power BI-rapporten en het omzetten van complexe datasets in bruikbare inzichten door middel van datavisualisaties.
Het up-to-date blijven met de nieuwste Power BI- en Microsoft Fabric-functionaliteiten en best practices om uit te blinken in deze rol.




Jouw vaardigheden

Je hebt een bachelor- of masterdiploma in (toegepaste) informatica of een verwante richting.
Je hebt een analytische geest en denkt oplossingsgericht.
Je hebt minstens 3 jaar ervaring als Power BI Developer of een vergelijkbare functie.
Je bent vertrouwd met SQL, DAX en Python.
Je hebt kennis van datamodelleringstechnieken zoals Kimball, Dimensional Modelling en Data Vault.
Power BI kent voor jou geen geheimen: je beheerst DAX, datamodellering √©n custom visuals.




Bonuspunten als je ‚Ä¶

Ervaring hebt met Azure Synapse, Data Factory en/of Databricks.
Weet hoe je effici√´nt werkt met verschillende soorten datastorage.
Sterk communiceert en graag samenwerkt in teamverband.
Vloeiend bent in zowel Nederlands als Engels.




Ons aanbod

Of je nu werknemer of freelancer bent, wij staan open voor samenwerking.
Je krijgt een aantrekkelijk salarispakket met uitstekende extralegale voordelen zoals o.a. 32 vakantiedagen, bedrijfwagen etc.
Je krijgt ruimte voor persoonlijke en professionele groei via opleidingen en certificeringen.
Je werkt aan uitdagende en innovatieve projecten binnen het Microsoft-ecosysteem.
Je wordt deel van een warme en dynamische bedrijfscultuur, met aandacht voor fun: van familiedagen en sportactiviteiten tot onze jaarlijkse skitrip en gezellige spelavonden.




Klaar om jouw carri√®re naar een hoger niveau te tillen?

Solliciteer vandaag nog en geef je datatalent de ruimte die het verdient.

Ons Talent Acquisition-team kijkt ernaar uit om jou te leren kennen!

Show more
