Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you ready to step up as a Data Analyst and truly make a difference?

Do you have around 3 years of experience, but even more drive to grow? At darwind, we‚Äôre looking for people like you: professionals with some experience, but plenty of ambition to keep building their future.




Here, you don‚Äôt just get assigned to a project ‚Äì we work with you to shape your ideal career path based on your talents and aspirations.




What will you do?

You source data from diverse channels such as databases, surveys, and external datasets.
You ensure data accuracy and relevance by filtering and cleaning it.
You use statistical methods to analyze data and identify trends, patterns, and correlations.
You create reports and dashboards to present findings to stakeholders.
You develop graphs, charts, and infographics to visualize data insights.
You work with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide solutions.




Who are we looking for?

You have at least 3 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar analytical role.
You're fluent in SQL and comfortable scripting in Python or R.
You have hands-on experience with Power BI and/or Tableau ‚Äì from exploration to storytelling. You have in-depth knowledge of data modeling, relational databases, and ETL processes.
You're experienced in statistical analysis, including regression and advanced modeling (SPSS, SAS or similar).
You can clearly explain complex data topics to both technical teams and non-technical stakeholders.
You're fluent in Dutch, with good command of French and English.
You're curious, proactive, and passionate about solving complex data challenges.







What's in it for you?

Challenging projects tailored to your interests and expertise across industries.
A say in your career path, with coaching, training, and regular feedback.
An attractive salary package with hospitalization and group insurance, plus a mobility budget or company car with fuel card.
A flexible, hybrid work environment where autonomy is the norm.
A team that supports and inspires each other ‚Äì no egos, just impact.
The chance to work with data that actually gets used to drive decisions, not just reports that end up in someone‚Äôs inbox.




Ready for a fresh wind in your career? Apply today and let‚Äôs grow together!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
!Join a Dynamic and Exciting Team at Cleeven!




Are you ready to be part of a fast-growing, ambitious company where innovation meets impact? Do you want to take part in cutting-edge data projects and accelerate your career in a collaborative, energetic environment?




At Cleeven, we believe that your growth drives our success. Join us and become a key player in projects that matter ‚Äî in a company that invests in your development every step of the way.




WHO ARE WE ?




Cleeven is an international engineering consulting firm built on two core principles:

OUR MISSION: To enhance self-awareness and the awareness of those around us.
OUR BELIEF: The excellence of European engineers and data professionals should power Europe‚Äôs leadership in technology and innovation.




We work hand-in-hand with our clients to deliver data-driven insights, cutting-edge technologies, and sustainable performance improvements.




YOUR ROLE AS A DATA ANALYST




As a Data Analyst at Cleeven, you will contribute to high-impact data initiatives across financial and industrial sectors. You‚Äôll play a crucial role in transforming data into actionable insights. Your responsibilities will include:

Requirement analysis: Understand and synthesize functional and technical needs.
Data asset analysis: Evaluate available datasets, identify gaps, and define data strategies.
Statistical modeling: Define models (PCA, logistic regression, random forest, etc.) tailored to business challenges.
Data sourcing: Collect, structure, and consolidate data from various internal and external sources.
Tool implementation: Work with tools and languages such as R, Python, SAS, SPSS to implement models.
Performance optimization: Fine-tune algorithms for accuracy and efficiency.
Result interpretation: Present findings in a clear, actionable manner for stakeholders.
Tech watch: Stay current on Big Data, machine learning, and statistical innovation.
Solution qualification: Participate in validating data-driven solutions for production deployment.




WHO YOU ARE




You‚Äôre curious, analytical, and solution-oriented ‚Äî and ready to put data at the heart of decision-making.

Your ideal profile:

Master‚Äôs degree in a relevant field
Fluent in English + Dutch and/or French (trilingual is a major asset)
Experience with data tools such as Python, R, SQL, SAS, Power BI, Tableau...
Familiar with statistical methods and machine learning fundamentals
Autonomous, adaptable, and a collaborative team player
A first experience in the financial sector is a plus




WHAT‚ÄôS HAPPENING AT CLEEVEN?




Your journey at Cleeven is more than a project ‚Äî it‚Äôs a path to your potential. Here‚Äôs how we support you:

Cleeven Coaching Program: Optional one-on-one coaching tailored to your development goals
Monthly Project Follow-Ups: Regular discussions with your manager to track progress and provide support
Boost Your Skills: Bi-monthly expert sessions to build your technical and analytical skills
Social Events: From networking evenings to off-site gatherings, we foster connection and community




"With Cleeven, become who you are!"

  • Je werkt nauw samen met collega‚Äôs uit verschillende teams om data-driven strategie√´n te ondersteunen.
  • Je optimaliseert datastromen en schrijft effici√´nte SQL-query‚Äôs om de juiste informatie boven te halen.


Wie ben jij?

  • Je hebt ervaring als Data Analyst of in een gelijkaardige functie.
  • Je bent sterk in SQL en weet hoe je data uit verschillende bronnen effici√´nt kunt combineren.
  • Je hebt ervaring met Power BI en/of Tableau.
  • Je werkt zelfstandig, maar bent ook een teamplayer.
  • Je spreekt vlot Engels. Kennis van Nederlands en/of Frans is een plus.


Voor jou:

  • Hybride werkmodel: een mooie balans tussen werken op kantoor (regio Zaventem) en van thuis uit.
  • Dynamische en maatschappelijk relevante sector: je komt terecht in een organisatie die een cruciale rol speelt in nationale en internationale connectiviteit.
  • Innovatie en duurzaamheid staan centraal in de bedrijfsstrategie.
  • Je werkt in een moderne werkomgeving met veel aandacht voor persoonlijke groei, opleiding en samenwerking.
  • Snelle opstart mogelijk ‚Äì we zoeken iemand die op korte termijn beschikbaar is.


Interesse? buna@recurv.be

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a Data Analyst for one of our clients in the banking sector to support data-driven decision-making. The candidate will work closely with business units to gather, interpret, and translate data into insights that improve processes, support regulatory reporting, and inform strategic initiatives.







Responsibilities:




Collect, clean, and validate structured and unstructured data from internal and external sources.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and data visualisations to support business analysis and performance monitoring.
Work closely with business stakeholders to define reporting needs and translate them into technical requirements.
Perform data mining and statistical analysis to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies.
Support regulatory and compliance reporting through accurate and timely data provision.
Collaborate with IT, risk, finance, and compliance teams to ensure alignment on data governance and quality standards.
Contribute to the development and documentation of data models and data dictionaries.
Assist in the implementation of data quality controls and data lineage tracking.







Profile:




Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Min 3 years of proven experience in a data analytics role, preferably within the banking or financial services sector.
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience with data visualisation tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Qlik).
Experience with programming languages such as Python or R.
Solid understanding of data management principles, including data governance and data quality.
Experience working with large datasets and relational databases.
Strong analytical mindset with attention to detail.
Knowledge of banking products, financial regulations, or risk management is considered an asset.
Fluent in English and able to communicate professionally in Dutch.













About Dynafin Consulting




DynaFin Consulting is a human-sized, flexible consulting company delivering services in the Financial Services Industry. Our company consists of more than 160 committed consultants in several business domains: Invest ‚Äì Payments ‚Äì Credits ‚Äì Insurance ‚Äì Data - Risk & Compliance.

In 14 years, we have become a reference in the Belgian Financial Services landscape. In July 2017, we joined the Alan Allman Associates ecosystem, adding the international dimension to our ambitions.




What we offer :

- An attractive salary package (a competitive fixed salary with benefits: car (models in line with our "green fleet mobility" - net allowances - smartphone budget - full insurance & hospitalization insurances ‚Ä¶).

- The opportunity to optimize your work-life balance.

- A team of dynamic and passionate colleagues, recognized for their expertise.

- An excellent collaborative working environment: One Team & One Dream

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 51.000 colleagues in nearly 30 countries, we rank as Europe‚Äôs leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let‚Äôs shape it together.

Job Description

As a Data Analyst at Sopra Steria, you will play a pivotal role in guiding clients from various industries through their dynamic data journey. You will assist clients in transforming their data processes. By thoroughly analysing and understanding customer needs, you‚Äôll match their requirements with meaningful data solutions. Your innovative approach will enable you to generate impactful analyses that deliver efficient, user-focused solutions. Through your expertise and advice across the data value chain, you‚Äôll ensure the successful implementation and support of Sopra Steria‚Äôs diverse portfolio of data services.

Qualifications

We‚Äôre seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries in digital transformation and technology consulting. At Sopra Steria, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to grow your skills in a constructive, collaborative team environment, working on impactful projects that drive change for our clients. If you thrive on challenge and meet (most of) the qualifications below, we look forward to your application!

You‚Äôll have knowledge and experience of the following:


At least 3 years of experience as a Data Engineer or Data Analyst.
You help customers in their data transformation, focusing on data architecture, data strategy and governance, data transformation, data foundation, and more
Based on your advice across the entire data value chain, you ensure that Sopra Steria‚Äôs portfolio of relevant data services is implemented and supported
You collect, analyze and match customer demand with meaningful data
You have knowledge and experience with databases and data modeling
You have good knowledge and experience with SQL
Knowledge of a programming language like Python is a plus
You have analytical thinking, communication skills and a practical attitude.
You are proficient in English; knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a must.


What We Can Offer You

Become part of a major Tech player in Europe that is recognised for consulting, digital services and software development. Work among high-level professionals who dare to make bold choices to deliver results.

Additionally, you‚Äôll join our Data & AI team, where we‚ÄØsupport enterprises‚ÄØand institutions to become more data driven, and assist our‚ÄØclients to increase business efficiency‚ÄØand create‚ÄØimpact with‚ÄØdata. We offer‚ÄØa complete‚ÄØportfolio of Services and Solutions to unburden‚ÄØorganisations in every step‚ÄØof their‚ÄØtransition: from defining‚ÄØand executing‚ÄØthe data strategy‚ÄØand governance, over setting up data platforms, to visualizing dashboards‚ÄØand applying‚ÄØthe latest‚ÄØdata science and artificial‚ÄØintelligence methodologies. ‚ÄØ

Additional Information

Are you ready to further develop your career? Then we‚Äôd love to point you in the right direction. With offices in more than 30 countries, that direction might lead you to places you‚Äôve never been to before. Would you prefer to grow internally? That‚Äôs possible, too. We challenge you to keep pushing yourself to become the best you can be.

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


Ready to take the next step?

We‚Äôre here to support you all the way and we are looking forward to your application!

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Ben jij er klaar voor om als Data Analist echt het verschil te maken?

Heb je meer dan 3 jaar ervaring, maar nog meer zin om te groeien? Bij darwind zijn we op zoek naar mensen zoals jij: professionals met enige ervaring, maar met veel ambitie om aan hun toekomst te blijven bouwen.




Hier krijg je niet zomaar een project toegewezen - we werken met je samen om jouw ideale carri√®repad vorm te geven op basis van jouw talenten en ambities.




Wat ga je doen?

Je haalt gegevens uit verschillende kanalen, zoals databases, enqu√™tes en externe datasets.
Je zorgt ervoor dat gegevens accuraat en relevant zijn.
Je gebruikt statistische methoden om gegevens te analyseren en trends, patronen en correlaties te identificeren.
Je maakt rapporten en dashboards om bevindingen te presenteren aan belanghebbenden.
Je ontwikkelt grafieken, diagrammen en infographics om gegevens te visualiseren.
Je werkt samen met cross-functionele teams om hun databehoeften te begrijpen en oplossingen te bieden.




Wie zoeken we?

Je hebt minstens 3 jaar ervaring als Data Analist of in een gelijkaardige analytische rol.
Je spreekt vloeiend SQL en bent vlot in het schrijven van scripts in Python of R.
Je hebt hands-on ervaring met Power BI en/of Tableau - van exploratie tot storytelling.
Je hebt diepgaande kennis van datamodellering en ETL-processen.
Je beschikt over sterke analytische vaardigheden, een gestructureerde mindset en kritisch denkvermogen.
Je kunt complexe data duidelijk uitleggen aan zowel technische teams als niet-technische stakeholders.
Je spreekt vloeiend Nederlands, met een goede kennis van Frans en Engels.
Je bent nieuwsgierig, proactief en gepassioneerd over het oplossen van complexe data-uitdagingen.




Wat zit er voor jou in?

Uitdagende projecten op maat van jouw interesses en expertise in verschillende sectoren.
Inspraak in je loopbaan, met coaching, training en regelmatige feedback.
Een aantrekkelijk salarispakket met hospitalisatie en groepsverzekering, plus een mobiliteitsbudget of bedrijfswagen met EU tankkaart.
Een flexibele, hybride werkomgeving waar autonomie de norm is.
Een team dat elkaar steunt en inspireert geen ego's, alleen impact.
De kans om te werken met gegevens die daadwerkelijk worden gebruikt om beslissingen te nemen, niet alleen rapporten die in iemands inbox belanden.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
My client based in Leuven who work in the Pharmaceutical sector are looking for a Data Analyst to work on multiple active projects. The selected consultant will be working with existing data, gathering it from various applications and transforming it into structured datasets that can be analysed and used for reporting and decision-making across the organization.

Key skills

Data gathering & cleansing experience
Data Analysis & Reporting experience
Advanced SQL
ETL & Data Modeling
English speaking

Logistics

Hybrid
Freelance
English Speaking

This role is a long-term freelance mission with a hybrid set up with only 2 day per week on-site required. We are hosting interviews for this position over the next two weeks so please get in touch if you are interested.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
About the company:

As a total solution provider of medical devices and pharmaceutical packaging, Nipro Europe Group Companies is continuously committed to improving patient outcomes and quality of life. We are part of a large global network headed by Nipro Corporation Japan, an industry-leading healthcare company with over 38,000 employees worldwide. Our European headquarters in Mechelen, Belgium covers a wide geographical reach (Europe, Africa, India, the Americas) and is home to Nipro Medical EMEA, Nipro PharmaPackaging International, and the Institute for Medical Practice (iMEP) Belgium.




To accommodate our growth, Nipro EMEA is looking for a BI Analyst/Engineer who is dynamic, hands-on, and collaborative to join us in our Data Analytics team, based in our European headquarters office in Mechelen, Belgium.




About the role

You will be working in a team that designs, develops, and maintains data warehouses and data lakes. You will integrate various data sources, develop interactive dashboards, and analyse large datasets to provide valuable business insights.




What you‚Äôll do

Design, develop, and maintain data warehouses and data lakes.
Integrate various data sources ensuring accuracy and integrity.
Develop interactive dashboards and reports to visualize insights.
Analyse large datasets to identify trends and opportunities.
Collaborate with departments to understand data needs.
Document data processes and support data-related queries.




What you‚Äôll need

Bachelor's or master's degree in Computer Science or related field.
5+ years of experience as a BI analyst/engineer.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication skills.
Knowledge of SQL and/or Python.
Experience with Azure, Snowflake, and PowerBI.
Hands-on mentality and proactive mindset.




Why you should apply

Join a global leader in healthcare with a commitment to improving patient outcomes.
Be part of a dynamic and growing team in a supportive work environment.
Opportunity to make a significant impact on data strategies and operations.
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Career growth and development opportunities within a global network.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Remote

Employment Type: Contract

Monthly Salary: $3k-$4k

Timezone: 2pm cest - 10pm cest




We‚Äôre looking for a detail-oriented Data/Business Analyst with strong marketing analytics expertise to join our growing team. You‚Äôll play a pivotal role in optimizing marketing campaigns and sales performance by building insightful dashboards, integrating data from multiple platforms, and enforcing data governance best practices. Your work will directly inform strategic decisions across the business.

What You‚Äôll Do

Develop and maintain dynamic Tableau dashboards to provide actionable insights to marketing and sales teams.
Build and manage data pipelines that integrate data from Martech and CRM platforms (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot, Marketo).
Implement and oversee UTM governance, campaign tracking frameworks, and attribution modeling to accurately assess performance.
Partner with marketing and sales stakeholders to define KPIs and translate business needs into technical requirements.
Enforce data quality standards and ensure consistency across reporting sources.
Perform advanced Excel-based analysis, creating reports and models to support campaign and sales strategy decisions.
Continuously optimize reporting processes and recommend improvements to the marketing tech stack.

What We‚Äôre Looking For

4+ years of experience in a data/business analyst role focused on marketing or sales.
Strong proficiency in Tableau for data visualization and storytelling.
Proven experience with Martech and CRM data integration (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot, Marketo, Pardot).
Deep understanding of campaign tracking, UTM governance, and multi-touch attribution.
Advanced Excel skills ‚Äì including pivot tables, lookups, data modeling, and automation techniques.
Experience with SQL and working knowledge of ETL processes a strong plus.
Strong communication skills with the ability to translate complex data into clear insights.

Title: Intership Data Analyst - Personalization
Description:
Join our team as a personalization Data analyst intern!

Are you passionate about data and customer engagement? As an intern in our personalization product team, you'll be an integral part of the cockpit squad, responsible for managing interactions with our customers through both inbound and outbound channels.

What You'll Do


Analyze customer behavior: Use data-driven insights to understand and engage with our customers effectively.
Build dashboards: Create and maintain dashboards in Cognos or Power BI to track and follow up on current actions.
Guide stakeholders: Assist in navigating our communications process to ensure smooth and effective interactions.


Why join us?


Hands-on experience: Gain practical experience in data analysis and customer engagement.
Collaborative environment: Work with a dynamic team dedicated to innovation and excellence.
Professional growth: Develop your skills and build a strong foundation for your career.


Interested? Apply now!

, ING Bank

, ING Bank

Title: Data Analyst / Data Consultant
Description:
Data Analyst / Data consultant

Are you interested in expanding your consulting exposure? Do you want to move away from an operations role and make an impact on the business?

Do you often feel like processes and ways of working could be better or more efficient?

Capco is a global management consultancy specialising in driving transformation across investment banking, securities services, and insurance.

We have the people, the vision, and the passion.

We are going through a significant growth journey, and now is a very good time to join us as we expand geographically, increase headcount and disrupt the consulting market across Central Europa with entrepreneurial and agile thinking.

In your role as a Consultant at Capco, you play a key role in the delivery of projects and gain wider exposure to our wider Investment Banking business.

You will work closely with senior clients to deliver large-scale change initiatives for leading global banks.

Fitting that description, you will also need to be a supremely motivated person and able to work in a team where clients become colleagues too.

We Are Looking For Talent With The Following


Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis


Skills & Expertise


Professional experience of minimum 2 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the financial industry or a consultancy firm
Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
Fluency in French or Dutch AND excellent knowledge of English


What We Offer You


The opportunity to join a growing, thought leading, global team of data professionals
An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers
Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts. Our learning materials cover all areas of data (Governance, Management, Manipulation, Decision science, Engineering)
A hybrid (on-site/remote) work environment
A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
SII Belgium is currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Big Data to join our team. As a Big Data Analyst, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing big data solutions to support business objectives. You will work with large, complex data sets and be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data to identify trends and insights. . You would join various teams working in the Energy, Retail, Banking or Telecom sectors.

SII is a European digital and engineering services company of 16,000 experts. SII Belgium supports large businesses in adopting new technologies and innovation management. SII values empowerment and entrepreneurship, providing a fulfilling work environment for employees. Our mission is to contribute to the design and development of future products and services for customers. SII is committed to a sustainable digital world and is recognized as a Great Workplace.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Key Responsibilities:


Develop and maintain big data solutions to support business objectives
Analyze and interpret large, complex data sets to identify trends and insights
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement data-driven solutions
Create and maintain data visualization and reporting tools to support decision-making
Integration‚ÄØbetween enterprise architecture and data collection.
Stay up to date with industry trends and technologies to identify new opportunities for data analysis


Qualifications:


You hold a bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in IT.
Minimum of 3 years of experience working with data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Hive‚Ä¶
Strong analytical skills and experience using statistical techniques to interpret data
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools such as Tableau and Power BI
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French, and fluent in English.


We offer:


A challenging and varied role in a growing company
Opportunity to work with the latest technologies
Competitive salary and benefits
Opportunity to improve your skills and knowledge through training and education
Warm and open company culture, supported by an international group


If you are passionate about Data and want to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at SII Belgium.

Title: Data Analyst M/F
Description:
At LittleBigCode, a fast-growing and dynamic company, we push the boundaries of data and artificial intelligence to deliver cutting-edge solutions to today‚Äôs technological challenges. Our talented team is committed to innovation, knowledge sharing, and leveraging the power of data to drive meaningful insights and impactful decisions. If you're passionate about data analysis, business intelligence, and turning complex datasets into actionable strategies ‚Äî and want to play a key role in a pioneering team ‚Äî this opportunity is made for you.




What will be your tasks with us ?




You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data analysis:




Collect, clean, and preprocess data from various sources to ensure data accuracy and reliability

Analyze datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that support business decisions

Create detailed reports and dashboards to visualize findings and communicate results effectively to stakeholders

Conduct exploratory data analysis (EDA) to understand data distributions, outliers, and potential issues

Develop and maintain queries, scripts, and automation for data extraction and reporting purposes

Work closely with clients or internal teams to understand business objectives and translate them into actionable data insights

Perform statistical analysis to validate hypotheses and make data-driven recommendations

Support decision-making by providing actionable insights that inform business strategy and operations




Profile

You have a Master in Engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics) and you have at least 3 years of experience as a Data Analyst

You are comfortable working with both technical & business stakeholders, thanks to your nice communication skills

You are fully proficient in Data Visualization (PowerBI, Tableau) and SQL, Python is considered as a real +

You master the creation of dashboards & visualization solutions in order to bring business teams valuable & dynamic insights

You have experiences with Data services of at least one the major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)

Support Data Scientists & Data Engineers on deployment of AI applications

Ensure a technological watch in order to propose innovations

Fluent in English and Dutch and/or French

Show more

Title: Game Data Analyst
Description:
Department: Data

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote

Description

We are looking for a talented Game Data Analyst to join our dynamic analytics team. You'll work closely with game teams, using data to drive player retention, improve monetization strategies, and optimize user experience. If you‚Äôre excited by data and games, this is the role for you.

All The Responsibilities We'll Trust You With


You‚Äôll collaborate with game development teams to analyze player behavior, identify trends, and provide actionable insights to drive game performance and player engagement.
You‚Äôll create dashboards and visualizations that support key business decisions by presenting clear and data-driven recommendations to senior stakeholders.
You‚Äôll design, implement, and analyze A/B tests to measure the effectiveness of new game features and mechanics.
You‚Äôll work on projects related to the blockchain, analyzing how players engage with decentralized features and in-game economies.
You‚Äôll contribute to advanced analytics projects, including game economy analysis, to enhance monetization strategies and game progression.
You‚Äôll build out new ways to map in-game events, such as stunts, crashes, and progression to optimize player experience.
You‚Äôll continuously drive data literacy within the company, helping stakeholders leverage data effectively for decision-making.


What You'll Bring To The Team


At least 2-3 years of experience in data analytics, preferably within a gaming environment.
Proficient in SQL and Python (or R) for data exploration and analysis.
Strong experience with A/B testing and applied statistics (bonus if familiar with Bayesian statistics).
Experience building dashboards using tools like Metabase, Looker, or Tableau.
Strong analytical skills and a proactive mindset.
A fast learner, able to balance immediate needs with long-term projects.
A collaborative team player, comfortable working with cross-functional teams.


Why You'll Love Working With Us


We‚Äôre 100% remote, work wherever you want forever!
We offer unlimited holidays. Take as much time off as you need, to spend time with your family and friends or just because you feel like playing games all day. We trust our team and want to offer a modern work life balance that allows you to thrive both at work and in your personal life.
You‚Äôll be able to make an impact, to work closely with the rest of the team and its leads to work on one of the most promising upcoming games in the mobile gaming industry and the Web3 space.
You‚Äôll have a comfortable work schedule and stable workload. With a variety of tasks that will allow your constant professional development.
We want our team to grow personally and professionally and support learning opportunities, especially with a focus around new AI tools and methods.
We have a culture that puts our people first. We believe in open communication, creativity and the value of unique contributions from everyone in the team.
We offer a competitive salary in addition to equity option plans.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst focusing on BASE data reporting & analysis and guiding decision makers by providing domain specific insights. You are the first contact person for all business analytical questions related to your domain and act as a liaison between the domain‚Äôs business stakeholders and the data (or data teams).

Your Tasks As a Data Analyst


You develop curiosity and understanding of your domain‚Äôs business context and processes which positions you as a perfect data partner to your stakeholders
You collect, query, clean, validate and manipulate the data you need from different sources
You define, build and automate reporting dashboards relevant for the business topic you are working on
You develop a proactive partnership with your stakeholders
You perform descriptive ad hoc analyses
You occasionally perform deep-dive analyses on specific insights requests that lead to actionable recommendations for the business colleagues
You take an active role in the community of data professionals within Telenet, through sharing sessions


Our Ideal Data Analyst


You have strong analytical skills
You have a hands-on mentality to really dive into the data and find the answers
You have a constructive mindset and can collaborate effectively with colleagues from various teams, both from a business and a more analytical background
You can manage an analytics initiative end to end, including strong communication & presentation skills and stakeholder management
You have experience in commercial reporting
You have a solid knowledge of one of the main dashboard tools (Qlik Sense, Power BI or Tableau); previous Qlik Sense experience is a big plus
You have a knowledge of SQL. Experience with Snowflake is a nice to have
You have a relevant degree and experience
Master's degree in a quantitative field (commercial engineering, TEW, computer science, information management ...) or equivalent through experience
Min. 3 years relevant work experience
Fluent in English and French, knowledge of Dutch is a bonus

What We Have To Offer


A varied job in which you produce tangible results and make your mark
An agile working environment, giving you significant responsibility and autonomy
All the space you need to further develop your expertise. We stimulate your personal growth with internal mobility opportunities and extensive learning opportunities
Opportunity to work from home 60% of your time
A competitive gross monthly salary that we complement with a lot of fringe benefits (meal vouchers, mobile phone, mobility budget, hospitalization insurance, telephone subscription, discounts on Telenet products, etc.)
The company of passionate colleagues. Join a team of young, dynamic, enthusiastic, and results-driven data profiles, with fun team buildings, on-site padel games and the occasional afterwork drinks
Telenet is a leading company in the field of Data and creating impact using Data & AI. We recently won the Data Maturity Award by Madison Partners & Delaware

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Vacature Ervaren Data Analist




Geo Solutions is een Belgisch bedrijf dat organisaties helpt om de kracht van locatiedata ten volle te benutten. Wij ontwerpen en ontwikkelen slimme GEO-ICT oplossingen op maat. Onze innovatieve en flexibele dienstverlening ondersteunt klanten in de overheid, nutsbedrijven, industrie en constructie bij strategische en operationele beslissingen.




Waar je ons terugvindt? Wel, ons hoofdkantoor is gelegen in Edegem, maar we bieden ook flexplekken aan in onze hubs in Gent, Leuven en Namen. Daarnaast zal je ook op wekelijkse basis ter plaatse op je toegewezen project bij je klant werken.




Zo ziet jouw rol als Data Analist eruit:

Werkplek: bij je klant, Geo-kantoor/hub, thuis




Als Data Analist bij Geo Solutions maak je locatiedata inzichtelijk voor onze klanten. Een achtergrond in de brede wereld van geo is niet noodzakelijk, maar je hart mag wel een slagje sneller slaan bij het zien van X, Y en Z‚Äôs.




Een greep uit je takenpakket:

Je vertaalt businessnoden naar datavereisten, en je kan daar helder over communiceren.
Je voert diepgaande en kwalitatieve analyses uit op complexe datasets en zet de bevindingen om naar heldere rapporten.
Je schat het potentieel van use cases in door een eerste exploratieve screening. Daarbij zet je zowel een sceptische als opportunistische bril op.
Je volgt technologische ontwikkelingen op en deelt actief je kennis met interne en externe collega‚Äôs.




Jouw profiel:

Bachelor- of masterdiploma in IT of een wetenschappelijke richting
Minstens 5 jaar ervaring als data analist of een vergelijkbare rol
Sterk in Python met ervaring in (Geo)Pandas, NumPy, Folium, DuckDB, Polars, ‚Ä¶
Ervaren in SQL en ETL-processen
Vaardig met BI- tools (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, Superset) bij voorkeur met geografische data
Ervaring met big data (Hadoop, Spark, Databricks) en cloudplatformen (Azure, GCP, AWS)
Kennis van AI/ML (TensorFlow, Torch, Keras) is een plus
Vloeiend Nederlands en Engels zijn een evidentie




Dit krijg je van ons

In ruil voor je inzet en leergierigheid bieden we je een boeiende job met toffe collega‚Äôs. En dat in een bedrijfscultuur die persoonlijke ontwikkeling en vernieuwing sterk aanmoedigt.




Bij Geo Solutions mag je rekenen op:

Een aantrekkelijk salarispakket: een brutoloon (rekening houden met je ervaring en diploma), aangevuld met bedrijfswagen en tankkaart (of laadkaart), maaltijdcheques, hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering, maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding.
Een gezonde werk-life balans: zo willen wij plezier binnen en buiten de werkuren motivering door flexibele werktijden aan te bieden
Aandacht voor nieuwe idee√´n: hier ben je geen nummer, wel een belangrijke aanwinst voor het team. We horen graag hoe jij bepaalde projecten ziet en hoe jij het zou aanpakken
Doorgroeimogelijkheden: we juichen met veel plezier je leergierigheid toe en bieden je toegang tot onze Geo Academy. Wil je graag een extra training volgen, een certificaat behalen of een externe opleiding volgen, dat kan allemaal!
State of the art technologie√´n: je bouwt ze niet alleen, je werkt er ook mee!




Kan je niet wachten om ons team te versterken? Stuur je cv en een korte motivatie naar jobs@geosolutions.be




Diversiteit, inclusie en gelijkheid

Bij ons draait het om mensen. We willen een plek zijn waar je jezelf kunt zijn, ongeacht wie je bent of hoe je in het leven staat. Verschillen maken ons sterker, en we geloven dat iedereen iets waardevols bijdraagt. Daarom zorgen we ervoor dat je je bij ons gerespecteerd voelt, en dat je met plezier je talenten kunt inzetten.

Title: Data Strategist
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe‚Äôs leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let‚Äôs shape it together.

Job Description

Your role as a Data Strategist lies in guiding our clients to become increasingly data-driven. You strive to connect (top) management, data teams and analytical teams with your analytical translation skills. You would build the business case for data & AI use cases and ensure that value creation is top priority in data roadmaps and throughout data projects execution. In addition, you work towards an improved organizational setup around data and install scalable data processes. Moreover, you contribute to creating a data-driven culture where people embrace data and its possibilities. In this role, you will operate with our current clients in rapidly changing environments on a medium to long-term basis or would develop the data strategy of organizations that prioritize their investments in data for the foreseeable future.

Qualifications

We‚Äôre seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries in digital transformation and technology consulting. At Sopra Steria, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to grow your skills in a constructive, collaborative team environment, working on impactful projects that drive change for our clients. If you thrive on challenge and meet (most of) the qualifications below, we look forward to your application!

You‚Äôll have knowledge and experience of the following:


You have 3 or more years of relevant experiences in data & analytics domain. Strategic or management consulting background is a big plus
You understand that organizations today should make the most of the available information and to turn this information into value
You are not necessarily a data scientist by background, but have reasonable high-level knowledge of different data-related domains such as business intelligence, analytics, data science, information management and data infrastructure. This includes understanding of market trends in tooling, data engineering and governance best practices and basic statistical knowledge
You are motivated by obtaining concrete deliverables and results
You want to make a difference for the organizations you work for, and you like to be recognized for your input
You create easy connections with stakeholders throughout organization
Experience with leading data projects is a plus.
All candidates need very good knowledge of English. Knowledge of French or Dutch is a plus


What We Can Offer You

As a member of one of Europe‚Äôs largest digital solutions providers, you‚Äôll benefit from extensive career development opportunities, both local and international. At the Sopra Steria Academy, you‚Äôll be part of a dynamic network of 56,000 professionals at all stages of their careers. With a wide array of offices to explore, you can find your ideal location and take the next step in your career.

You‚Äôll become a part of a major Tech player in Europe recognised for its consulting, digital services, and software development. On top of that, you‚Äôll join our Data & AI team, where we support enterprises and institutions to become more data driven, and assist our clients to increase business efficiency and create impact with data. We offer a complete portfolio of Services and Solutions to unburden organisations in every step of their transition: from defining and executing the data strategy and governance, over setting up data platforms, to visualizing dashboards and applying the latest data science and artificial intelligence methodologies.

Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe‚Äôs Leading Digital Service Provider.

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


People are the cornerstone of our success. That‚Äôs why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application!

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Company: Clear Edge International Search & Selection Ltd
Description:
BI Analyst

Location: Kyiv, Poland, Czechia, Malta, or Armenia | Hybrid Working Available




Join a fast-growing international gaming and entertainment company as a BI Analyst, where data plays a central role in shaping business strategy and performance. With operations in over 120 countries and more than 20 years of industry expertise, this company is on a mission to provide exceptional, secure betting and gaming experiences worldwide.




About the Role

As a BI Analyst, you‚Äôll work closely with stakeholders across the business to turn complex data into clear insights. You‚Äôll be responsible for delivering powerful dashboards, maintaining high-quality datasets, and helping teams make informed decisions through data-driven recommendations.

This is a hybrid role with flexible location options, including Kyiv, Poland, Czechia, Malta, or Armenia.




Key Responsibilities

Analyze large datasets to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement
Build and maintain dashboards and reports using BI tools like Metabase or Tableau
Translate business needs into effective BI solutions through close stakeholder collaboration
Ensure data quality and consistency across systems
Develop and optimize data workflows and integration pipelines
Track and report on KPIs, offering actionable insights to improve business performance
Contribute to broader analytics projects and support senior team members as needed




Requirements

Degree in Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or related field
2+ years of experience in BI, preferably within iGaming, e-commerce, or digital products
Solid SQL skills and experience working with BI tools such as Tableau or Metabase
Strong understanding of online business metrics (web, CRM, product, financial)
Upper-intermediate English proficiency (spoken and written)
Confident communicator, comfortable presenting findings to technical and non-technical audiences
Able to work both independently and collaboratively in cross-functional teams




What We Value

Analytical Thinking: Ability to extract clear insights from complex data
Attention to Detail: High standards for accuracy and reliability
Collaboration: Team-oriented, proactive communicator
Adaptability: Comfortable working in dynamic, fast-moving environments
Business Awareness: Understanding how data connects to strategy
Proactivity: Willing to take initiative and drive improvements




What‚Äôs in It for You

Competitive salary based on experience
Health insurance coverage for you and your family
Upskilling and reskilling programs
Team events and corporate gatherings
4 additional personal days off per year

Show more

Title: Regional Data Analyst
Description:
Zoetis Zaventem is currently looking for a Regional Data Analyst.

As the Data Analyst at Zoetis Benelux, Nordics & Ireland, you will be responsible for transforming raw data into actionable insights that drive business growth and innovation for the whole region.

By analysing and interpreting data trends, patterns, and anomalies, you will provide valuable insights and recommendations to stakeholders across the region, enabling data-driven decision-making and strategic planning for the regional Lead and the General Managers.

The Data Analyst plays a crucial role in building comprehensive reports and dashboards that visualize key metrics and performance indicators, empowering stakeholders to monitor progress, identify areas for improvement, and make informed decisions based on real-time data analysis.

Your work will directly contribute to improving processes, optimizing performance, and ultimately enhancing the overall competitiveness and success of Zoetis BNNI region.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

Data Analysis

Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and correlations in the data.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate key insights and findings to stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and develop analytical solutions to address business challenges.
Conduct ad hoc analysis and research to answer specific business questions and support decision-making.
Stay updated on emerging trends and best practices in data analytics and continuously seek opportunities to improve processes and methodologies.
Translate analytical findings into clear, concise, and actionable recommendations for all stakeholders.

Relationships

Develop mutually beneficial long-term partnerships with local, regional and international teams based on high quality interactions and exceptional provision of service
Implement bespoke solutions for all stakeholders in the region, utilising all available resources and tools
Work effectively at all levels in the teams from Vice President, General Manager to Marketing and Sales Managers.
Contribute to the success of your team by sharing best practice with colleagues across the region and proactively introducing ideas

Compliance

Maintain high standards of business conduct and compliance, adhering particularly to Pharmacovigilance Policy, Global vet Policy, Zoetis values, travel & expenses policy and local codes of practice.

KEY SKILLS

Capability in, or potential to develop

Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, etc.) and the ability to create visually compelling reports and dashboards
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to extract insights from complex datasets and identify actionable recommendations
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively communicate findings to all stakeholders
Attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy and integrity
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize tasks effectively in a fast-paced environment
Strong collaborative skills and the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and deliver impactful solutions

BEHAVIOURS

Our Colleagues make the difference

Keep your analytical skills sharp. Train, and retrain
Be an expert on your domain - know them inside and out, and continue to learn
Use the experience from setbacks and failure to drive your future success

Always do the right thing

Sell what you know your stakeholders need; what you know will work for our business
Uphold the highest standards of professionalism, honesty and integrity with the stakeholders
Help build the reputation of our brand by understanding and supporting the things that we stand for

Customer obsessed

Know your stakeholders. Know more than just their names, know their business
Establish effective and lasting relationships with customers that build loyalty to our brand

Run it like you own it

Ground all data quality plans in commercially sound thinking
Make realistic and achievable commitments to stakeholders that work for our business whilst benefiting theirs

We are one Zoetis

Show the stakeholders a united team that speak with one voice
Give the team timely information and support that helps them to deliver their role
Know what's going on around the business and talk about it to your customers

TRAINING & QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or related field; advanced degree preferred
Proven experience as a Data Analyst or related role, with a minimum of 5 years of experience

EXPERIENCE

Experience in a commercial industry
Experience in a data analyst role
Professional experiences gained in industries or sectors outside of Animal & Human Health are welcomed

TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS

Limited frequency of travel.


About Zoetis

At Zoetis, our purpose is to nurture the world and humankind by advancing care for animals. As a Fortune 500 company and the world leader in animal health, we discover, develop, manufacture and commercialize vaccines, medicines, diagnostics and other technologies for companion animals and livestock. We know our people drive our success. Our award-winning culture, built around our Core Beliefs, focuses on our colleagues' careers, connection and support. We offer competitive healthcare and retirement savings benefits, along with an array of benefits, policies and programs to support employee well-being in every sense, from health and financial wellness to family and lifestyle resources.







Global Job Applicant Privacy Notice

HTML:
Zoetis Zaventem is currently looking for a Regional Data Analyst.

As the Data Analyst at Zoetis Benelux, Nordics & Ireland, you will be responsible for transforming raw data into actionable insights that drive business growth and innovation for the whole region.

By analysing and interpreting data trends, patterns, and anomalies, you will provide valuable insights and recommendations to stakeholders across the region, enabling data-driven decision-making and strategic planning for the regional Lead and the General Managers.

The Data Analyst plays a crucial role in building comprehensive reports and dashboards that visualize key metrics and performance indicators, empowering stakeholders to monitor progress, identify areas for improvement, and make informed decisions based on real-time data analysis.

Your work will directly contribute to improving processes, optimizing performance, and ultimately enhancing the overall competitiveness and success of Zoetis BNNI region.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

Data Analysis

  • Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and correlations in the data.
  • Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate key insights and findings to stakeholders.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and develop analytical solutions to address business challenges.
  • Conduct ad hoc analysis and research to answer specific business questions and support decision-making.
  • Stay updated on emerging trends and best practices in data analytics and continuously seek opportunities to improve processes and methodologies.
  • Translate analytical findings into clear, concise, and actionable recommendations for all stakeholders.

Relationships

  • Develop mutually beneficial long-term partnerships with local, regional and international teams based on high quality interactions and exceptional provision of service
  • Implement bespoke solutions for all stakeholders in the region, utilising all available resources and tools
  • Work effectively at all levels in the teams from Vice President, General Manager to Marketing and Sales Managers.
  • Contribute to the success of your team by sharing best practice with colleagues across the region and proactively introducing ideas

Compliance

  • Maintain high standards of business conduct and compliance, adhering particularly to Pharmacovigilance Policy, Global vet Policy, Zoetis values, travel & expenses policy and local codes of practice.

KEY SKILLS

Capability in, or potential to develop

  • Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages
  • Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, etc.) and the ability to create visually compelling reports and dashboards
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to extract insights from complex datasets and identify actionable recommendations
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively communicate findings to all stakeholders
  • Attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy and integrity
  • Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize tasks effectively in a fast-paced environment
  • Strong collaborative skills and the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and deliver impactful solutions

BEHAVIOURS

Our Colleagues make the difference

  • Keep your analytical skills sharp. Train, and retrain
  • Be an expert on your domain - know them inside and out, and continue to learn
  • Use the experience from setbacks and failure to drive your future success

Always do the right thing

  • Sell what you know your stakeholders need; what you know will work for our business
  • Uphold the highest standards of professionalism, honesty and integrity with the stakeholders
  • Help build the reputation of our brand by understanding and supporting the things that we stand for

Customer obsessed

  • Know your stakeholders. Know more than just their names, know their business
  • Establish effective and lasting relationships with customers that build loyalty to our brand

Run it like you own it

  • Ground all data quality plans in commercially sound thinking
  • Make realistic and achievable commitments to stakeholders that work for our business whilst benefiting theirs

We are one Zoetis

  • Show the stakeholders a united team that speak with one voice
  • Give the team timely information and support that helps them to deliver their role
  • Know what's going on around the business and talk about it to your customers

TRAINING & QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or related field; advanced degree preferred
  • Proven experience as a Data Analyst or related role, with a minimum of 5 years of experience

EXPERIENCE

  • Experience in a commercial industry
  • Experience in a data analyst role
  • Professional experiences gained in industries or sectors outside of Animal & Human Health are welcomed

TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS

  • Limited frequency of travel.

About Zoetis

At Zoetis, our purpose is to nurture the world and humankind by advancing care for animals. As a Fortune 500 company and the world leader in animal health, we discover, develop, manufacture and commercialize vaccines, medicines, diagnostics and other technologies for companion animals and livestock. We know our people drive our success. Our award-winning culture, built around our Core Beliefs, focuses on our colleagues' careers, connection and support. We offer competitive healthcare and retirement savings benefits, along with an array of benefits, policies and programs to support employee well-being in every sense, from health and financial wellness to family and lifestyle resources.

Functie




Als Data Analyst binnen de afdeling Reporting Automotive ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergelijken van gegevens (klanten, bedrijven, intern), het analyseren en interpreteren van de resultaten om gepersonaliseerde rapporten op te stellen voor onze klanten of partners. Je speelt een sleutelrol omdat je verantwoordelijk bent voor de kwaliteit van de gegevens en vaak zal samenwerken met verschillende teams (Claims, IT, Productie, Client Manager, Boekhouding).




Je taken zijn gevarieerd:




Je maakt, beheert en modelleert rapporten en zorgt ervoor dat de benodigde gegevens volgens de vastgestelde deadlines worden geleverd.

Je zorgt voor de levering van verschillende operationele taken.




Profiel

Je beheerst de Office-suite goed, vooral Excel (gevorderd niveau).
Je kent en kunt de "Power Tools" gebruiken.
Je hebt een analytische geest, bent goed met cijfers en gegevensverwerking.
Je kan zelfstandig of in teamverband werken.
Je bent georganiseerd en je kan goed je prioriteiten stellen.




Interesse?

Title: Sales Data Analyst (m/f/*)
Description:
Job Description

Collaborate with Innovative 3Mers Around the World

Choosing where to start and grow your career has a major impact on your professional and personal life, so it‚Äôs equally important you know that the company that you choose to work at, and its leaders, will support and guide you. With a diversity of people, global locations, technologies and products, 3M is a place where you can collaborate with curious, creative 3Mers.

The Impact You‚Äôll Make in this Role

As a Business Analyst, you will be part of the Consumer Business Group, responsible for the commercialization of worldwide leading brands including Scotch¬Æ, Scotch Blue‚Ñ¢, Command‚Ñ¢, Scotch-Brite‚Ñ¢, Post-it¬Æ, 3M, Futuro‚Ñ¢, Nexcare‚Ñ¢, among others and you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world.

Here, You Will Make An Impact By



Determining Advanced Analysis and Insight Generation: Leveraging retailers and distributors' point of sales (POS) data, syndicated data, and shopper data to generate actionable insights.
Driving POS Growth and Mitigating Declines: Utilize your analytical expertise to develop strategies that enhance POS growth, while identifying and addressing potential declines through effective category management.
Playing a pivotal role in executing category management strategies. This involves deep dives into category performance, identifying growth opportunities, optimizing product assortment, and providing guidance on pricing and promotional strategies.
Influencing Partnership with Key Accounts: Build and maintain strong relationships with retailer/distributor key accounts within EMEA, influencing decision-making through data-driven insights and category management expertise.
Collaborating with all business analysts to implement Consumer Business Group global analytic strategies and tactics, ensuring alignment with overall business objectives.



Your Skills And Expertise

To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M is looking for candidates who must have the following qualifications:



Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree or higher from an accredited institution preferably in Business, Economics, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field.
Expert Experience in business analytics or a related relevant customer market with a preference for experience in the FMCG industry.
Category Management demonstrated expertise and data-driven decision making.
Language Proficiency: Fluent in French AND English is a must
Communication Skills: Excellent storytelling and presentation skills, capable of translating complex data into actionable insights. Proficiency in presenting to clients.



Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:



Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and data interpretation skills, with proficiency in Microsoft Power BI.
Technical Proficiency: Familiarity with planogramming software (e.g., JDA Space Planner), and an understanding of data modeling techniques.
Leadership Qualities: Proven leadership skills with the ability to influence key stakeholders and drive implementation of strategic initiatives.



Supporting Your Well-being

3M offers many programs to help you live your best life ‚Äì both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, 3M regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope.

Resources for You

For more details on what happens before, during and after the interview process, check out the Insights for Candidates page at 3M.com/careers. If you have further questions please reach out to Max (our AI Virtual Assistant) via our Career Page.



At 3M, diversity & inclusion are essential to innovation. We seek and value differences in people! This Job ad is addressed to all potential candidates. As an equal opportunity employer 3M will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on the basis of religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability. If you want to discover more about D&I at 3M, please visit http://go.3M.com/4i9C

As an equal opportunity employer 3M will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on the basis of race/ethnicity, nationality, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy/maternity-related matters, age or disability, or any other relevant characteristic protected under applicable local law.

Please note: your application may not be considered if you do not provide your education and work history, either by: 1) uploading a resume, or 2) entering the information into the application fields directly.

Carefully read these Terms of Use before using this website. Your access to and use of this website and application for a job at 3M are conditioned on your acceptance and compliance with these terms.

Please access the linked document by clicking here, select the country where you are applying for employment, and review. Before submitting your application, you will be asked to confirm your agreement with the terms.

Title: Power BI Specialist
Description:
Who are we?

CFE is a multidisciplinary group (listed on Euronext Brussels) active in Belgium, Luxembourg and Poland in 4 businesses segments with high growth potential because they have the opportunity to shape the world of tomorrow:

Real Estate Development
Multitechnical
Construction & Renovation
Sustainable Investments

With more than 3100 employees and a long experience and expertise acquired since its foundation in 1880, the CFE Group aims to challenge the status quo and create positive change by successfully addressing environmental and social challenges for the well-being of future generations. The CFE Group achieves this ambition by placing sustainability, innovation and respect for employees at the heart of its strategy and by offering its customers end-to-end solutions.




Your Role & Responsabilities

Promote and integrate dashboards: Take an active role in the promotion, definition, and introduction of various dashboards to make data a strategic part of the organization's activities.
Create and maintain dashboards: Use your technical expertise to design and maintain dashboards based on data from different sources.
Translate business needs: Collaborate with business partners to define and translate their requirements into user-friendly dashboards and reports.
Coordinate with stakeholders: Guide internal and external partners in developing necessary interfaces, extractors, and reports.
Dashboard governance: Establish reporting governance to ensure dashboards are consistent in design, methodology, and use a "single version of the truth."
Train and support users: Empower key users with training and support to help them become self-sufficient in creating and maintaining dashboards and reports.
Lead projects and initiatives: Oversee projects, initiatives, and tasks related to reporting, ensuring they are delivered on time, within scope, and within budget.
Documentation and reporting: Keep functional and technical documentation up-to-date and report regularly on project progress to stakeholders.
Risk management: Identify and proactively escalate issues, risks, and concerns when necessary.
Standardization and optimization: Stay informed about industry best practices and propose functional improvements and standardizations.
Manage external consultants: Supervise external consultants assigned to your projects, initiatives, and tasks.
Provide technical assistance: Offer support to end users when required, while promoting standard application setups.




Your Profile

You hold a bachelor‚Äôs degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Data Analytics, or a related field.
You have at least 5 years of experience in reporting and dashboarding, as well as 3 years of project management experience in a complex organization.
You are an expert in Power BI, with solid expertise in Power Automate, Power Apps, MS SQL, MS SharePoint, and MS Dataverse, along with knowledge of ETL processes. Familiarity with tools such as Tableau, Qlik Sense, IBM Cognos, SAS BI, and Google Data is a plus.
You have high-level knowledge of industry best practices.
You are fluent in Dutch, French, and English, enabling seamless communication across diverse teams.
You demonstrate strong technical expertise in data modeling, ITIL frameworks, and technical design, with a focus on delivering actionable insights and impactful solutions.
You excel in problem-solving and analytical thinking, tackling challenges effectively while maintaining a strategic perspective.
You possess excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills, facilitating collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
You are proactive, accountable, and detail-oriented, with a focus on achieving results and driving productivity.
You thrive in a team environment while being able to work autonomously, encouraging collaboration and knowledge sharing.
You stay updated on emerging technological trends and demonstrate a passion for innovation and self-development.




What‚Äôs in it for you?

Come as You Are: At CFE, we value diversity, equity and inclusion. Our company culture embraces and celebrates individuality, fostering a workplace that is completely free from any form of harassment, bias, or discrimination. We encourage all qualified applicants, regardless of gender, to apply.




What We Offer: Besides great colleagues and a fantastic new wooden HQ in Brussels, you will be offered a competitive compensation & benefits package including:

A full-time position with the possibility of hybrid working and the ability to flex your hours as you need.
An attractive remuneration package with many advantages such as a competitive base pay, a range of extralegal benefits as: sustainable transport options (mobility budget or lease car), lunch vouchers, a pension savings scheme and affiliation at a hospitalization insurance plan.
Opportunities for professional growth and development in various areas.
A collaborative and supportive team culture.
A challenging and dynamic work environment.

Show more

With more than 3100 employees and a long experience and expertise acquired since its foundation in 1880, the CFE Group aims to challenge the status quo and create positive change by successfully addressing environmental and social challenges for the well-being of future generations. The CFE Group achieves this ambition by placing sustainability, innovation and respect for employees at the heart of its strategy and by offering its customers end-to-end solutions.


Your Role & Responsabilities

  • Promote and integrate dashboards: Take an active role in the promotion, definition, and introduction of various dashboards to make data a strategic part of the organization's activities.
  • Create and maintain dashboards: Use your technical expertise to design and maintain dashboards based on data from different sources.
  • Translate business needs: Collaborate with business partners to define and translate their requirements into user-friendly dashboards and reports.
  • Coordinate with stakeholders: Guide internal and external partners in developing necessary interfaces, extractors, and reports.
  • Dashboard governance: Establish reporting governance to ensure dashboards are consistent in design, methodology, and use a "single version of the truth."
  • Train and support users: Empower key users with training and support to help them become self-sufficient in creating and maintaining dashboards and reports.
  • Lead projects and initiatives: Oversee projects, initiatives, and tasks related to reporting, ensuring they are delivered on time, within scope, and within budget.
  • Documentation and reporting: Keep functional and technical documentation up-to-date and report regularly on project progress to stakeholders.
  • Risk management: Identify and proactively escalate issues, risks, and concerns when necessary.
  • Standardization and optimization: Stay informed about industry best practices and propose functional improvements and standardizations.
  • Manage external consultants: Supervise external consultants assigned to your projects, initiatives, and tasks.
  • Provide technical assistance: Offer support to end users when required, while promoting standard application setups.


Your Profile

  • You hold a bachelor‚Äôs degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Data Analytics, or a related field.
  • You have at least 5 years of experience in reporting and dashboarding, as well as 3 years of project management experience in a complex organization.
  • You are an expert in Power BI, with solid expertise in Power Automate, Power Apps, MS SQL, MS SharePoint, and MS Dataverse, along with knowledge of ETL processes. Familiarity with tools such as Tableau, Qlik Sense, IBM Cognos, SAS BI, and Google Data is a plus.
  • You have high-level knowledge of industry best practices.
  • You are fluent in Dutch, French, and English, enabling seamless communication across diverse teams.
  • You demonstrate strong technical expertise in data modeling, ITIL frameworks, and technical design, with a focus on delivering actionable insights and impactful solutions.
  • You excel in problem-solving and analytical thinking, tackling challenges effectively while maintaining a strategic perspective.
  • You possess excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills, facilitating collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
  • You are proactive, accountable, and detail-oriented, with a focus on achieving results and driving productivity.
  • You thrive in a team environment while being able to work autonomously, encouraging collaboration and knowledge sharing.
  • You stay updated on emerging technological trends and demonstrate a passion for innovation and self-development.


What‚Äôs in it for you?

Come as You Are: At CFE, we value diversity, equity and inclusion. Our company culture embraces and celebrates individuality, fostering a workplace that is completely free from any form of harassment, bias, or discrimination. We encourage all qualified applicants, regardless of gender, to apply.


What We Offer: Besides great colleagues and a fantastic new wooden HQ in Brussels, you will be offered a competitive compensation & benefits package including:

  • A full-time position with the possibility of hybrid working and the ability to flex your hours as you need.
  • An attractive remuneration package with many advantages such as a competitive base pay, a range of extralegal benefits as: sustainable transport options (mobility budget or lease car), lunch vouchers, a pension savings scheme and affiliation at a hospitalization insurance plan.
  • Opportunities for professional growth and development in various areas.
  • A collaborative and supportive team culture.
  • A challenging and dynamic work environment.

Title: Junior Clinical Data Analyst (BE)
Description:
CluePoints is an innovative, fast-growing company and the premier provider of Risk-Based Monitoring and Data Quality Oversight solutions to clinical research organizations. Our products enable both risk planning and operational risk monitoring, and utilize advanced statistical algorithms to determine the quality of clinical trial data both during and following study execution. CluePoints is seeking outstanding candidates with strong data analytics aptitude and a passion for delivery excellence, to help drive customer success and broad adoption of the CluePoints solution.




Responsibilities:

Perform the technical configuration of the CluePoints solution for clinical studies based on customer requirements
Perform analyses using the CluePoints Central Monitoring Platform ‚Äì diagnosing and explaining anomalies identified in the clinical study data
Summarize findings and support the communication of results to customers (both written report and oral presentation)
Participate in the continuous improvement and development of our product solutions and operational processes
Provide consultation and related operational support to customers as needed, with the help of more senior Data Analysts and/or the CluePoints Project Lead
Ensure that appropriate documentation is produced and maintained for each study
Assist Business Development and Quality Assurance teams in responding to client questions and requests (e.g., RFP responses, audits, etc.)




Qualifications:

College degree, preferably in a scientific or technical discipline
0-2 years of experience in a clinical research environment.
Experience with one or more programming languages (preferably SAS)
At least one first experience in clinical trials (data management or CRA)
Aptitude for mathematical and statistical concepts
Excellent English oral and written communication skills
Experience and ability to work well in a team environment
Ability to thrive in a fast-moving environment, under time and resource constraints
High degree of accuracy and attention to detail
Experience with CDISC databases is a plus













Top Reasons to Work with Us

Flexibility is part of our DNA

Hybrid role (2-3 days per week at the office)
Our offices provide a fun atmosphere: PS4, foosball, and our newly added dartboard
Many activities are organized during the year such as team lunches, happy hours, team buildings, holiday parties and many other celebrations!
At CluePoints, learning, training and personal growth are part of the game: you‚Äôll have access to online training materials, certifications sponsored by the company, personal growth plans, and career paths to explore new opportunities.
You‚Äôll work with a fast-growing, multi-disciplinary and international team representing over 20 different nationalities, in an English-speaking working environment.
You‚Äôll have a challenging and rewarding job in an ambitious and fast-paced technology scale-up that has received many national and international awards.
Last but not least, we offer competitive salary and benefits !
