Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Freelance Senior Data Analyst (7+ Years)




Location: Brussels (Hybrid)

Duration: 18-Month Contract

Industry: Technology

Start Date: ASAP / Flexible




About the Opportunity

We are looking for a Freelance Senior Data Analyst to support our data-driven transformation. Based in Brussels, our technology company is growing fast, and data is at the heart of every strategic decision. This freelance role offers the freedom of flexible work, combined with the opportunity to influence real business outcomes from day one.




As part of a cross-functional initiative to improve user retention, you‚Äôll analyse behavioural data across the platform to identify key drop-off points, usage trends, and content engagement levels. Your work will help shape a new data model to better predict churn and inform the roadmap for personalized user journeys. You'll collaborate with product managers and customer success teams to turn these insights into concrete feature updates and communication strategies.




Responsibilities

Partner with teams across Product, Marketing, and Engineering to define metrics, track performance, and identify areas for improvement
Build and maintain dashboards and reports to enable stakeholders to make informed, data-backed decisions
Lead deep-dive analyses on customer behaviour, product performance, and operational efficiency
Develop predictive models and clustering techniques to support business forecasting and segmentation
Support data governance efforts and contribute to best practices in data quality, accessibility, and documentation
Present insights and strategic recommendations clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences




Qualifications

7+ years of experience in data analysis, ideally in a fast-paced tech environment
Strong skills in SQL and Python or R, with a solid understanding of statistical methods
Proficiency in BI tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Looker
Experience with cloud-based data environments (BigQuery, Snowflake, AWS, or Azure)
Excellent problem-solving abilities and a proactive, analytical mindset
Strong communication skills in English; knowledge of Dutch or French is a plus

Title: Data analyst Qliksense (Freelance)
Description:
As data analytics & reporting specialist you will be the connection between strategy, business and technology. As such were looking for talent who can structure requests associated with overarching projects. Facilitate where needed the translation of business requirements through mock ups and design thinking. You will focus on creating reports from these inputs and collaborates with stakeholders to derive data insight through analysis as they continue to drive adoption.

The role balances coordinating, analysing and execution subject to the experience level of the hire. You will work closely with various business units and transversal strategic initiatives.

Key responsibilities;


Be a catalyst to structure BI-processes in collaboration with the BI manager.
Ensure our data products and reports are properly documented.
Facilitate the application of ITIL and SDLC processes with a key focus on practical real world application.
Collect, analyse and advise on business requirements
Build prototypes, reports & dashboards in Qlik.
Create clear story lines for insight throughout our reporting portfolio.
Analyse data sets and contribute to the improvement of data quality across the organisation.
Test data, reports and dashboards as a means to driving trust in our products.
Facilitate the adoption of reporting products.



Practical information:


Minimum 1 day / week onsite to work with business partners is expected.
Multiple locations are applicable for the role; Brussel, Gent, Leuven amongst which youll alternate. Brussel being the main office.
Dutch or French is required, English is the working language.
Ability to communicate with technical and non-technical profiles.
High affinity with agile principles is a plus.
Work well in dynamic team structure with many different sources of work.



Key differentiator: youre pro-active and like to take initiative whilst reporting back on your learnings.

Title: Senior Analyst Report
Description:
The Role

We are looking for a Senior Analyst ‚Äì Reporting to provide analytical support and ensure accurate, high-quality reporting to meet business needs. This role involves interpreting complex data, optimizing data quality, and delivering insightful reports while ensuring compliance with governance standards. You will work closely with stakeholders to refine reporting requirements and drive automation initiatives.

Key Responsibilities


Produce and manage detailed reports, ensuring data accuracy and timely distribution.
Communicate reporting needs, clarify requests, and validate results with stakeholders.
Standardize reports and oversee automation processes in line with company standards.
Identify and resolve data inconsistencies, optimizing data quality and integrity.
Analyze trends, detect recurring issues, and propose process improvements.
Develop complex calculations and simulation models for in-depth data analysis.
Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and internal guidelines.
Prioritize internal reporting needs and oversee functional validation (UAT) of reports.
Provide support in creating user guides and educating stakeholders on governance rules.


What You Bring


Education: Bachelor's or Master‚Äôs degree.
Experience: At least 3 years in reporting, data analysis, or business intelligence.
Languages: Strong proficiency in English and a second national language.


Technical Skills


Advanced data processing and analysis capabilities.
Strong understanding of business data and operational challenges.
Proficiency in Power BI, SQL, and office applications.
Knowledge of project management principles.


Why Join Us?


Be part of a dynamic team driving data-driven decision-making.
Work on impactful projects that improve reporting efficiency.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams in a fast-paced environment.


If you have a passion for data, reporting, and process optimization, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

#Analyst #reporting #LandmarkGlobal #bpostgroup

Title: Power BI Expert
Description:
Are you a Power BI Expert with at least 5 years of professional experience?




Then this would be a great opportunity for you to join an international and multicultural company like Synechron. We are a global consulting and technology organization providing innovative solutions to the financial services industry.




In order to pursue our growth in Luxembourg, we are looking for a new talent:




Power BI Expert




What would be your mission?

As Power BI Expert, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining interactive dashboards and reports. This role requires strong analytical skills, proficiency in Power BI, and the ability to translate complex data into meaningful insights. You will work as a Power BI Expert within the Cash development team.




What would be your tasks?

Migrating the data from the CashSSP datawarehouse to the cloud.
Converting a large number of static PDF reports (SAP BO) into Power BI reports that meet the same business requirements.
This new data warehouse will be leveraged by 12 European countries, making it a crucial tool for strategic decision-making and operational efficiency.
Coaching & Mentoring
Data Modeling & Report Development: Designing, implementing, and maintaining robust semantic models to support scalable, performant, consistent reporting ‚Äî including support for self-service analytics by business users; Developing and optimizing Power BI reports and dashboards that deliver clear insights aligned with business requirements.
Collaborating with stakeholders to ensure the alignment of technical solutions with business objectives.




What kind of profile are we looking for?

At least 5 years of experience as a Power BI Expert in a complex, enterprise environment
Expertise in DAX, Power Query, and Power BI Desktop/Service
Solid experience in data modeling, data transformation, and data integration
Ability to design semantic layers that ensure data consistency and performance
Knowledge of Row-Level Security (RLS) implementation in a multi-country, multi-user environment
Understanding of different data connectivity modes (Import, DirectQuery, Live Connection) and when to use them
Experience with Power BI deployment pipelines, workspace structuring, and lifecycle management
Strong understanding of data visualization best practices, including layout, user experience, and accessibility
Ability to translate business requirements into impactful dashboards and visuals
Strong communication and mentoring skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences
Team-oriented mindset and ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams
Fluency in English and French




An asset:

Power BI certification
Experience in creating paginated reports
Familiarity with Azure or other cloud platforms
Knowledge of SAP BO to analyze existing reports
Experience working directly with business stakeholders to gather and refine reporting needs




Why join Synechron?

We are always looking for new talents, ready to immerse themselves in challenging projects with continuous learning opportunities.

We are offering you:

- A specialization in Finance: we can assist you in planning your career and offer all the necessary training and opportunities for development. (IT, Finance, coaching, personal development).

- We customize your training to fit your career path!

- An international presence: we encourage your mobility projects within our subsidiaries.

- Careful selection and support of our consultants: we engage in duration.

- A true spirit of conviviality in a dynamic and collaborative environment punctuated by regular events.

- An attractive salary package including a fixed and variable compensation as well as extra-legal advantages.

Ce poste s'adresse √† un(e) jeune dipl√¥m√©(e) ma√Ætrisant Excel, ayant une bonne compr√©hension de Power BI (ou d√©sireux(se) d'apprendre), et capable de comprendre des syst√®mes complexes. Tout cela avec l'ambition d'impacter le business, d'augmenter la part de march√©, d'am√©liorer la satisfaction des clients, d'accro√Ætre la rentabilit√© des marques et de suivre la transition √©nerg√©tique.

Profil

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Job Title: Freelance Data Engineer

Location: Belgium (Remote/Hybrid)

Contract Type: Freelance

Languages Required: Fluent in French or Dutch (English is a plus)




Role Overview

Our client, a leading organization based in Belgium, is looking for an experienced Freelance Data Engineer to design, build, and optimize data pipelines and infrastructure. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience with modern data platforms and tools, and be fluent in French or Dutch to effectively collaborate with local teams.




Key Responsibilities

Develop and maintain scalable ETL/ELT pipelines to support analytics and data-driven applications.
Build and optimize data architecture for ingestion, processing, and storage of large-scale datasets.
Collaborate with data architects, analysts, and business stakeholders to understand requirements and deliver solutions.
Implement and monitor data quality, security, and compliance (including GDPR).
Work with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) to manage infrastructure and deployment.
Document data flows, architecture, and operational procedures.




Required Skills and Experience

3+ years of experience in a Data Engineering role.
Strong programming skills in Python, Scala, or Java.
Solid experience with ETL tools (e.g., Apache Airflow, dbt, Talend).
Proficiency with SQL and relational/non-relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, BigQuery, Snowflake, MongoDB).
Experience working with cloud environments and data services (AWS Glue, Azure Data Factory, GCP Dataflow, etc.).
Understanding of data governance, data quality, and security standards.
Fluent in French or Dutch; good knowledge of English is a plus.




Nice to Have

Experience with streaming data technologies (e.g., Apache Kafka, Spark Streaming).
Exposure to CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices.
Familiarity with BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker).
Prior work experience with Belgian or EU clients.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Quantitative analyst

About US (GEMS):

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales (GEMS) provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE‚Äôs assets and contributing to value creation.

ENGIE is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services with a leading energy management business, piloted by its entity "Global Energy Management & Sales" who built its savoir-faire managing the Group‚Äôs large and diverse asset portfolio over 20+ years.

3,600 employees around the world develop our solutions, through +20 international business platforms. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our 190,000 clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors and industrials. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.

Our 4 areas of expertise :


Asset management
Energy transition services
Energy supply & global commodities
Risk management & market access


At GEMS we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation while preserving the right work/life balance for you.

More info on GEMS Hub ( https://gems.engie.com ) or LinkedIn ( https://www.linkedin.com/company/engie-global-energy-management-solutions ).

Context: The Expertise Center (EC) Quantitative Research and Modeling (QRM) within GEMS is a team of around 40 quantitative analysts. It‚Äôs mission is to provide advanced quantitative expertise to all Business Platforms (BP) of GEMS. The quantitative analyst will be part of the ‚ÄúPower & Emissions‚Äù quant team (approximately 10 people) and will be supporting the different local business platforms, with a focus on the US Business Platform located in Houston. Role:

The quantitative analyst should design and provide robust quantitative tools that have a concrete impact on the power business:


Work very closely with the BP US, mainly with the Renewable and Batteries Trading teams. He / She needs to understand their business needs, and needs to provide them with high-quality quantitative support in their day to day activities.
Participate in enhancing the existing pricing and managing framework.
Deliver ad hoc tactical solutions as well as develop new pricers in the official pricing library.
Play a key role for developing new products, linked for example to the renewable and battery business (pricing, managing strategies, various risk indicators, ‚Ä¶).
Promote best coding practices that comply with general rules and standards.
Document and share knowledge across GEMS on the different models used within GEMS.


Hard skills:


Must have:

Strong Financial Mathematical background (probability, stochastic calculus, various numerical methods such as Monte Carlo, finite differences, ‚Ä¶)
Experience on different optimization methods
Strong coding experience (preferably C# and python), object oriented programming skills
Experience in a trading environment
Familiar with Git




Good to have:

Experience on the power markets

Soft skills:


Must have:

Practical and conceptual thinking
Ability to explain and convey messages about complex issues
Ability to deliver concrete solutions
Autonomy
Working together

Education and professional background:


Engineering or university degree (Master of PhD) in Computer Sciences, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Financial Engineering.
3 to 15 years of experience in a similar role.


Languages:


English


Travels: Regular travels to the US (Houston) are needed

If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!

Apply by attaching your updated CV, regardless your gender.

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales is committed to create a gender-neutral environment that unlocks the potential of everyone and provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals. All our positions are open to people with disabilities, please let your recruiter know if you need reasonable accommodations to be able to participate in the recruitment process, they will be happy to assist you.

About ENGIE:

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (‚Äúraison d‚Äô√™tre‚Äù) is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, power, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 96,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress.

Business Unit: GEMS

Divisie: GEMS - EC QUANTITATIVE RESEARCH & MODELING

Juridische entiteit: ENGIE GLOBAL MARKETS, BELGIAN BRANCH

Professionele werkervaring: Ervaren, (3-15 jaar ervaring)

Opleidingsniveau: WO / Master opleiding

Title: Data Analyst AWS
Description:
Wij zijn op zoek naar een analytische en gedreven Data Analyst die ervaring heeft met Amazon Web Services (AWS). In deze rol ben je verantwoordelijk voor het verzamelen, analyseren en visualiseren van data om waardevolle inzichten te bieden aan verschillende afdelingen binnen onze organisatie. Je werkt nauw samen met onze data engineers, business stakeholders en IT-teams om datagedreven besluitvorming te ondersteunen.

Wat ga je doen?


Verzamelen, transformeren en analyseren van grote datasets met behulp van AWS-diensten zoals Athena, Redshift, Glue, S3 en QuickSight.
Ontwikkelen van dashboards en rapportages die strategische inzichten bieden.
Meedenken over het verbeteren van datastructuren en processen.
Samenwerken met verschillende teams om data te vertalen naar concrete acties.


Wat breng je mee?


Minimaal 2-3 jaar ervaring als Data Analyst of in een vergelijkbare rol.
Sterke ervaring met AWS-diensten zoals S3, Redshift, Glue, Athena, en QuickSight.
Vaardig in SQL en idealiter ook Python of R.
Ervaring met datavisualisatietools (Power BI, Tableau, of QuickSight).
Analytisch sterk en in staat complexe vraagstukken eenvoudig te vertalen.


üîç Interesse?

Stuur je CV naar armend.haxhijaj@oliverjames.com.

Apply Now

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst

Job Location: Geneva, Switzerland

Job Term: Full-Time

The Opportunity

Picarro is transforming gas utility operations with innovative solutions for methane emissions management, risk-informed leak prioritization, and pipeline asset optimization. As a Data Analyst in Picarro's Gas Business Unit, you will play a critical role in developing analytical tools, generating insights from complex datasets, and driving operational improvements.

Reporting to the Sr. Director of Climate and Safety Solutions, you will work with cross-functional teams to develop ETL pipelines, automate data processing, and create reports that enhance internal decision-making and customer outcomes. The role is ideal for candidates with 1-2 years of experience or a recent Master's or Ph.D. graduate with strong data analysis skills.



Roles and Responsibilities


Data Processing and ETL Development ‚Äì Build and optimize automation tools and ETL pipelines for cleaning, normalizing, and structuring large-scale sensor and operational data.
Analysis and Insights ‚Äì Conduct data analysis on time-series, sensor, and geospatial datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and operational improvements.
Collaboration ‚Äì Work with product management, engineering, and customer success teams to ensure data workflows meet business needs.
Automation ‚Äì Develop scripts and processes in Python and SQL to improve data ingestion, processing, and reporting.
Documentation and Reporting ‚Äì Maintain clear documentation of methodologies, workflows, and results to support internal teams and customers.
Customer Support ‚Äì Assist in generating analytical deliverables and visualizations to support customer projects and business objectives.




Skills and Abilities


Technical Proficiency ‚Äì Strong Python and SQL skills for data automation and analysis.
Statistical and Analytical Skills ‚Äì Solid foundation in statistics, including hypothesis testing and uncertainty quantification.
Data Engineering Exposure ‚Äì Experience with ETL, data cleaning, and automation techniques.
GIS (Preferred but Not Required) ‚Äì Familiarity with GIS tools (e.g., ESRI ArcGIS, QGIS) for geospatial analysis is a plus.
Communication ‚Äì Ability to translate technical findings into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Problem-Solving ‚Äì Proactive approach to improving data processes and solving data quality challenges.


Qualifications


Master's or Ph.D. in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field (or Bachelor's with 1-2 years of experience in a relevant role).
Experience in Python, SQL, and data automation workflows.
Exposure to geospatial, time-series, or measurement data.
Industry experience in natural gas, utilities, or infrastructure is a plus.
Experience with ETL development, reporting automation, or cloud-based data processing is preferred.

Title: Data Analyst (f|m|d) (80-100%) - Zurich - Hybrid Work
Description:
Company Description

Welcome to SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG

We are a pioneering network of online marketplaces and an innovative European digital company that simplifies people's lives with future-oriented products.

Job Description

Join our General Marketplaces team as our new Data Analyst and become a part of SMG!

We are currently looking for a Data Analyst who will actively contribute to improving our business analytics capabilities, ensure tracking and data consistency, define and spot optimization potential in our buying and selling conversion funnels across our different platforms, and work as a data evangelist across our company by facilitating knowledge sharing sessions and training. As a member of our Data Team, you will spend time gathering insights and recommendations about our users' behavior, democratizing data access at the company, and promoting the correct use of data and analytics.

About The Position


Perform business and feature analysis and deep dives for management and product stakeholders
Own the Tableau self-service platform and main reports
Creation and maintenance of the different user conversion funnels on Google Analytics for the brands within General Marketplaces
Define GA tracking together with our front-end engineers, including testing the implementation and maintaining an events track book
Carrying reporting and analytics onboarding training for other employees of the company (especially PMs) to allow them to become self-sufficient and build their own, more specific reports and funnels
Performing internal data quality audits and reviews on internal tools


Qualifications

What we are looking for


3-5 years of experience in data analysis, storytelling, visualization, and effectively presenting insights about (complex) topics to stakeholders
3+ years of experience working with Google Analytics: building funnels and reports on the analytical side, and tracking implementation on the tech side
Experience with the GA4 and Firebase apps tracking and GA events tracking test tools such as XTag or GTM
Knowledge of A/B testing frameworks
Knowledge of Tableau and SQL is a big plus
Analytical and problem solving mindset, ability to dig into potential issues and propose solutions for optimization
Ability to quickly onboard and understand our business model, including how various events and transactions are captured in our data structures
Proactive approach to learn and find solutions outside direct area of competence
Fluency in English mandatory
German is a plus


Additional Information

Why you should join us

At SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG, you‚Äôll be part of an international and diverse team of friendly and supportive colleagues. We embrace a hybrid work model, giving you the flexibility to work from our modern office in Zurich Oerlikon and your own home office.

Benefits You‚Äôll Love


Flexible working hours and a culture of trust
Hybrid work set-up
40-hour week (flexitime with a cap at 45 hours)
6 weeks of vacation (with the possibility to buy 10 additional days)
Great office facilities with opportunities for plenty of social interactions, after-work-ap√©ros, and regular company-wide events
Free SBB half-fare card and you travel 1st class between SMG locations in Switzerland
Gender-neutral fair-pay
18 weeks maternity and 6 weeks paternity leave (also in case of adoption)
Choose your hardware (Mac or Windows + Monitor for home) and cell phone (iPhone, Samsung or Google Pixel)


Ready to make an impact?

Then apply now with your current CV, and feel free to submit any additional documents you find helpful to boost your application.

We are looking forward to getting to know you!

About Us

SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG. is a pioneering network of online marketplaces and cutting-edge European digital company that simplifies people‚Äôs lives with innovative products.

SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG. provides customers the best tools to meet their life decision needs. The portfolio includes Real Estate (ImmoScout24, Homegate, Flatfox, alle-immobilien.ch, Immostreet.ch, home.ch, Publimmo, Acheter-Louer.ch, CASASOFT, IAZI), Automotive (AutoScout24, MotoScout24), General Marketplaces (anibis.ch, tutti.ch, Ricardo) and Finance & Insurance (FinanceScout24, moneyland.ch).

The company was founded in November 2021 by TX Group AG, Ringier AG, La Mobili√®re and General Atlantic.

Disclaimer

SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG primarily engages directly with candidates. We do not accept unsolicited resumes or candidate profiles from recruitment agencies unless we have specifically requested their assistance for particular roles. Any submissions made without a prior request from our Talent Acquisition team will not be acknowledged or considered. We appreciate the understanding and cooperation of recruitment agencies in respecting this policy.

HTML:
Company Description

Welcome to SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG

We are a pioneering network of online marketplaces and an innovative European digital company that simplifies people's lives with future-oriented products.

Job Description

Join our General Marketplaces team as our new Data Analyst and become a part of SMG!

We are currently looking for a Data Analyst who will actively contribute to improving our business analytics capabilities, ensure tracking and data consistency, define and spot optimization potential in our buying and selling conversion funnels across our different platforms, and work as a data evangelist across our company by facilitating knowledge sharing sessions and training. As a member of our Data Team, you will spend time gathering insights and recommendations about our users' behavior, democratizing data access at the company, and promoting the correct use of data and analytics.

About The Position

  • Perform business and feature analysis and deep dives for management and product stakeholders
  • Own the Tableau self-service platform and main reports
  • Creation and maintenance of the different user conversion funnels on Google Analytics for the brands within General Marketplaces
  • Define GA tracking together with our front-end engineers, including testing the implementation and maintaining an events track book
  • Carrying reporting and analytics onboarding training for other employees of the company (especially PMs) to allow them to become self-sufficient and build their own, more specific reports and funnels
  • Performing internal data quality audits and reviews on internal tools

Qualifications

What we are looking for

  • 3-5 years of experience in data analysis, storytelling, visualization, and effectively presenting insights about (complex) topics to stakeholders
  • 3+ years of experience working with Google Analytics: building funnels and reports on the analytical side, and tracking implementation on the tech side
  • Experience with the GA4 and Firebase apps tracking and GA events tracking test tools such as XTag or GTM
  • Knowledge of A/B testing frameworks
  • Knowledge of Tableau and SQL is a big plus
  • Analytical and problem solving mindset, ability to dig into potential issues and propose solutions for optimization
  • Ability to quickly onboard and understand our business model, including how various events and transactions are captured in our data structures
  • Proactive approach to learn and find solutions outside direct area of competence
  • Fluency in English mandatory
  • German is a plus

Additional Information

Why you should join us

At SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG, you‚Äôll be part of an international and diverse team of friendly and supportive colleagues. We embrace a hybrid work model, giving you the flexibility to work from our modern office in Zurich Oerlikon and your own home office.

Benefits You‚Äôll Love

  • Flexible working hours and a culture of trust
  • Hybrid work set-up
  • 40-hour week (flexitime with a cap at 45 hours)
  • 6 weeks of vacation (with the possibility to buy 10 additional days)
  • Great office facilities with opportunities for plenty of social interactions, after-work-ap√©ros, and regular company-wide events
  • Free SBB half-fare card and you travel 1st class between SMG locations in Switzerland
  • Gender-neutral fair-pay
  • 18 weeks maternity and 6 weeks paternity leave (also in case of adoption)
  • Choose your hardware (Mac or Windows + Monitor for home) and cell phone (iPhone, Samsung or Google Pixel)

Ready to make an impact?

Then apply now with your current CV, and feel free to submit any additional documents you find helpful to boost your application.

We are looking forward to getting to know you!

About Us

SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG. is a pioneering network of online marketplaces and cutting-edge European digital company that simplifies people‚Äôs lives with innovative products.

SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG. provides customers the best tools to meet their life decision needs. The portfolio includes Real Estate (ImmoScout24, Homegate, Flatfox, alle-immobilien.ch, Immostreet.ch, home.ch, Publimmo, Acheter-Louer.ch, CASASOFT, IAZI), Automotive (AutoScout24, MotoScout24), General Marketplaces (anibis.ch, tutti.ch, Ricardo) and Finance & Insurance (FinanceScout24, moneyland.ch).

The company was founded in November 2021 by TX Group AG, Ringier AG, La Mobili√®re and General Atlantic.

Disclaimer

SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG primarily engages directly with candidates. We do not accept unsolicited resumes or candidate profiles from recruitment agencies unless we have specifically requested their assistance for particular roles. Any submissions made without a prior request from our Talent Acquisition team will not be acknowledged or considered. We appreciate the understanding and cooperation of recruitment agencies in respecting this policy.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Position: Senior ERP Data Analyst

Location: Geneva, Switzerland (Hybrid)




Job Description

Experience Level:

7+ years of experience in ERP data analysis, with hands-on exposure to end-to-end business processes across finance (Record-to-Report), procurement (Procure-to-Pay), and sales (Order-to-Cash)‚Äã
Demonstrated history of analyzing and optimizing data in these functional areas is expected.




Preferred Industry Background:

Experience working in large enterprises or industries with complex worldwide financial operations (e.g. manufacturing, retail, or consumer goods) is preferred.
Candidates should be familiar with multi-department ERP environments and high transaction volumes, as this role spans P2P, O2C, and R2R processes.




Certifications:

ERP certification(s) preferred




Technical Skills:

Strong expertise in enterprise ERP systems (SAP ECC experience is strongly preferred)‚Äã.
Deep knowledge of key ERP modules in Finance, Procurement, and Sales and how data flows through these processes.
Proficiency in SAP data analytics and querying tools: SAP Query, SAP ABAP Query, SAP Data Browser.
Ability to generate reports and perform data validation across P2P, O2C, and R2R data.
Skilled in process mapping and analysis ‚Äì capable of documenting end-to-end process flows (e.g. mapping how purchase orders to payments, or orders to cash receipts flow through the system) and identifying data dependencies/improvement opportunities.
Familiarity with business intelligence and reporting tools (such as SAP BW, Power BI) for building dashboards and visualizing ERP data insights.‚Äã




Soft Skills:

Strong interpersonal communication skills in English; other languages are an advantage.
Excellent stakeholder engagement and communication skills ‚Äì able to collaborate with finance, procurement, IT, and sales stakeholders and translate data findings into business insights‚Äã
A problem-solving, analytical mindset is critical for investigating data issues and identifying root causes or trends‚Äã
The candidate should be detail-oriented yet able to see the big picture, and adept at troubleshooting process/data problems. Additionally, strong organizational skills and the ability to work under deadlines in cross-functional teams (often acting as a bridge between technical teams and business users) are important‚Äã













About Us

We are a Brazilian company with over 35 years of experience in delivering IT services worldwide, ranging from IT outsourcing to application development or IT staffing. We have a direct presence in 41 countries, through our 70 offices located throughout the world. We have managed to become the preferred partner of many small-to-midsize local and regional companies as well. Most of our clients come from industries such as financial services, manufacturing, telecommunications, chemical, services, technology, public sector and utilities.

Stefanini has career opportunities locally and around the world for professionals interested in a vibrant, passionate, team-oriented workplace. If you are a customer-centric person with a "get it done" attitude, come over for coffee and a talk on your future career with us! Learn more about us on www.stefanini.com and join us on LinkedIn , Facebook and Instagram where we regularly post insights from our colleagues.

Title: Analytics & Insights - Paid Internship (m/f/x)
Description:
Job Location

Petit-Lancy

Job Description

Position: Analytics & Insights - Paid Internship (m/f/x)

Location: Geneva

Do you have passion to influence business strategy, product design, commercial vision, media landscape? Passion to drive the change, through deep consumer understanding and front-edge advanced analytics? And finally, are you available for a 6-months internship?

Then, this role is perfect for you!

In Analytics & Insights (A&I), we use our boundless curiosity to discover what consumers want, why they want it & how we can we influence them, through immersive exploration and data analytics.

We uncover unexpected insights and innovate the way P&G runs business.

A career in A&I will build your ability to influence and think strategically, across a breadth of experiences on multiple P&G business.

Your role as an Analytics & Insights Intern :


You will act as a business strategy consultant, guiding decisions of P&G management in several business domains (consumer, costumer, digital, ‚Ä¶);
You will be part of a multi-functional business team, working closely with Marketing, Finance, Sales, R&D and others, constantly exploring new opportunities for business growth;
You will combine analytical expertise and deep consumer understanding, to anticipate opportunities and answer critical business questions;
You will grow your skills day-in, day-out, improving your mastery in data analytics as well as immersive in-depth research. You will have the opportunity to explore new ways to learn and to connect with internal & external guides worldwide.


What we offer:


Responsibilities as of Day 1 ‚Äì You will be given concrete projects and feel the ownership for them from the beginning
Continuous Growth through working on real business challenges and mentoring‚Äì you will work with a team and receive both formal training as well as day-to-day mentoring from your manager, ensuring your skillset will grown day in-day out.
Opportunity to work in a dynamic and respectful work environment ‚Äì We live our Purpose, Values, and Principles daily. We value every individual and encourage initiatives promoting agility and work/life balance.


Job Qualifications

What we are looking for:

Masters Students with:


Strong analytical skills and Integrative thinking
Proven leadership and teamwork skills, with a ‚Äúcan-do‚Äù approach and an unusual skew to innovate
Ability to play a key role and influence across levels and functions.
Boundless curiosity and un-sane passion to generate results
Data Analytics background a plus


Additional expertise/certifications on the following areas will be valued but not required:


Work experience or certification in Market Research Techniques (Quantitative or Qualitative methods)
Work experience or certification in Visualization, Data transformation tools and/or programming (Tableau, Spotfire, PowerBI , JMP, SQL, R or Python, Alteryx, KNIME, RapidMiner)


WHO WE ARE:

P&G is one of the world‚Äôs largest consumer goods companies and home to iconic, loved and trusted brands, such as Dash¬Æ, Gillette¬Æ, Pantene¬Æ, Oral-B¬Æ, Swiffer¬Æ, Head & Shoulders¬Æ, Braun¬Æ, Fairy¬Æ.

For over 180 years, Procter & Gamble has grown in the market and changed the way business is done, thanks to Talents. We value leadership as well as mastery and offer fulfilling career opportunities that make us an unbeatable force in our industry.

At P&G #weseeequal

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

Due to legal restrictions, immigration sponsorship is available only for EU/EFTA nationalities. All candidates with nonEU/EFTA nationalities are encouraged to check out opportunities in countries where they can obtain a work permit.

Job Schedule

Full time

Job Number

R000114493

Job Segmentation

Internships (Job Segmentation)

Title: Logistics Data Analyst Intern
Description:
CONTEXT

In the context of the Luxury New Retail, Richemont Group is accelerating its logistics transformation reshaping our logistics network across all Regions.

Agility, Flexibility, Speed and Customer-centricity are the key drivers for a successful logistics transformation across our Maisons.

By joining our Group Logistics Business Performance team, you will contribute to the development, standardization, and optimization of our end-to-end logistics reporting and performance KPIs across all regions.

HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?

As a Logistics Data Analyst intern, you will play a key role in modernizing our data analytics ecosystem. You will support the migration of logistics databases to our new data lake in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) BigQuery and help transition all Power BI dashboards to Looker, ensuring seamless data visualization and reporting.

Key Responsibilities


Assist in migrating of logistics databases to the new data lake in GCP BigQuery.
Rebuild and optimize Power BI dashboards in Looker, ensuring accuracy and performance.
Process, clean, and validate data integrity for analytics.
Collaborate with logistics teams to identify and resolve data discrepancies in dashboards.
Document standard logistics performance metrics and best practices for reporting.
Participate in cross-functional logistics projects, contributing to data-driven decision-making.


HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

You are a student or recent graduate in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field. You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with an interest in data visualization and business intelligence.

You have experience in data processing, cleaning and validation to ensure data integrity.

You are autonomous, organized, with a proactive mindset to drive improvements and the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders.

You speak English fluently (French is a plus).

You are proficient in SQL and familiar with Power BI, Looker. Experience with Python and knowledge of GCP BigQuery is a plus.

HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?

This is a unique opportunity to gain deep insights into luxury logistics operations and luxury markets.

Exposure to cutting-edge BI technologies in a dynamic, international work environment

Hands-on experience in cloud data management, business intelligence, and cross-functional logistics teams collaboration.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
The L‚ÄôOCCITANE Group is a leading international manufacturer and retailer of premium and sustainable beauty and wellness products. The Group operates in 90 countries worldwide and has 3,000 retail outlets, including over 1,300 of its own stores. Within its portfolio of premium beauty brands that champion organic and natural ingredients are: L‚ÄôOCCITANE en Provence, Melvita, Erborian, L‚ÄôOCCITANE au Br√©sil, LimeLife by Alcone, ELEMIS, Sol de Janeiro and Dr. Vranjes Firenze.

With its nature-positive vision and entrepreneurial ethos, L‚ÄôOCCITANE Group is committed to investing in communities, biodiversity, reducing waste and to finding sustainable solutions to create a better and healthier planet. The mission statement of the Group is: With empowerment we positively impact people and regenerate nature.

Title: Circularity Data Analyst Intern
Description:
At Nespresso, we believe that we can elevate the world of coffee to drive a positive impact and be a force for good. We place our people at the heart of our success ‚Äì all 14,000 of them. To achieve this, we live by four behaviors. We Inspire, we Care, we Act, and we iNnovate. Want to be part of this exciting journey? Join the Nespresso team- Reimagine what coffee can be. Reimagine what you can become.

Position Snapshot

Location: Vevey, Switzerland

Company: Nespresso HQ

Act. Rate: Full-Time

Type of contract: Internship, 6 months

Start date: Mid-July 2025

Deadline for applications: May 19th

What We Offer At Nespresso

Exciting opportunities to develop your career your way

Flexible working arrangements - facilitating creativity and collaboration

A culture of diversity, inclusion and belonging where individuality is celebrated, and you can be the real you!

Quality and sustainability at the core of who we are and a critical vision of driving positive change

The opportunity to be part of a B Corp certified company and one of the world‚Äôs most trusted brands

Don‚Äôt hesitate to connect with us during the recruitment process to learn more.

Position Summary

As a Circularity Data Analyst Intern, you will support data collection and analysis related to material usage and waste generation in our operations. You will assist in identifying data sets, analyzing material flows, creating visualizations, and researching industry benchmarks. This internship provides valuable experience in sustainability practices and data analysis within a collaborative team.

A Day in the Life of a Circularity Data Analyst Intern


Assist in identifying and sourcing relevant data sets on material usage and waste generation within operations and factories.
Support data collection efforts by collaborating with team members to ensure accurate information.
Help analyze material flows to identify basic trends and patterns in usage and waste.
Create simple visualizations (charts, graphs) to present findings to the team.
Assist in proposing basic metrics for measuring circularity, such as material recovery rates.
Contribute to the process of updating and reporting on circularity metrics as needed.
Research industry benchmarks for circularity and summarize findings for team review.
Observe and learn about best practices from industry leaders to support improvement initiatives.


What Will Make You Successful


Student or fresh graduate in a Bachelor Master‚Äôs Degree in Data Science, Business Administration, Economics, or Sustainability
Passion and interest in Sustainability
Strong analytical mind, comfortable with data, curious and autonomous
Excellent presentation skills as well as a methodical and rigorous approach to tasks
Ability to navigate challenges effectively while maintaining a proactive and positive attitude.
Consolidated experience on Sharepoint and PowerBi would be a plus as well as a solid experience with Excel
Fluent in French and advanced-level English proficiency


Nespresso is committed to the accessibility of its recruitment process. If you require an adaptation during the recruitment process, please do let us know so we can support you effectively. All information will be treated confidentially.

At Nespresso, we‚Äôve built a culture of care and inclusion, making sure everyone can be their bold selves, while growing with the company. We innovate, dare to try, learn and scale up in a fast paced, digital and connected environment. With a diverse workforce made up of over 90 nationalities across 58 countries, you can be a part of an innovative culture, where supportive people help each other. One where anyone is encouraged to challenge the status quo and have an impact on the future for one of the biggest sustainable companies. Whatever your role, you‚Äôll find you can drive real change and spread your enthusiasm. Join the place where you can thrive, you feel, you belong, you are inspired to be and do your best.

Title: Quantitative Researcher
Description:
Systematic Quantitative Researcher - Entry/Junior Level - London/Paris/Zurich Office Locations




My client is a leading quantitative hedge fund with offices across Europe, North America and Asia. Their teams trade all traditional asset classes and cover a mix of MM/HFT, Stat Arb, Quant Macro, and Event-Driven strategies. The firm is looking for Junior Quantitative Researchers to be responsible for end-to-end strategy research. This is an excellent opportunity for PhD and Master‚Äôs graduates with a background in mathematics, statistics, computer science or a related field.




Successful candidates will work in a collaborative environment where they will gain exposure to the full research pipeline from the front office while working with developers and traders to optimize, implement, monitor and manage strategies.




The Role:

Collaborate with other quantitative researchers and developers to clean datasets, discuss research, and optimise systematic trading strategies.
Involvement in all aspects of the strategy research/trading pipeline, from research based on large datasets to the development, backtesting and monitoring of strategies in live trading.




Requirements:

The ideal candidate will have a Master's or PhD in a numerate field of study, such as Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, or Engineering.
Excellent coding ability in at least one language. Previous successful candidates are proficient users of Python, C++, Java, MATLAB, etc.
Experience/knowledge of finance from academic studies, internships or professional work.
Strong attention to detail, excellent problem-solving abilities, and the ability to work well in a collaborative environment.

Description:
80% - 100%

Nous allons r√©aliser ensemble

Dans le cadre de notre transformation digitale et de l‚Äôadoption d‚Äôune architecture Data Mesh, nous recherchons un¬∑e Business Data Analyst passionn√©¬∑e par la donn√©e et par la compr√©hension fine des enjeux m√©tier. Int√©gr√©¬∑e √† l‚Äôunit√© ¬´ Donn√©es et Innovation ¬ª (rattach√©e √† la direction informatique de SIG), vous participerez activement √† l‚Äôidentification, la formalisation et la priorisation des cas d‚Äôusage, √† la d√©finition des mod√®les de donn√©es et √† la conception des livrables.

La donn√©e est d√©sormais au c≈ìur de la transformation digitale de l‚Äôentreprise. Elle devient un actif strat√©gique √† forte valeur ajout√©e. Votre r√¥le sera de d√©tecter cette valeur et de faciliter son exploitation par nos √©quipes m√©tiers.

Vous √™tes convaincu¬∑e que la donn√©e est un levier de performance et d‚Äôinnovation ? Vous souhaitez travailler au plus proche des m√©tiers tout en collaborant avec des experts data et IT ? Alors ce poste est fait pour vous.

Votre √©nergie au service d‚Äôune Gen√®ve durable

En tant que Business Data Analyst, votre mission principale consiste √† :


Analyse et cadrage des besoins m√©tiers
Animer des ateliers de cadrage avec les √©quipes m√©tiers (interviews, co-construction, Data/Event Storming, etc.) afin d‚Äôidentifier les cas d‚Äôusage √† forte valeur ajout√©e et les traduire en exigences fonctionnelles claires ;
Contribuer √† la structuration des donn√©es m√©tiers en lien avec les principes du Domain-Driven Design ;
Participer activement √† la conception des couches Silver et Gold de l‚Äôarchitecture en m√©daillon, en lien avec les ing√©nieurs de donn√©es et les experts en mod√©lisation de donn√©es.



Gouvernance et documentation m√©tier
Formaliser et maintenir des glossaires, dictionnaires de donn√©es, r√©f√©rentiels m√©tier et autres artefacts favorisant une compr√©hension partag√©e des donn√©es ;
Contribuer √† la qualit√© des donn√©es, en collaborant √† la mise en place de tests de validation et √† la d√©finition de data contracts entre producteurs et consommateurs ;
Accompagner les √©quipes dans la conformit√© r√©glementaire et participer √† la documentation et √† la classification des donn√©es ;
Promouvoir une culture data partag√©e au sein de l‚Äôentreprise.

Title: Digital Content Insight Specialist
Description:
Title: Digital Content Insight Specialist

Location: Basel (Hybrid working)

Length of Contract: 7 months




Haybury have partnered with a leading global pharmaceutical organization within Switzerland who are seeking a talented Content Insight and Taxonomy Specialist to generate actionable insights to marketing campaigns alongside providing accurate dashboards and reports for business decision making.




This is a fantastic opportunity for an individual familiar with using systems such as Veeva supporting the analytics and growth frameworks for the digital content, ensuring accuracy and integrity is maintained on each activity.




Responsibilities:




Drive the development and rollout of dashboards that measure content performance across multiple brands and markets
Build and maintain scalable content tagging frameworks aligned to business needs
Lead taxonomy design and expansion to support new channels and campaigns
Support onboarding of global stakeholders as new brands/countries join the program
Collaborate with cross functional data teams and platform teams (e.g., Veeva Vault) to ensure data and system readiness
Facilitate continuous feedback loops to extract insights and guide strategic improvements
Contribute to training programs and documentation to support consistent adoption across teams







Qualifications:




Experience in content strategy, insights, or digital marketing analytics
Strong understanding of tagging, metadata, and taxonomy best practices
Ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights
Familiarity with enterprise content platforms (e.g., Veeva Vault) is a plus
Excellent collaboration skills across business and technical teams







Reach out to Rory.pitts@hayburysearch for a confidential discussion an further insight to the position.

Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst - Power & Gas
Description:
Senior Quantitative Analyst - Power & Gas Markets




Location: Geneva, Switzerland




Our client is looking for an experienced Quantitative Analyst to join their dynamic energy trading and analytics team in Geneva, Switzerland. This role combines market expertise with quantitative skills to drive power and gas market strategies forward.




About Our Client

Our client is a leading expert in the energy markets, providing critical analysis, forecasting, and modelling services. Their work supports key stakeholders in navigating the energy transition while identifying valuable investment opportunities in sustainable energy systems.




The Role

As a Senior Quantitative Analyst, you will apply sophisticated quantitative methods to model European power and gas markets, create price scenarios, and develop actionable insights for trading desks and clients.




Key Responsibilities

Model fundamental power and gas markets using proprietary systems and data analysis
Design and integrate new datasets to enhance trading strategies
Support trading desks in utilizing data for production systems
Develop and improve analytical products and methodologies
Manage data sourcing projects from acquisition through production
Communicate insights to clients and internal stakeholders
Collaborate with research and consulting teams




Required Qualifications

Degree in a technical or quantitative field (Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Data Science, or Economics)
Minimum 3 years of experience in quantitative analysis, data engineering, or similar roles
Strong programming skills in Python and familiarity with data analysis packages
Understanding of European energy markets and trading dynamics
Experience with financial data platforms is advantageous
Ability to work independently while collaborating in a global team environment
Excellent analytical thinking and problem-solving abilities
Strong communication skills in English; German proficiency is a plus




What Our Client Offers




An opportunity to join a team at the forefront of the energy transition, where your analytical expertise will contribute to sustainable market solutions while generating value for their clients and stakeholders.




For a confidential discussion about this exciting opportunity in Geneva, please submit your application with a detailed CV.

Title: Graduate Program Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Graduate Program Junior Data Analyst

Our company in Schachen employs a diverse group of highly skilled scientists, engineers, technicians, and process specialists from more than 15 nations and provides an important contribution to our company‚Äôs endeavor to bring new innovative medicines to patients as fast as possible, while applying highest quality standards to all activities.

Are you a highly talented biotechnology graduate seeking for a first or new challenge where you are free to take initiative? Would you like to experience working in one of the biggest multinationals in the pharmaceutical industry? We are looking for a graduate student in the field of Biotechnology/Bioinformatics, Data Science or a related discipline, who is searching for a challenging early career position in our innovative company. This role is part of our Future Career Graduate Program which consists in 1 year project-based contract.

Graduate Project

The Schachen Biotech Process Automation team is providing a strategic link between our early and late-stage pipeline and responsible to develop and maintain a ‚ÄòLine of Sight‚Äô between the stages.

The Data Analyst Graduate Project will consist in creating an innovative solution for finding and visualizing correlations between multiple sets and levels of real production process and analytical data. Implementation of PowerBI dashboards for visualization of real time data, focused on representing the key process parameters, key metrics and visualization of out-of-range values for the batches or campaigns. As an extended implementation, creating PowerBI Dashboards to represent a contextualized real time data from SAP (Bill Of Materials, Bill Of Parameters, Inventory) and MES data (Parameter Value Lists) for an overview and possible de-bottlenecking of the Batch/Campaign running.

This will also include working with intelligent automation solutions using AWS and Azure cloud capabilities and tooling, implementation of Power BI dashboards representing the process data and as well possibility of implementation of machine learning algorithms as well as Python or R programming.

As a graduate you should bring energy, knowledge, innovation to carry out the following


Collaborating with various business teams in an international setting to generate business understanding and identifying relevant data sources.
Assess the process and analytical data, collect, clean, and interpret the data available.
Prepare data for analysis and representation in PowerBI Dashboards.
Providing a fresh perspective within the department your opinion matters.
Participate and actively learn about Digital Transformation initiatives involving system integrations, data connectivity and value-based optimization of manufacturing via process supporting analyzation.


The above-mentioned responsibilities are an indication of what you will be doing after proper onboarding and initial learning and development. This provides you with the opportunity to learn and hereafter perform tasks independently. In consultation with your supervisor or peers, you could take on additional tasks and responsibilities.

What Skills You Will Need

In order to excel in this role, you will more than likely have


A graduate student in Biotechnology, Bioinformatics, Data Science.
Passionate about Process Data Science and Data Analysis.
Proven experience in bioprocess engineering, analytical methods, and process data interpretation.
Basic knowledge in Python and/or R.
Basic knowledge in Power BI, Databricks, or Dataiku is preferred but not required.
You are searching for a program where you have the freedom to take initiative.
Effective oral / written communication skills in English.


What We Offer

Being an intern at our company means you will work together with a team on healthcare in an international environment. As a student, you will get the opportunity to develop yourself. In addition, we offer


The possibility to gain experience within the pharmaceutical industry.
The chance to show your potential.
A challenging and dynamic work environment with lots of space to develop yourself.
Professional guidance by an experienced specialist.


What We Look For

In a world of rapid innovation, we seek brave Inventors who want to make an Impact in all aspects of our business, enabling breakthroughs that will affect generations to come. We encourage you to bring your disruptive thinking, collaborative spirit and diverse perspective to our organization. Together we will continue Inventing For Life, Impacting Lives while Inspiring Your Career Growth.

INVENT.

IMPACT.

INSPIRE.

We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one another‚Äôs thinking and approach problems collectively. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace

Current Employees apply HERE

Current Contingent Workers apply HERE

Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully

Merck & Co., Inc., Rahway, NJ, USA, also known as Merck Sharp & Dohme LLC, Rahway, NJ, USA, does not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. All CVs / resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at our company without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of our company. No fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired by our company as a result of an agency referral where no pre-existing agreement is in place. Where agency agreements are in place, introductions are position specific. Please, no phone calls or emails.

Title: IT Business Analyst
HTML:
Why Join Us

The Ermenegildo Zegna Group is one of Italy‚Äôs most famous family driven enterprises and a world leader in luxury menswear. Founded in 1910, Zegna is deeply grounded in history and craftsmanship, yet always at the forefront of contemporary innovation and style.

We are pioneers who embrace change, take ownership of our actions and work to create the world we want.

With over 500 points of sale and 7,000 employees worldwide, we‚Äôre as proud of our people as our products and look for others that share our passion and commitment to excellence and authenticity.

Your Opportunity

Location: Stabio (20% smart working)

As an IT Business Analyst, you will be a member of the Planning and Consolidated application maintenance and development services support team, and you will focus your responsibilities on projects and application maintenance aimed at users located in all areas of the world where the Zegna Group operates.

How Will You Contribute

  • Technical support on Planning and Consolidation applications and resolution of related problems;
  • Implementation of evolutions on systems and/or coordination of supplier activities in the development and evolutionary maintenance phases of application solutions;
  • Drafting of the technical specifications necessary for the evolution and maintenance of the systems;
  • Coordination of supplier activities in the development and evolutionary maintenance phases of application solutions;
  • Support to users in the testing and training phases for the start-up and use of new features and new applications;
  • Technical support for users and resolution of related problems;
  • Management of relationships with internal customers.

Who You Are

You are a professional with strong data analysis and team working skills, with experience understanding business processes and mature project management skills.

You Have

  • Degree in Economics or Engineering or Computer science (or similar);
  • At least 3 years of experience in similar roles in the IT function of structured companies and/or consultancy companies;
  • In-depth knowledge of the SAP BPC system (knowledge of the main EPM tools will be considered a plus);
  • Fluency in spoken and written Italian and English;
  • Willing to travel.

Title: Business Intelligence Data Warehouse Consultant
Description:
Position Title: BI & DWH Specialist

Functional Area: Information Technology

Reporting to: Director - IT

Location: Lugano ( On-Site )

Job Description:

As a BI & DWH Specialist, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining our Oracle data warehouse and business intelligence solutions. You will work closely with business stakeholders to understand their data needs and deliver actionable insights.

Key Responsibilities:

Data Warehouse Design and Development:
Design and implement a robust data warehouse architecture.
Skill-set Oracle Data Integrator, Oracle Warehouse Builder, Oracle BI Suite, Oracle Database, Oracle Business Intelligence Suite Enterprise Edition, OR OBIEE, PL/SQL, UNIX
Good knowledge of data warehouse designs, including top-down, bottom-up, and hybrid designs.
Develop ETL processes to extract, transform, and load data from various sources into the data warehouse.
Ensure data quality and consistency through data profiling and cleansing techniques.
Technology expertise includes in-depth skills in designing and developing applications with Oracle Technologies.
Good knowledge of PL/ SQL programming, creating Stored Procedures, Functions, Triggers, cursors, and packages.
Proficiency in Software Development Life Cycle SDLC and AGILE development process methodologies, such as requirement analysis, definition, prototyping, proof of concept, designing, coding, testing, and implementation.




Business Intelligence Development:
Design and develop interactive dashboards and reports using BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) to provide insights into key business metrics.
Collaborate with business users to understand their reporting needs and translate them into actionable insights.
Create data visualizations that are easy to understand and interpret.
Data Analysis and Reporting:
Conduct in-depth data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities.
Prepare regular and ad-hoc reports to support decision-making.
Provide data-driven insights to improve business performance.
Data Governance:
Establish and maintain data governance policies and procedures.
Ensure data security and privacy compliance.
Monitor data quality and accuracy.

Qualifications and Experience:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Experience in data warehousing and business intelligence, and experience working with globally distributed technology teams. Handled multiple roles: Team Lead, Data Warehouse Developer, Business Analyst, Data Modeler, and Back-End Developer.
6+ years of experience in data warehousing and business intelligence.
Strong proficiency in SQL and data modeling techniques.
Experience with BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts, ETL processes, and data mining techniques.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.




Technical Skills:

ETL

Oracle Data Integrator (ODI), Oracle Warehouse Builder, PL/ SQL scripts.

Databases

Oracle 8i/ 9i/ 10g/ 11g, Sybase Version ASE 15, SQL Server.

Reporting

Oracle BI Suite, Cognos Reporting, and Actuate Reporting.

Version Control

Visual Source Safe 6.0, Clear Case.

Other Tools

Toad, SQL Navigator, Microsoft Visio, Excel, Rapid SQL, SQL Advantage, HP Service Desk, SQL Developer.

Title: Data- & Insights-Analyst (a)
Description:
Mit Insights Impact generieren. Du brennst f√ºr Daten, m√∂chtest den Getr√§nkemarkt im Detail verstehen und willst mit datenbasierten Insights echte Wirkung entfalten? Dann ist diese Rolle bei Red Bull AG genau das Richtige f√ºr dich. In einem dynamischen, internationalen Umfeld erwartet dich nicht nur eine spannende Marke, sondern auch ein modernes Office direkt beim Bahnhof Baar ZG, ein motiviertes Team mit Drive ‚Äì und die M√∂glichkeit, dein analytisches Talent auf ein neues Level zu bringen.




Deine Herausforderung

Als Data- & Insights-Analyst bist du Teil des Category Management Teams und unterst√ºtzt zus√§tzlich das Field Sales Team. Deine Hauptaufgabe besteht darin mittels Datenanalysen & -visualisierungen Handlungsempfehlungen abzuleiten. Diese bist du auch in der Lage zu pr√§sentieren und es macht dir Freude, diese mit unterschiedlichen Stakeholdern zu diskutieren!




Du analysierst Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen (NielsenIQ Paneldaten, interne BI Daten wie z.B. Aussendienst Performance oder auch Daten aus Marktforschungsstudien) und leitest daraus strategisch relevante Erkenntnisse ab
Du unterst√ºtzt das Category Management mit Visualisierungen, Dashboards (z. B. in Power BI) und Modellen zur datenbasierten Sortiments-, Platzierungs- und Promotionsoptimierung
Du bist Sparringpartner f√ºr das Aussendienst-Team und erm√∂glichst durch smarte Analysen effizientere Verkaufsprozesse und wirkungsvollere Massnahmen im Feld
Du analysierst Marktforschungsstudien zu Konsumverhalten und Shopper Insights und bringst die Resultate in Kundenworkshops √ºberzeugend auf den Punkt
Mit deinem technologischen Know-how in Python, R, SQL und Snowflake entwickelst du automatisierte Reports, aussagekr√§ftige Visualisierungen und smarte Entscheidungshilfen
Du wirkst aktiv mit in internen und externen Meetings ‚Äì und bringst dein Wissen in internationale Austauschformate mit anderen Red Bull Insights Experts ein




Deine Qualit√§ten und Begabungen

Hochschulabschluss (FH/Uni) in Wirtschaftsinformatik, BWL/VWL, Psychologie oder einem vergleichbaren Feld ‚Äì erg√§nzt durch Know-how in Statistik oder Data Engineering
Idealerweise hast du erste Erfahrung mit Data Analytics im FMCG-, Retail-, Konsumg√ºter-, Versicherungs- oder Gastronomieumfeld gesammelt oder bist motiviert dich ¬´on the job¬ª einzuarbeiten
Du kennst dich mit Tools wie Python, R, Power BI, SQL und Snowflake aus ‚Äì und hast Spass daran, komplexe Inhalte klar und verst√§ndlich aufzubereiten
Du bist analytisch stark, hast ein gutes Gesp√ºr f√ºr wirtschaftliche Zusammenh√§nge und kannst deine Erkenntnisse √ºberzeugend pr√§sentieren
Deine Muttersprache ist Deutsch und du verf√ºgst √ºber sehr gute Englischkenntnisse ‚Äì Franz√∂sisch ist ein sch√∂nes Extra
Dich zeichnet eine proaktive und selbstst√§ndige Arbeitsweise aus, du bringst Drive und Motivation f√ºr eigene L√∂sungswege mit




Du m√∂chtest einen echten Mehrwert bei einer internationalen Unternehmung mit lokalem Spirit schaffen? Dich zeichnet ein analytisches Vorgehen mit Blick f√ºrs grosse Ganze aus?




Dann freut sich Stefan Fritschi auf deine Bewerbungsunterlagen! Ein Motivationsschreiben, warum dich diese Position und Unternehmen anspricht, kann den Unterschied machen!

Title: Energy Data Portfolio Intern
Description:
Contexte et environnement

About us:

TotalEnergies has developed a strong expertise in oil and biofuels, natural gas and electricity trading. Trading entities are based in Geneva, Paris, Houston and Singapore. TotalEnergies installed its European trading hub across in Geneva, which now bring together very large teams around trading activities: TotalEnergies Trading & Shipping (T&S) and TotalEnergies Gas and Power (TGP).

TotalEnergies Gas and Power (TGP) is the trading arm of TotalEnergies in the field of low carbon energies. As such, it operates in fast-evolving market dynamics influenced by internal and external factors that require constant adaptation and evolution.

The Trading division in Geneva is responsible for optimising the purchase & sales portfolios of gas, electricity, CO2 emissions, dry bulk, and LNG in all recognised markets worldwide, in compliance with the Company trading guidelines.

In such context, TGP helps to ensure growth and profitability to a key segment of the business in order to reach the objective of Carbon Neutrality by 2050.

Our Culture:

We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population and we are committed to the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation. We are fully embracing the digital revolution.

Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success.

Reinforcing the competencies of our people is a key pillar of our culture: we train our people to ensure their development and we pledge to encourage safety in all our actions.

We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding industry that requests to be always on the edge, we cultivate a friendly workplace where our people feel good, where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.

Context & Environment

Fast-paced trading environment requires the jobholder to be able to work both autonomously and a team to produce quick results. Global trading environment involves communication to be sent and received in several languages.

The role operates within a changing energy market mainly due to environmental and regulatory impacts and requirements.

In house systems requires deep collaboration with other departments and IT teams to implement.

Activit√©s

Job Dimension:

Energy Data Management team consists of 8 FTE based in Geneva and is managing all detailed data supplied by 45 market system operators and providers, within 10 markets on power and gas, in a centralised database portal to calculate imbalances and costs associated with physical trades on behalf of the 40 market access affiliated contracts of TotalEnergies.

The Energy Data Portfolio Analyst is responsible for data retrieval within their portfolio, coordinating with IT and the T/DSOs. This role includes controlling and analysing the retrieved volumes, addressing any disputes, and updating the deals in the ETRM. The team supports business development across additional markets and less-carbonized commodities.

The team acts as the direct liaison to market system operators, ensuring continuous data collection from various sources. They are responsible for comparing volumes, performing controls and analysis, and cleaning the data. This enables seamless and flexible access to accurate and robust data, which is then shared with both internal and external stakeholders. The Energy Data Management team collaborates with relevant departments to ensure the accuracy of volumetric data when implementing it into the trading system and reviews the robustness of all internal systems related to this data.

What you will do:

The Energy Data Portfolio Intern will work closely with the Energy Data Portfolio analysts on the French renewables scope.

Thus, your main tasks will be the following:


Ensuring allocation data is received in a timely manner in the EDM system and communicating to TSO/DSO to retrieve missing volumes
Analysing and controlling volumetric data daily to identify anomalies and inconsistencies before updating the ETRM.
Assisting and building with Energy Data Portfolio Analysts, dashboards, reports and alerts on volumetric data to improve the data quality.
Producing key performance measures and indicators around data quality of the assets.
In coordination with Energy Data Portfolio Analysts, request Guarantees of Origins issuance to EEX every month.
Updating procedures to ensure clarity and feasibility of process reference.



Profil du candidat

Your profile:


Educational standard required: Engineering or Finance background preferred.
Strong operational and data visualisation skills with the ability to implement those using commonly used tools ‚Äì Alteryx, Python and PBI.
Strong analytical capabilities, especially in energy markets and in a broader economical field.
A team player who works well with internal team(s), partners and external stakeholders.
Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
Fluent in English and secondary language is nice to have ‚Äì French, Spanish and Italian.



Informations suppl√©mentaires

TotalEnergies valorise la diversit√©, promeut le d√©veloppement individuel et offre des opportunit√©s d'emploi √©gales √† tous les candidats.
