  • Educational standard required: Engineering or Finance background preferred.
  • Strong operational and data visualisation skills with the ability to implement those using commonly used tools ‚Äì Alteryx, Python and PBI.
  • Strong analytical capabilities, especially in energy markets and in a broader economical field.
  • A team player who works well with internal team(s), partners and external stakeholders.
  • Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
  • Fluent in English and secondary language is nice to have ‚Äì French, Spanish and Italian.


Informations suppl√©mentaires

TotalEnergies valorise la diversit√©, promeut le d√©veloppement individuel et offre des opportunit√©s d'emploi √©gales √† tous les candidats.

Title: Trainee - Artificial Intelligence & Data
Description:
Job Description

Location: Zurich, Geneva

Work Pattern Percentage: 80% - 100%

You bring ambition, we provide opportunities.

Help our clients navigate the future with confidence, embracing decision making with clear, data-driven choices

Are you close to completing a bachelor / master's in science, Information Technology, or a related quantitative discipline, eager to dive into the world of Artificial Intelligence and Data? Our AI & Data team is on the lookout for passionate, innovative minds ready to explore the vast possibilities of AI and data analytics. As a trainee with us, you will embark on a journey of learning and discovery, gaining hands-on experience in shaping the future of technology. Join us to transform your academic knowledge into real-world impact, and kickstart your career in one of the most exciting and fast-evolving fields today.

About The Position

We are looking for Trainees starting September 2025 for a 12-month program. Top performers may be offered full-time roles as Business Analysts or Consultants right after the program or within a year of finishing studies.

How You Can Make An Impact


Work with our clients to modernize their data landscape using next generation cloud-enabled platforms and (Gen)AI technology to deliver high quality actionable insights
Implement large-scale data ecosystems including data management, governance, and the integration of internal and external data
Leverage traditional data visualization and next generation algorithms to generate predictions and insights from structured and unstructured data, and augment decision-making
Jointly develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their objectives ranging from satisfying regulatory requirements to improving customer experience by leveraging the power of modern data stack
Guide clients in executing complex data transformations that have organizational and cultural implications and require data-driven mindset



Who We Are Looking For


You have a strong academic background, preferably with a degree in Science, Information Technology, or another quantitative field
You have a strong drive for excellence and high career ambitions
You have gained first relevant practical data-related and/or consulting-like experience through internships/traineeships and enjoy working methodically and with great attention to detail.
You grasp new concepts quickly and are both client and goal oriented
You can manage multiple activities and are used to work in high pace environment
You‚Äôre fluent English, fluency in German and/or French highly preferred
You show a foundational understanding of at least one of the following disciplines ‚Äì data management, data platforms, data analytics & (Gen)AI
Practical experience with SQL, Python/Spark, GenI, and Cloud Data Platforms is highly beneficial



Your Team

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 60+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices.‚ÄØWe specialise in AI & Data ‚Äì empowering clients to harness it for creating human-centric solutions, driving growth and efficiency. Clients benefit from our expertise in data, analytics, modern platforms, and advanced technologies like Generative AI. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

Careers at Deloitte. Choose your impact.

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .

How To Apply

We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on ‚Äúapply now‚Äù to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates. If you have any questions, please contact Jules at talent@deloitte.ch


We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria; don‚Äôt hold yourself back ‚Äì apply today.



We do not accept applications from recruitment agencies for this position.

Deloitte Consulting AG and Deloitte AG are affiliates of Deloitte NSE LLP, a member firm of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee (‚ÄúDTTL‚Äù)

Title: DATA MANAGER / ANALYST (MID LEVEL)
Description:
Job Type

Full-time

Description

Nemean Solutions, headquartered in Sierra Vista, AZ, is a certified SBA 8(a) Native Hawaiian Organization (NHO) and veteran-operated company providing advanced Military Intelligence, Enterprise and Cloud IT services, Cybersecurity, Special Operations Forces (SOF) Exercise and Training, and niche Program Support and Professional Services to Federal and State Agencies supporting the US Government Defense, Intelligence and Aerospace sectors.

Job Overview

The Data Manager / Analyst (Mid Level) supports the Tethered Aerostat Radar System (TARS) Program by managing, organizing, and analyzing program-related data to inform decisions and improve operational effectiveness. This role ensures data integrity, produces detailed reports and dashboards, and supports the development of performance metrics and data governance policies.

Support Hours: Applicant shall be available during core work hours as established the Government customer.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities


Collect, clean, and maintain datasets to support program reporting and analytics.
Analyze operational, financial, and performance data to support decision-making.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations using tools such as Excel, Power BI, or Tableau.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify data requirements and streamline reporting processes.
Ensure adherence to data quality, integrity, and security standards.
Assist in the development of standard operating procedures (SOPs) for data management and reporting.
Support audits, evaluations, and ad hoc data requests.


Competencies


Strong analytical and data interpretation skills.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and one or more data visualization tools.
Ability to manage multiple datasets and perform detailed analysis.
Familiarity with data governance and federal reporting requirements.
Excellent communication and organizational skills.


Requirements

Minimum Requirements/Education:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Analytics, Statistics, Information Systems, or a related field.
3-5 years of experience in data management, analysis, or reporting within a federal program or government contracting environment.
Proficient in Excel, data visualization software, and data management platforms.
Familiarity with DHS or DoD environments preferred.
U.S. Citizenship required.


Security Requirement


Favorably adjudicated CBP Background Investigation (BI) and Secret Security Clearance required.


Travel Required: 10-15%

Physical Demands/Requirements: Work is performed in an office environment. Mostly sedentary work. Repetitive motion. Substantial movement (motions) of the wrists, hands, and/or fingers. The worker is required to have close visual acuity to perform an activity such as: preparing and analyzing data and figures; transcribing; viewing a computer screen; extensive reading.

What Nemean Solutions, LLC Offers

Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance plans, Paid Time Off, sick leave, 401k Retirement Savings plan with company match, and more.

Nemean Solutions is proud to be a Veteran friendly employer and provides Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability status, genetic information, marital status, ancestry, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, and local laws. Equal Opportunity for VEVRAA Protected Veterans. Nemean Solutions, LLC will not discriminate against employees and job applicants who inquire about, discuss or disclose compensation information.

Salary Description

$150,000 and above

Title: BI Developer and analyst
Description:
üíº Job Title : BI Developer and analyst

üìç Localisation : Geneva or Zurich

‚è≥ Activity rate : 100%

üóìÔ∏è Starting date : July 2025




Job purpose :




The BI Developer in close cooperation with the division's Continuous Improvement Manager serves the Applications Engineering Division (and on opportunity also other business users in the Technical Department) by developing BI visuals (KPI dashboards, trend graphs, ‚Ä¶) of data out of the software development and deployment processes of the division. These visuals will be part of a structured Cockpit for the division allowing at different levels of granularity to monitor the performance and output of the division. The overall cockpit shall enable the division to identify and address improvement areas. He or she will work closely with the division's Continuous Improvement Manager to implement this cockpit.




He or she is responsible to analyze complex information and data flows as well as existing data structures with the target to optimize BI data models including the associated process and data flow logic. The reporting tool is Power BI where solutions will be developed.




He or she will be involved in the contact with stakeholders, customers and users for the determination of their needs.

He or she will further interact with these persons during the development of the reports in a closed feedback loop.




The to be developed visuals shall support the division management and other stakeholders to

understand the status of a process, the organization, the product quality, ‚Ä¶
easily identify trends and areas requiring measures for improvement,
take decisions about improvement measures,
monitor progress after implementation of improvement measures.




The BI developer is accountable for applying best practices in his/her work and for striving for common look and feel and user friendliness of the visuals.







Responsabilities :




Supports the division in building up a visual data driven cockpit of relevant KPIs for the processes and products of the division.
Collaborates with the Continuous Improvement Manager closely on the overall concept, as well as on the implementation of the individual KPI visuals.
Collaborates with other stakeholders and team members who provide or maintain basic data.







Tasks :




Elicit requirements for Visuals
Identify and analyze data sources
Establish means for automatic collection
Develop data model within the BI tool according to best practices
Job Description Page 2 of 2 Profile-BI Developer-and-analyst-final
Apply solution-oriented data transformation
Develop visualization within the BI tool considering style guides
Where appropriate or needed evolve existing style guides
Test visual
Provide user description or info about each visual
Provide technical description for maintenance of each visual(support) rollout of new visuals
Improve visuals in feedback driven collaboration with stakeholders and users of the visuals







Knowledge/experience :




3+ years of experience as BI developer, preferably with Power BI
Very good verbal and written English
French and/or German language skills a plus
Data modelling and analysis
Problem solving mindset
Power BI desktop tool expertise
Data transformation with M language
DAX knowledge (Data Analysis Expressions)
Visualization and design
Deployment of Power BI visuals
Reporting process automation (data collection, transformations and refresh)
Practical knowledge of collaboration tools like Jira, Confluence a plusv




Softskills :




Collaborative, team player
Organized and methodic
Good communication skills
Proactive and outgoing personality

üìç With offices in Switzerland, Singapore, Hong Kong, and France, we support our Swiss and international clients in the following areas:

Organisation & Transformation Consulting
Industrial Engineering
Information Systems Management




By joining our team, you will discover:

A dynamic team with a start-up spirit
A human-centric approach & personalized career follow-up
Education & Training to keep developing your skills
Exciting events: team building, meet-ups, workshops, afterworks, and Winter + Summer Events




üèÜ A company certified @HappyAtWork and committed to CSR (Ecovadis 2023 Gold Medal ü•á)




You too can be part of the Antaes adventure !

Title: Internship R&D Engineer (Data Science)
Description:
CT_Technology & Innovation-E122

Internship R&D Engineer (Data Science) - Full Time - Oberwinterthur, Switzerland

Sulzer is a leading engineering company with a proud heritage of innovation. Join our global team to grow your expertise and develop innovative solutions that enable a prosperous and more sustainable society.

We are looking for an R&D Engineer, Data Science Intern to join our Chemtech, Technology and Innovation, team in Oberwinterthur.

Join our R&D team for six months and develop innovative solutions for the chemical industry and sustainable technologies, including carbon capture and emission control. Focused on digitalization, you will help drive data-driven product development from ideation to market-ready solutions within our Separation Technology business unit.

Your main tasks and responsibilities:


Collaborate in Contribute to data-driven product development within the Separation Technology business unit.
Collect, organize, and analyze experimental data from our pilot plants and production facilities.
Identify opportunities to enhance our experimental design and critical parameters for product optimization.
Play an active role in implementing new analytical technologies to support digital transformation.


To succeed in this role, you will need:


Student or recent graduate in Chemical, Process, or Mechanical Engineering (related disciplines welcome).
Experience in data evaluation, modeling, visualization, and data-driven analysis.
Previous experience with programming languages such as Python or R.
Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Office is expected.
Curious, motivated team player with a knack for problem-solving and a desire to advance your career in a dynamic, fast-paced, and innovative environment.
Fluency in English.


What we offer you:


25 days holiday (exclusive of bank holidays)
Defined contribution pension scheme
Employee Assistance Program/health care
On-site car parking/public transport allowance
Access to a wide range of discounts


No visa or work permit support can be provided for this role.

Do you have a question about the role?

Reach out to Alexi Donadoni at Alexi.Donadoni@sulzer.com . Our team is looking forward hearing from you!

Sulzer is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in the strength of a diverse workforce and are committed to offering an inclusive work environment.

We are proud to be recognized as a Top Employer 2025 in Brazil, China, Finland, Germany, Ireland, Switzerland, South Africa, the UK and the USA.

Title: SQL Developer
Description:
Job Description




On behalf of our client, a prestigious Wealth Management firm specialised in alternative investment solutions, we are seeking a highly motivated and experienced SQL Developer to join our client's IT Data and Application Management team. The role will focus on developing, optimizing, and maintaining their data reconciliation platform while also supporting the management of the Master Data Management (MDM) system.




Responsibilities




Oversee the full development lifecycle of the SQL-based data reconciliation platform, from gathering requirements to development, testing, deployment, and ongoing maintenance.
Design and implement additional integrations to enhance the reconciliation platform.
Contribute to the ongoing development of the central Master Data Management (MDM) system, focusing on integrations with other systems; act as a deputy for the MDM application manager.
Identify and resolve performance issues to ensure the platform‚Äôs scalability.
Collaborate with application owners, business analysts, and stakeholders to understand new requirements and implement appropriate solutions.







Requirements




Master‚Äôs degree in computer science, mathematics, engineering, or a related IT-focused discipline.
Strong hands-on experience with Microsoft SQL Server (T-SQL).
Proficiency in data reconciliation and integration with databases and file-based systems.
Familiarity with ETL processes and data transformation techniques.
Solid understanding of data architecture and data modeling principles.
Enthusiastic about new technologies with a willingness to learn and adapt.
Strong analytical mindset with a goal-oriented, solution-driven approach.
Organized and detail-oriented with a structured working style.
Experience in the financial sector and knowledge of asset management is a plus.
Effective communication skills in English and German as a strong advantage.







Due to immigration restrictions in Switzerland, we will only be able to consider applications from Swiss or EU citizens or from candidates holding a valid Swiss work permit.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
80% - 100%

Nous allons r√©aliser ensemble

Dans le cadre de notre transformation digitale et de l‚Äôadoption d‚Äôune architecture Data Mesh, nous recherchons un¬∑e Business Data Analyst passionn√©¬∑e par la donn√©e et par la compr√©hension fine des enjeux m√©tier. Vous serez le lien direct entre les √©quipes op√©rationnelles et les √©quipes techniques, en transformant les besoins m√©tiers en cas d‚Äôusage data concrets et en accompagnant leur mise en ≈ìuvre au sein de notre plateforme de donn√©es moderne bas√©e sur Microsoft Azure (Databricks, Fabric, Power BI, dbt).

Int√©gr√©¬∑e √† l‚Äôunit√© ¬´ Donn√©es et Innovation ¬ª (rattach√©e √† la direction informatique de SIG), vous participerez activement √† l‚Äôidentification, la formalisation et la priorisation des cas d‚Äôusage, √† la d√©finition des mod√®les de donn√©es et √† la conception des livrables.

La donn√©e est d√©sormais au c≈ìur de la transformation digitale de l‚Äôentreprise. Elle devient un actif strat√©gique √† forte valeur ajout√©e. Votre r√¥le sera de d√©tecter cette valeur et de faciliter son exploitation par nos √©quipes m√©tiers.

Vous √™tes convaincu¬∑e que la donn√©e est un levier de performance et d‚Äôinnovation ? Vous souhaitez travailler au plus proche des m√©tiers tout en collaborant avec des experts data et IT ? Alors ce poste est fait pour vous.

Votre √©nergie au service d‚Äôune Gen√®ve durable

En tant que Business Data Analyst, votre mission principale consiste √† :


Analyse et cadrage des besoins m√©tiers
Animer des ateliers de cadrage avec les √©quipes m√©tiers (interviews, co-construction, Data/Event Storming, etc.) afin d‚Äôidentifier les cas d‚Äôusage √† forte valeur ajout√©e et les traduire en exigences fonctionnelles claires ;
Contribuer √† la structuration des donn√©es m√©tiers en lien avec les principes du Domain-Driven Design ;
Participer activement √† la conception des couches Silver et Gold de l‚Äôarchitecture en m√©daillon, en lien avec les ing√©nieurs de donn√©es et les experts en mod√©lisation de donn√©es.



Gouvernance et documentation m√©tier
Formaliser et maintenir des glossaires, dictionnaires de donn√©es, r√©f√©rentiels m√©tier et autres artefacts favorisant une compr√©hension partag√©e des donn√©es ;
Contribuer √† la qualit√© des donn√©es, en collaborant √† la mise en place de tests de validation et √† la d√©finition de data contracts entre producteurs et consommateurs ;
Accompagner les √©quipes dans la conformit√© r√©glementaire et participer √† la documentation et √† la classification des donn√©es ;
Promouvoir une culture data partag√©e au sein de l‚Äôentreprise.



Interface entre m√©tiers et data platform
Traduire les besoins m√©tier en sp√©cifications exploitables pour les √©quipes data et IT ;
Participer aux choix d‚Äôoutils, de mod√®les et de bonnes pratiques pour renforcer l‚Äôint√©gration des usages m√©tiers dans la plateforme de donn√©es SIG.

Votre personnalit√© et vos comp√©tences

Techniques et m√©thodologiques


Bonne compr√©hension des principes du Domain-Driven Design (DDD) et capacit√© √† collaborer avec les √©quipes m√©tiers et data pour identifier les √©v√©nements cl√©s (via des ateliers tels que Data/Event Storming) ;

Title: Digital Content Insight Specialist
Description:
Title: Digital Content Insight Specialist

Location: Basel (Hybrid working)

Length of Contract: 7 months




Haybury have partnered with a leading global pharmaceutical organization within Switzerland who are seeking a talented Content Insight and Taxonomy Specialist to generate actionable insights to marketing campaigns alongside providing accurate dashboards and reports for business decision making.




This is a fantastic opportunity for an individual familiar with using systems such as Veeva supporting the analytics and growth frameworks for the digital content, ensuring accuracy and integrity is maintained on each activity.




Responsibilities:




Drive the development and rollout of dashboards that measure content performance across multiple brands and markets
Build and maintain scalable content tagging frameworks aligned to business needs
Lead taxonomy design and expansion to support new channels and campaigns
Support onboarding of global stakeholders as new brands/countries join the program
Collaborate with cross functional data teams and platform teams (e.g., Veeva Vault) to ensure data and system readiness
Facilitate continuous feedback loops to extract insights and guide strategic improvements
Contribute to training programs and documentation to support consistent adoption across teams







Qualifications:




Experience in content strategy, insights, or digital marketing analytics
Strong understanding of tagging, metadata, and taxonomy best practices
Ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights
Familiarity with enterprise content platforms (e.g., Veeva Vault) is a plus
Excellent collaboration skills across business and technical teams







Reach out to Rory.pitts@hayburysearch for a confidential discussion an further insight to the position.

Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst - Power & Gas
Description:
Senior Quantitative Analyst - Power & Gas Markets




Location: Geneva, Switzerland




Our client is looking for an experienced Quantitative Analyst to join their dynamic energy trading and analytics team in Geneva, Switzerland. This role combines market expertise with quantitative skills to drive power and gas market strategies forward.




About Our Client

Our client is a leading expert in the energy markets, providing critical analysis, forecasting, and modelling services. Their work supports key stakeholders in navigating the energy transition while identifying valuable investment opportunities in sustainable energy systems.




The Role

As a Senior Quantitative Analyst, you will apply sophisticated quantitative methods to model European power and gas markets, create price scenarios, and develop actionable insights for trading desks and clients.




Key Responsibilities

Model fundamental power and gas markets using proprietary systems and data analysis
Design and integrate new datasets to enhance trading strategies
Support trading desks in utilizing data for production systems
Develop and improve analytical products and methodologies
Manage data sourcing projects from acquisition through production
Communicate insights to clients and internal stakeholders
Collaborate with research and consulting teams




Required Qualifications

Degree in a technical or quantitative field (Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Data Science, or Economics)
Minimum 3 years of experience in quantitative analysis, data engineering, or similar roles
Strong programming skills in Python and familiarity with data analysis packages
Understanding of European energy markets and trading dynamics
Experience with financial data platforms is advantageous
Ability to work independently while collaborating in a global team environment
Excellent analytical thinking and problem-solving abilities
Strong communication skills in English; German proficiency is a plus




What Our Client Offers




An opportunity to join a team at the forefront of the energy transition, where your analytical expertise will contribute to sustainable market solutions while generating value for their clients and stakeholders.




For a confidential discussion about this exciting opportunity in Geneva, please submit your application with a detailed CV.

Title: Business Analyst / Consultant - Artificial Intelligence & Data - (Data Management & Data Platforms focus)
Description:
Job Description

Location: Zurich, Geneva, Basel

Work Pattern Percentage: 80-100%

Help our clients navigate the future with confidence and embrace decision making with clear data-driven choices

Deloitte AI & Data helps clients unlock the power of AI and data to deliver better human-centric solutions that catalyse growth and efficiencies. We enable them to leverage data, analytics, modern platforms, and data science & AI technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform their decision-making.

We help clients transform their business by designing and implementing data solutions to excel in their markets. Our role is to understand their business problems and use data-driven thinking and technology to achieve outcomes that drive their business forward.

For this role, we are currently offering start dates from February 2025.

How You Can Make An Impact


Design and implement modern data solutions in the areas of data management (e.g. data quality, master and reference data, catalogues, data platforms) that deliver high-quality, usable data
Develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their business objectives across regulatory, cost, and revenue pillars.
Design complex data & analytics transformations by providing architectural, technical and organizational thought leadership and guide clients in executing these transformations, which have significant organizational implications.
Drive Data & AI use cases from business value concept to production
Develop and maintain trusted client relationships through project work or business development and expand your network both internally and externally.
Support business development opportunities to generate new projects.
Be a role model for people you work with by demonstrating strong work ethic, leadership, and subject matter competence.
Grow expertise in different industry and subject matter areas and share your knowledge with the rest of Deloitte talent.





Who we are looking for

Drive and Motivation:


Passionate individuals looking to make a career in AI & Data space.
Drive to learn new topics and master them
Ability to manage multiple activities in a high-paced environment and deliver independently.
Consulting and Communication Skills:
Strong Microsoft Power Point skills: Ability to design and shape meaningful presentations.
Strong Conceptual Capability: Ability to consolidate diverse requirements into coherent solution designs, simplifying complex problems.
Business-IT Translator: Ability to act as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions.



Technical design:


Attention to detail and ability to convey technical specifics of solution design in oral or written form and in 1-1 meetings as well as workshops
Technical expertise:
First practical experience with Data management or Data Platform solutions is highly recommended.
Familiarity with SQL and Python.



Language Proficiency:


Fluent in English; fluency in German and/or French is highly preferred to facilitate communication with diverse teams and stakeholders.



Industry Experience:


First relevant experience in consulting, tech companies, or industry-specific roles, particularly in data-driven fields.
Previous experience in the Banking, Insurance, Life Science or Healthcare sector is advantageous.



Your team

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 50+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI & data ‚Äì how to structure it, how to source it, how to transform it, how to store it, and how to consume it. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

Life at Deloitte

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .

How To Apply

We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on ‚Äúapply now‚Äù to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates.

If you have any questions, please contact Julia at talent@deloitte.ch


We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria; don‚Äôt hold yourself back ‚Äì apply today.

Title: Graduate Program Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Graduate Program Junior Data Analyst

Our company in Schachen employs a diverse group of highly skilled scientists, engineers, technicians, and process specialists from more than 15 nations and provides an important contribution to our company‚Äôs endeavor to bring new innovative medicines to patients as fast as possible, while applying highest quality standards to all activities.

Are you a highly talented biotechnology graduate seeking for a first or new challenge where you are free to take initiative? Would you like to experience working in one of the biggest multinationals in the pharmaceutical industry? We are looking for a graduate student in the field of Biotechnology/Bioinformatics, Data Science or a related discipline, who is searching for a challenging early career position in our innovative company. This role is part of our Future Career Graduate Program which consists in 1 year project-based contract.

Graduate Project

The Schachen Biotech Process Automation team is providing a strategic link between our early and late-stage pipeline and responsible to develop and maintain a ‚ÄòLine of Sight‚Äô between the stages.

The Data Analyst Graduate Project will consist in creating an innovative solution for finding and visualizing correlations between multiple sets and levels of real production process and analytical data. Implementation of PowerBI dashboards for visualization of real time data, focused on representing the key process parameters, key metrics and visualization of out-of-range values for the batches or campaigns. As an extended implementation, creating PowerBI Dashboards to represent a contextualized real time data from SAP (Bill Of Materials, Bill Of Parameters, Inventory) and MES data (Parameter Value Lists) for an overview and possible de-bottlenecking of the Batch/Campaign running.

This will also include working with intelligent automation solutions using AWS and Azure cloud capabilities and tooling, implementation of Power BI dashboards representing the process data and as well possibility of implementation of machine learning algorithms as well as Python or R programming.

As a graduate you should bring energy, knowledge, innovation to carry out the following


Collaborating with various business teams in an international setting to generate business understanding and identifying relevant data sources.
Assess the process and analytical data, collect, clean, and interpret the data available.
Prepare data for analysis and representation in PowerBI Dashboards.
Providing a fresh perspective within the department your opinion matters.
Participate and actively learn about Digital Transformation initiatives involving system integrations, data connectivity and value-based optimization of manufacturing via process supporting analyzation.


The above-mentioned responsibilities are an indication of what you will be doing after proper onboarding and initial learning and development. This provides you with the opportunity to learn and hereafter perform tasks independently. In consultation with your supervisor or peers, you could take on additional tasks and responsibilities.

What Skills You Will Need

In order to excel in this role, you will more than likely have


A graduate student in Biotechnology, Bioinformatics, Data Science.
Passionate about Process Data Science and Data Analysis.
Proven experience in bioprocess engineering, analytical methods, and process data interpretation.
Basic knowledge in Python and/or R.
Basic knowledge in Power BI, Databricks, or Dataiku is preferred but not required.
You are searching for a program where you have the freedom to take initiative.
Effective oral / written communication skills in English.


What We Offer

Being an intern at our company means you will work together with a team on healthcare in an international environment. As a student, you will get the opportunity to develop yourself. In addition, we offer


The possibility to gain experience within the pharmaceutical industry.
The chance to show your potential.
A challenging and dynamic work environment with lots of space to develop yourself.
Professional guidance by an experienced specialist.


What We Look For

In a world of rapid innovation, we seek brave Inventors who want to make an Impact in all aspects of our business, enabling breakthroughs that will affect generations to come. We encourage you to bring your disruptive thinking, collaborative spirit and diverse perspective to our organization. Together we will continue Inventing For Life, Impacting Lives while Inspiring Your Career Growth.

INVENT.

IMPACT.

INSPIRE.

We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one another‚Äôs thinking and approach problems collectively. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace

Title: BI Developer and analyst
Description:
üíº Job Title : BI Developer and analyst

üìç Localisation : Geneva or Zurich

‚è≥ Activity rate : 100%

üóìÔ∏è Starting date : July 2025




Job purpose :




The BI Developer in close cooperation with the division's Continuous Improvement Manager serves the Applications Engineering Division (and on opportunity also other business users in the Technical Department) by developing BI visuals (KPI dashboards, trend graphs, ‚Ä¶) of data out of the software development and deployment processes of the division. These visuals will be part of a structured Cockpit for the division allowing at different levels of granularity to monitor the performance and output of the division. The overall cockpit shall enable the division to identify and address improvement areas. He or she will work closely with the division's Continuous Improvement Manager to implement this cockpit.




He or she is responsible to analyze complex information and data flows as well as existing data structures with the target to optimize BI data models including the associated process and data flow logic. The reporting tool is Power BI where solutions will be developed.




He or she will be involved in the contact with stakeholders, customers and users for the determination of their needs.

He or she will further interact with these persons during the development of the reports in a closed feedback loop.




The to be developed visuals shall support the division management and other stakeholders to

understand the status of a process, the organization, the product quality, ‚Ä¶
easily identify trends and areas requiring measures for improvement,
take decisions about improvement measures,
monitor progress after implementation of improvement measures.




The BI developer is accountable for applying best practices in his/her work and for striving for common look and feel and user friendliness of the visuals.







Responsabilities :




Supports the division in building up a visual data driven cockpit of relevant KPIs for the processes and products of the division.
Collaborates with the Continuous Improvement Manager closely on the overall concept, as well as on the implementation of the individual KPI visuals.
Collaborates with other stakeholders and team members who provide or maintain basic data.







Tasks :




Elicit requirements for Visuals
Identify and analyze data sources
Establish means for automatic collection
Develop data model within the BI tool according to best practices
Job Description Page 2 of 2 Profile-BI Developer-and-analyst-final
Apply solution-oriented data transformation
Develop visualization within the BI tool considering style guides
Where appropriate or needed evolve existing style guides
Test visual
Provide user description or info about each visual
Provide technical description for maintenance of each visual(support) rollout of new visuals
Improve visuals in feedback driven collaboration with stakeholders and users of the visuals







Knowledge/experience :




3+ years of experience as BI developer, preferably with Power BI
Very good verbal and written English
French and/or German language skills a plus
Data modelling and analysis
Problem solving mindset
Power BI desktop tool expertise
Data transformation with M language
DAX knowledge (Data Analysis Expressions)
Visualization and design
Deployment of Power BI visuals
Reporting process automation (data collection, transformations and refresh)
Practical knowledge of collaboration tools like Jira, Confluence a plusv




Softskills :




Collaborative, team player
Organized and methodic
Good communication skills
Proactive and outgoing personality







------------------------------------------------------------------

üìç With offices in Switzerland, Singapore, Hong Kong, and France, we support our Swiss and international clients in the following areas:

Organisation & Transformation Consulting
Industrial Engineering
Information Systems Management




By joining our team, you will discover:

A dynamic team with a start-up spirit
A human-centric approach & personalized career follow-up
Education & Training to keep developing your skills
Exciting events: team building, meet-ups, workshops, afterworks, and Winter + Summer Events




üèÜ A company certified @HappyAtWork and committed to CSR (Ecovadis 2023 Gold Medal ü•á)




You too can be part of the Antaes adventure !

Title: Internship R&D Engineer (Data Science)
Description:
CT_Technology & Innovation-E122

Internship R&D Engineer (Data Science) - Full Time - Oberwinterthur, Switzerland

Sulzer is a leading engineering company with a proud heritage of innovation. Join our global team to grow your expertise and develop innovative solutions that enable a prosperous and more sustainable society.

We are looking for an R&D Engineer, Data Science Intern to join our Chemtech, Technology and Innovation, team in Oberwinterthur.

Join our R&D team for six months and develop innovative solutions for the chemical industry and sustainable technologies, including carbon capture and emission control. Focused on digitalization, you will help drive data-driven product development from ideation to market-ready solutions within our Separation Technology business unit.

Your main tasks and responsibilities:


Collaborate in Contribute to data-driven product development within the Separation Technology business unit.
Collect, organize, and analyze experimental data from our pilot plants and production facilities.
Identify opportunities to enhance our experimental design and critical parameters for product optimization.
Play an active role in implementing new analytical technologies to support digital transformation.


To succeed in this role, you will need:


Student or recent graduate in Chemical, Process, or Mechanical Engineering (related disciplines welcome).
Experience in data evaluation, modeling, visualization, and data-driven analysis.
Previous experience with programming languages such as Python or R.
Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Office is expected.
Curious, motivated team player with a knack for problem-solving and a desire to advance your career in a dynamic, fast-paced, and innovative environment.
Fluency in English.


What we offer you:


25 days holiday (exclusive of bank holidays)
Defined contribution pension scheme
Employee Assistance Program/health care
On-site car parking/public transport allowance
Access to a wide range of discounts


No visa or work permit support can be provided for this role.

Do you have a question about the role?

Reach out to Alexi Donadoni at Alexi.Donadoni@sulzer.com . Our team is looking forward hearing from you!

Sulzer is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in the strength of a diverse workforce and are committed to offering an inclusive work environment.

We are proud to be recognized as a Top Employer 2025 in Brazil, China, Finland, Germany, Ireland, Switzerland, South Africa, the UK and the USA.

Title: Data Engineer (100%)
Description:
To strengthen our AI / Data team, we are looking for a Data Engineer that will play a key role in supporting us data modeling, quality, validation, analysis, governance, warehouse and ETL pipelines. The position of Data Engineer is a full-time and permanent position based in our office in the Basel, Switzerland. As part of our commitment to fostering a collaborative team environment, this role requires working fully on-site.

Tasks & Responsibilities


Data modelling: design and implement data models that support business requirements and optimise for performance and scalability on large datasets.
Data quality and validation: provide support and solutions to develop data quality checks within the pipelines to ensure data is always within its expectations.
Data integration: integrate data from all sources within the company and make it equally available for local and remote organisations.
Data analysis: develop and maintain insightful reports and dashboards to provide business metrics, trends and performances.
Data governance: support ensuring data compliance and harmonisation by developing strong and meaningful collaboration with data governance team policies and regulations.
Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) pipelines: create and maintain fast and efficient data pipelines from different relational and non-relational sources - MySQL, Apache Solr, MongoDB, APIs into a centralised data lake and data warehouse, using the Apache Airflow orchestrator.
Data Warehouse tuning and optimisation: contribute to the optimisation and performance of the orchestrator and data warehouse to ensure durable environment health and scalability.
Cross-functional collaboration: collaborate within an international environment to provide your expertise to data scientists, analysts and business stakeholders.


Requirements


Degree in computer science or data engineering certification.
Knowledge of Python programming language.
Experience with Pandas or Polars (Dataframes), SQLAlchemy (database toolkit), Streamlit is a plus.
Hands-on experience with SQL.
Experience with relational databases. Knowledge of MySQL and PostgreSQL-specific features is a plus.
Good understanding of NoSQL databases: Apache Solr, MongoDB.
Excellent problem-solving, communication, and organisational skills.
Technical expertise in data mining and modelling techniques.
Basic understanding of Machine Learning models.
Proven ability to work independently and within a team.


What We Offer


The opportunity to contribute to the academic/scientific community;
Flexible working hours;
Team bond strengthening through team-building events;
Professional growth opportunities with our global training system;
Working in a collaborative, diverse, and socially responsible team;
Company retreat facility;
Full-coverage insurance for accidents/daily sickness;
Prime location near Basel train station and city center;
And more


If you are interested in this position, we look forward to receiving:


A motivational letter(EN) that briefly describes your motivations for joining MDPI
A resume(EN) including personal information, past & current education,
Copy of ID and Diplomas
If available: reference letters and certificates.


About MDPI

A pioneer in scholarly open access publishing, MDPI has supported academic communities since 1996. Our mission is to foster open scientific exchange in all forms, across all disciplines. We operate more than 400 diverse, peer-reviewed, open access journals supported by over 66,000 academic editors. We serve scholars from around the world to ensure the latest research is openly and broadly available.

MDPI is headquartered in Switzerland with additional offices in Europe, Asia and North America. We are committed to ensuring that high quality research is made available as quickly as possible. We also support sustainability projects, with sustainability as a key theme in many journals and through the MDPI Sustainability Foundation.

Initiatives

At MDPI, We Develop And Maintain Various Platforms In Order To Better Serve The Scientific Community. Please Find Here-below a List Of Our Main Platforms

https://www.mdpi.com

https://www.mdpi.com/books/

https://sciprofiles.com

https://sciforum.net

https://www.scilit.net

https://www.preprints.org

https://encyclopedia.pub


Show more

Title: Online Data Analyst (Switzerland)
Description:
Job description




Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.




A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.




Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!




TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world‚Äôs largest brands.










Qualification path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German languages
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

Job description


Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.


A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

  • In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
  • Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.


Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!


TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world‚Äôs largest brands.




Qualification path


No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.


Basic Requirements

  • Full Professional Proficiency in English & German languages
  • Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
  • Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
  • Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
  • Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software


Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you‚Äôll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.


Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants‚Äô qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: SQL Developer
Description:
Job Description




On behalf of our client, a prestigious Wealth Management firm specialised in alternative investment solutions, we are seeking a highly motivated and experienced SQL Developer to join our client's IT Data and Application Management team. The role will focus on developing, optimizing, and maintaining their data reconciliation platform while also supporting the management of the Master Data Management (MDM) system.




Responsibilities




Oversee the full development lifecycle of the SQL-based data reconciliation platform, from gathering requirements to development, testing, deployment, and ongoing maintenance.
Design and implement additional integrations to enhance the reconciliation platform.
Contribute to the ongoing development of the central Master Data Management (MDM) system, focusing on integrations with other systems; act as a deputy for the MDM application manager.
Identify and resolve performance issues to ensure the platform‚Äôs scalability.
Collaborate with application owners, business analysts, and stakeholders to understand new requirements and implement appropriate solutions.







Requirements




Master‚Äôs degree in computer science, mathematics, engineering, or a related IT-focused discipline.
Strong hands-on experience with Microsoft SQL Server (T-SQL).
Proficiency in data reconciliation and integration with databases and file-based systems.
Familiarity with ETL processes and data transformation techniques.
Solid understanding of data architecture and data modeling principles.
Enthusiastic about new technologies with a willingness to learn and adapt.
Strong analytical mindset with a goal-oriented, solution-driven approach.
Organized and detail-oriented with a structured working style.
Experience in the financial sector and knowledge of asset management is a plus.
Effective communication skills in English and German as a strong advantage.







Due to immigration restrictions in Switzerland, we will only be able to consider applications from Swiss or EU citizens or from candidates holding a valid Swiss work permit.

Title: Consultant - Forensic Technology and eDiscovery
Description:
At EY, we‚Äôre all in to shape your future with confidence.

We‚Äôll help you succeed in a globally connected powerhouse of diverse teams and take your career wherever you want it to go.

Join EY and help to build a better working world.

The Forensic Technology & eDiscovery team is a group of technical specialists that leverages data and technology to investigate high-profile financial crime matters related to fraud, corruption, money-laundering, misconducts and support the enforcement of regulatory requirements.

The nature of our work requires the collection, processing and management of large sets of communications, documents and records from a wide array of information systems. We combine deep investigation expertise with Forensic, eDiscovery and artificial intelligence (‚ÄúAI‚Äù) technology to accelerate the fact-finding process.

The opportunity


The rapidly growing Forensic department is currently seeking the right candidates for an excellent career opportunity in the Forensic Technology and eDiscovery team.
You will be responsible for providing critical support to our teams of investigators, clients, legal counsels and regulators in fact-finding activities.
Our methodology incorporates advanced data analysis technologies such as Generative AI (‚ÄúGenAI‚Äù), natural language processing, machine learning, predictive coding, social network analysis and automation. You will receive training on our forensic technologies and the opportunity to contribute to innovation.
You will have a unique, career changing opportunity to play a key role in the growth and strategy of the team.


Your Key Responsibilities


Working in engagement teams, carrying out both reactive and proactive data analysis of large volumes of unstructured and structured data.
Collaborating with clients, fraud investigators, internal and external auditors, lawyers and regulatory authorities in sensitive and sometimes adversarial situations.
Working in our dedicated Forensic Technology & eDiscovery lab and secure platform to help clients secure and uncover facts with the use of technology.
Innovating and developing new solutions to answer current and future needs of our clients.
Supporting the leadership team and the project manager on the operational level and acting as a role model and coach for more junior team members.


Skills And Attributes For Success

To qualify for the role you must have


Degree (Bachelor or Master) in all fields related to Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering and other technical majors
Strong problem solving, analytical, technical, and interpersonal skills
Consulting-oriented mindset, flexibility and ‚Äúcan-do‚Äù approach
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English (German or French is a plus).


Ideally, you‚Äôll also have


Solid programming skills with Python, R, SQL or other main programming languages
Solid knowledge of IT infrastructure and security topics
Experience with Relativity, Nuix, and other state-of-the-art Forensic Technology & eDiscovery tools
Experience using Generative AI and engineering prompts


What We Offer


International multi-cultural team of highly motivated professionals
Constant personal development with a steep learning curve ‚Äì a system of trainings, mentoring, counselling and on-the-job learning
Modern working environment and equipment, fostering mobile working flexibility
Transparent performance-based recognition and progression system
Acquire a fully accredited corporate MBA (EY Tech MBA) from Hult International Business School, whilst working with EY, completely free*
exception of EY contractors, interns and alumni.


If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. Make the next step and apply for this position (ID: 814785) online. For further information please contact our recruitment team (recruitment.switzerland@ey.com / +41 58 286 33 66).

The Exceptional EY Experience. It‚Äôs Yours To Build.

EY | Building a better working world

EY is building a better working world by creating new value for clients, people, society and the planet, while building trust in capital markets.

Enabled by data, AI and advanced technology, EY teams help clients shape the future with confidence and develop answers for the most pressing issues of today and tomorrow.

EY teams work across a full spectrum of services in assurance, consulting, tax, strategy and transactions. Fueled by sector insights, a globally connected, multi-disciplinary network and diverse ecosystem partners, EY teams can provide services in more than 150 countries and territories.

Consulting-oriented mindset, flexibility and ‚Äúcan-do‚Äù approach
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English (German or French is a plus).


Ideally, you‚Äôll also have


Solid programming skills with Python, R, SQL or other main programming languages
Solid knowledge of IT infrastructure and security topics
Experience with Relativity, Nuix, and other state-of-the-art Forensic Technology & eDiscovery tools
Experience using Generative AI and engineering prompts


What We Offer


International multi-cultural team of highly motivated professionals
Constant personal development with a steep learning curve ‚Äì a system of trainings, mentoring, counselling and on-the-job learning
Modern working environment and equipment, fostering mobile working flexibility
Transparent performance-based recognition and progression system
Acquire a fully accredited corporate MBA (EY Tech MBA) from Hult International Business School, whilst working with EY, completely free*
exception of EY contractors, interns and alumni.


If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. Make the next step and apply for this position (ID: 814785) online. For further information please contact our recruitment team (recruitment.switzerland@ey.com / +41 58 286 33 66).

The Exceptional EY Experience. It‚Äôs Yours To Build.

EY | Building a better working world

EY is building a better working world by creating new value for clients, people, society and the planet, while building trust in capital markets.

Enabled by data, AI and advanced technology, EY teams help clients shape the future with confidence and develop answers for the most pressing issues of today and tomorrow.

EY teams work across a full spectrum of services in assurance, consulting, tax, strategy and transactions. Fueled by sector insights, a globally connected, multi-disciplinary network and diverse ecosystem partners, EY teams can provide services in more than 150 countries and territories.
Show more
HTML:
At EY, we‚Äôre all in to shape your future with confidence.

We‚Äôll help you succeed in a globally connected powerhouse of diverse teams and take your career wherever you want it to go.

Join EY and help to build a better working world.

The Forensic Technology & eDiscovery team is a group of technical specialists that leverages data and technology to investigate high-profile financial crime matters related to fraud, corruption, money-laundering, misconducts and support the enforcement of regulatory requirements.

The nature of our work requires the collection, processing and management of large sets of communications, documents and records from a wide array of information systems. We combine deep investigation expertise with Forensic, eDiscovery and artificial intelligence (‚ÄúAI‚Äù) technology to accelerate the fact-finding process.

The opportunity

  • The rapidly growing Forensic department is currently seeking the right candidates for an excellent career opportunity in the Forensic Technology and eDiscovery team.
  • You will be responsible for providing critical support to our teams of investigators, clients, legal counsels and regulators in fact-finding activities.
  • Our methodology incorporates advanced data analysis technologies such as Generative AI (‚ÄúGenAI‚Äù), natural language processing, machine learning, predictive coding, social network analysis and automation. You will receive training on our forensic technologies and the opportunity to contribute to innovation.
  • You will have a unique, career changing opportunity to play a key role in the growth and strategy of the team.

Your Key Responsibilities

  • Working in engagement teams, carrying out both reactive and proactive data analysis of large volumes of unstructured and structured data.
  • Collaborating with clients, fraud investigators, internal and external auditors, lawyers and regulatory authorities in sensitive and sometimes adversarial situations.
  • Working in our dedicated Forensic Technology & eDiscovery lab and secure platform to help clients secure and uncover facts with the use of technology.
  • Innovating and developing new solutions to answer current and future needs of our clients.
  • Supporting the leadership team and the project manager on the operational level and acting as a role model and coach for more junior team members.

Skills And Attributes For Success

To qualify for the role you must have

  • Degree (Bachelor or Master) in all fields related to Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering and other technical majors
  • Strong problem solving, analytical, technical, and interpersonal skills
  • Consulting-oriented mindset, flexibility and ‚Äúcan-do‚Äù approach
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English (German or French is a plus).

Ideally, you‚Äôll also have

  • Solid programming skills with Python, R, SQL or other main programming languages
  • Solid knowledge of IT infrastructure and security topics
  • Experience with Relativity, Nuix, and other state-of-the-art Forensic Technology & eDiscovery tools
  • Experience using Generative AI and engineering prompts

What We Offer

  • International multi-cultural team of highly motivated professionals
  • Constant personal development with a steep learning curve ‚Äì a system of trainings, mentoring, counselling and on-the-job learning
  • Modern working environment and equipment, fostering mobile working flexibility
  • Transparent performance-based recognition and progression system
  • Acquire a fully accredited corporate MBA (EY Tech MBA) from Hult International Business School, whilst working with EY, completely free*
  • exception of EY contractors, interns and alumni.

If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. Make the next step and apply for this position (ID: 814785) online. For further information please contact our recruitment team (recruitment.switzerland@ey.com / +41 58 286 33 66).

Title: Expert for data analysis and processing
Description:
Mission

In this joint position between the Center for Imaging and CIME, you will serve the EM community for exploiting measurements made on the electron microscopy platform. You will identify bottlenecks for data analysis in electron microscopy and create robust image and data analysis pipelines for typical CIME workloads

Main Duties And Responsibilities


Support EPFL researchers for electron microscopy data analysis
Analyse the needs for data processing workflows of the EPFL‚Äôs EM community
Implement (possibly ML/AI-driven) data analysis pipelines within EM imaging
Contribute to the research and development of new data analysis techniques and workflows in EM
Acting as a bridge between the CIME and the Center of Imaging.


Profile


Master or PhD in Science (Physics, Materials Science, Chemistry, Computer Science).
Expertise in the following fields/techniques :
Large scale data analysis
Development of data processing techniques/workflows
Quantitative Imaging
Experience in machine learning, AI etc.

We offer


Excellent working conditions in a dynamic multi-disciplinary environment
Possibility to increase your competences and extend your horizon.


Informations

Contract Start Date : to be discussed

Activity Rate : 100.00

Contract Type: CDD

Duration: 1 year, possibly renewable

Reference: 1560

For additional information: Please contact M. Marco Cantoni by e-mail: marco.cantoni@epfl.ch
Show more

Title: Internship Digital Chemistry Bayesian optimisation
Description:
Company Description

As a world market leader in crop protection, we help farmers to counter these threats and ensure enough safe, nutritious, affordable food for all ‚Äì while minimizing the use of land and other agricultural inputs. Syngenta Crop Protection keeps plants safe from planting to harvesting. From the moment a seed is planted through to harvest, crops need to be protected from weeds, insects and diseases as well as droughts and floods, heat and cold. Syngenta Crop Protection is headquartered in Switzerland.

Job Description

Join our Data Manufacturing Excellence and Chemistry Research teams as a Data Analytics Intern. We offer two internships: one optimizing global production processes for cost and sustainability, and another enhancing chemical target selection in research.

Both projects use cutting-edge Bayesian statistical modeling techniques to improve decision-making. You'll develop predictive models to boost manufacturing efficiency and candidate selection accuracy.

This opportunity provides exposure to real-life data from research and production, involves high-impact projects on operational efficiency and sustainability, and offers insight into a large organization's research and manufacturing operations.

Ideal for those passionate about data analysis, data science, and development.

Planned duration of the internship: 4-6 months starting from March 2025.

Main Responsibilities


Work with Research and Production departments
Develop a methodology to optimize cost, sustainability impact and chemical yield
Work on a concrete case study, on one of our Active Ingredient currently on market
Identify key drivers of chemical process to be optimized
Analyze variable production cost data from 5 international manufacturing sites based in UK, Switzerland, France, USA & Brazil
Develop predictive models to anticipate cost variations
Build predictive models in R or Python (eg using PyMC and SciPy optimize packages for Bayesian inference)
Create and maintain data flows and interactive dashboards to visualize variable product cost KPIs
Participate in the development of decision support tools for cost optimization
Collaborate with international teams to standardize data collection and analysis practices
Make larger analysis on other sites including 5 sites in UK, Switzerland, France, USA & Brazil


Qualifications


BAC+5 student, Master's or Engineering School, specialized in Data Science, you are looking for a 6-month end-of-year internship.
You have knowledge of programming languages, Python, SQL
Familiarity with machine learning concepts and statistical analysis
Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite and statistical methods is required
Rigorous and organized, you respect quality/deadline constraints and know how to adapt your work organization according to the priorities given.
Good communicator and naturally curious, you easily discuss the progress of your activities, the problems encountered and work in a spirit of continuous service improvement.
Your interpersonal skills allow you to integrate easily into teams.
Given the company's international environment, an intermediate level of written/read English (email exchanges, meetings, technical documents...) is required at minimum.
Valid driver's license required for site access.


Additional Information

What we offer


An international experience in a multicultural environment
Exposure to concrete large-scale cost optimization projects
Possibility to publish on methodologies utilized while keeping confidential information on Syngenta knowledge
Mentoring by data experts
Opportunity to travel to different production sites


Interested? We are looking for your application! Along with your Cover letter and CV please provide a Research Summary of 2-5 pages.

Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status.

Health Promotion Switzerland recognizes Syngenta's commitment to the health and well-being of its employees and awards the "Friendly Work Space" label to all its Swiss sites. At Syngenta, employee health and well-being are key to the company.
Show more

Title: Member of Technical Staff, AI Data
Description:
Overview

Help b uild the w orld‚Äôs m ost a dvanced m ultimodal d ataset at Microsoft AI.

We are on a mission to create the largest and most advanced multimodal dataset in the world. This dataset , spanning all modalities from across the web and beyond , will power the training of the world‚Äôs most capable AI frontier models , pushing the boundaries of scale , performance , and product deployment.

The AI Data team at Microsoft AI is responsible for all aspects of data preparation to support our model pre-training operations, including collecting data from the source, extracting and transforming the most useful data, and understanding the impact of changes to data by training and evaluating new models . We are an interdisciplinary team of engineers and scientists, learning from each other, and collaborating to create the best models and products. We work closely with the teams that transform pre-trained models into the models that power the consumer Copilot experience .

About

We are looking for outstanding individuals excited about contributi ng to the next generation of systems that will transform the field. In particular, we are looking for candidates who :


Are pa ssionate about the role of data in large-scale AI model training
Will thrive in a highly collaborative, fast-paced environment
Have a high degree of craftsmanship and pay close attention to details
Demonstrate a proactive attitude and enthusiasm for exploring new methods and technologies
Effectively manage multiple responsibilities and can adjust to shifting priorities .


Responsibilities


Design and develop data pipelines that ingest enormous amounts of multi-modal training data (text, audio, images, video).
Build and maintain cutting-edge infrastructure that can store and process the petabytes of data needed to power models.
Partner with the pretraining and post-training teams to improve our data recipe by rigorous and careful experimentation.
Collaborate with the product team and other engineers and researchers across Microsoft AI to identify gaps in the current generation of models.
Embody our culture and values .


Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications


Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science , Math, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field AND experience in business analytics, data science, software development, data modeling or data engineering work
OR Master's Degree in Computer Science , Math, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field AND experience in business analytics, data science, software development, or data engineering work
OR equivalent experience.
Experience u sing data processing technologies for Multimodal dataset scalability, parellel processing, data handling, streaming/batch processing, etc.
Experience working with distributed computing tools such as; Spark, Kubernetes, TensorFlow, Flink and Pyspark.
Experience conducted research in Machine Learning or worked as an ML Engineer/ MLOps/ SWE.
Experience designing and developing data pipelines that ingest enormous amounts of multi-modal training data (text, audio, images, video) AND have the skills to be able to build infrastructure to support this work from ground up.


Preferred


Experience working with large scale of data ideal Petabyte scale or above.


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form .

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.
