Title: Database Engineer
Description:
Job Opportunity: Database Engineer




We are looking for highly skilled Database Engineer (m/w/d) to join our customer team on a temporary basis. In this position, you will have the opportunity to actively participate in exciting database projects and contribute to the continuous improvement of processes at our client in the telecommunications industry. If you have a technical background and are interested in the design and optimization of modern database systems, then this could be the right opportunity for you.







Your responsibilities:

Administration, installation, configuration and maintenance of PostgreSQL and MariaDB databases.
Database performance optimization, including query tuning, indexing and configuration settings.
Implementation and management of high availability and replication solutions for databases.
Backup and recovery management to ensure data integrity and security.
Monitoring and analyzing system performance to identify bottlenecks and proactively resolve issues.
Support in the planning and implementation of database migration projects.
Administer and configure the Apache web server to support database-driven web applications.
Develop and maintain scripts to automate routine tasks.
Collaborating with developers and other IT teams to optimize database solutions.
Creation and maintenance of technical documentation and operating manuals




Your profile

Degree in computer science, information technology or a comparable qualification. Certificates
Several years of experience in the administration of PostgreSQL and MariaDB under Linux.
Sound knowledge of SQL, database design and performance tuning.
Experience with the configuration and administration of Apache web servers.
Knowledge of shell programming (Bash, Python, Perl) and automation tools.
Experience with high availability solutions (e.g. Patroni, Galera Cluster) and replication mechanisms.
Knowledge of backup strategies and disaster recovery.
Good problem-solving skills and an analytical mindset.
Ability to work in a team as well as independently and in a structured manner.
Certifications such as PostgreSQL Certified DBA, MariaDB Certified Database Administrator or similar an advantage
Experience in DevOps practices and CI/CD pipelines an advantage
Knowledge of container technologies (Docker, Kubernetes) and cloud environments.
Familiarity with security best practices for databases and web servers.
Languages: German and English (fluent)




What we offer

Duration: ASAP ‚Äì 31.12.2025
You can expect a modern infrastructure: access to the latest technologies and agile working methods
Flexible working hours with the option of working from home offer you a good work-life balance.
Budget: Market rate
Languages: English (mandatory), German (fluent)
Location: Hybrid ‚Äì 3 days per week in the office in Bern and / or Z√ºrich
Start Date: ASAP
Work location: Bern and Z√ºrich




This is a unique opportunity to work on a high-impact project with the potential for long-term growth. If you're up for the challenge, let‚Äôs connect!




Apply now or reach out for more details.

Title: Data Engineer ‚Äì Lugano, Switzerland
Description:
Data Engineer - Lugano, Switzerland




Tech stack: Data Engineer; MS SQL, SSIS, C#, Data Governance, Data Security (Data Masking, Encryption), Data Catalogs, Power BI, Tableau, Compliance Management, Financial Data Platforms, KPI Calculation, Data Architecture, Data Structures, Data Loading Optimization, ETL, Database Management, System Reliability, System Scalability, Performance Optimization, Business Intelligence, Integration with Enterprise Systems, SQL Server, .NET, Software Development, Automation, Data Integration, Advanced Analytics, Cloud Platforms (Azure, AWS); Data Engineer.




We're thrilled to present an exciting opportunity for Data Engineers with expertise in MS-SQL and C# to join the cutting edge of fintech innovation! Work alongside the brightest minds in private wealth management and financial software development, driving revolutionary advancements in asset management. Our client's latest product release has sparked a transformative wave in the industry, delivering personalized, scalable wealth management solutions like never before. If you're ready to shape the future of finance, join us on this thrilling journey into the next era of fintech excellence!




Our client is looking for passionate Data Engineer candidates with experience in some or all of the following (full training will be provided to fill any gaps in your skill set): (Tech stack: Data Engineer; MS SQL, SSIS, C#, Data Governance, Data Security (Data Masking, Encryption), Data Catalogs, Power BI, Tableau, Compliance Management, Financial Data Platforms, KPI Calculation, Data Architecture, Data Structures, Data Loading Optimization, ETL, Database Management, System Reliability, System Scalability, Performance Optimization, Business Intelligence, Integration with Enterprise Systems, SQL Server, .NET, Software Development, Automation, Data Integration, Advanced Analytics, Cloud Platforms (Azure, AWS); Data Engineer.




This is your opportunity to be part of a new, technically challenging project and to be involved in the creation of a new application from scratch. Fintech is booming and our client are fast becoming a leader of this market!




All Data Engineer positions come with the following benefits:




3 hours ‚Äòfree time‚Äô each week to investigate new technologies.
An annual training allowance of CHF 4,500.
27 days holiday (excluding Public Holidays) plus your birthday off.
Flexible working hours.




Location: Lugano, Switzerland/ Hybrid Working




Salary: CHF 80,000 - CHF 95,000 + Bonus + Pension + Benefits




To apply for this position please send your CV to Charlie Skipper at Noir.

Applicants must be based in Switzerland or Italy and have the right to work in Switzerland even though remote working is available.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Does this sound like you?

You are an engineer with a pragmatic attitude. You feel the weight of responsibility that comes with taking systems into production. You easily switch between scripting and structured programming in typed languages. You understand cloud, provisioning and automation. And you know how to build robust systems.







How you will help to create value with Data & A

IAt Xebia we build strong Data & AI practices to deliver value to our clients and their customers. In the past, our team of data professionals has predicted the daily demand for millions of loaves of bread, built advanced energy-saving algorithms to nationwide scale, and set up data innovation labs at large multinational corporations. We enjoy great success in making top companies AI-driven ‚Äî just think of what more we can achieve when YOU join our team!




In Switzerland, our journey is just beginning, collaborating closely with the Xebia Data Community in the Netherlands and Poland. This presents a lot of opportunities for you to actively influence and shape our initiatives within an innovative team characterized by a flat hierarchy. You'll have the chance to make a real impact and contribute to our growth from the ground up!




What your work as a Data Engineer Consultant will look like

As a Data Engineer Consultant, you will work on the backbone of the data infrastructure. You will help our clients to make the right design decisions and implement data pipelines. There is lots of data to store, many jobs to run and schedule, much configuration to be dealt with. You typically work at the client in teams that are a mix of people from Xebia Data and the client.




When you‚Äôre working on-site with a client you may come across something that is really difficult to solve. We‚Äôve got your back as we at Xebia Data work as a team and will help you solve your problems, because everybody at Xebia Data is just a quick message away and ready to help at any time.




Who Are We Looking For?

The Data Engineer Consultant role is a senior position with a central role in our clients‚Äô teams, and therefore we require at least 2 years of relevant professional experience. Having said that, we like to be amazed: so if you have done something outstanding during your studies, like contributing to open source projects or starting your own company, we encourage you to apply no matter what the level of your experience is.




THIS IS YOUR DREAM JOB IF‚Ä¶

‚úÖ You like working with the latest data processing tools, like Airflow, Spark, Flink, and Druid

‚úÖ You like to create, shape, and have a say.

‚úÖ You like working with both code and people and enjoy the excitement of regularly getting to learn new environments and help your clients to be successful.

THIS IS NOT YOUR DREAM JOB IF‚Ä¶

‚ùå You do not like to get things done in the best way possible with the limited time that you have available to finish it.

‚ùå You do not like working with open-source technology.

‚ùå You do not like coding, scripting, templating.







The Xebia Way

At Xebia we treat each other with respect, cooperation and a view towards creating an enthusiastic, self-empowered, dynamic working community. Our culture exudes creativity and ambition and our colleagues share an insatiable thirst for knowledge. We‚Äôre especially proud of our generous training budget and our ‚ÄúHack-What-You-Want Fridays."

In addition to a great culture, we provide competitive primary benefits:




competitive salary;
great pension plan;
extended holidays;
flexible workload;
monthly knowledge sharing sessions;
5k educational budget. And please, do spend every bit of it.

Does this sound like you?

You are an engineer with a pragmatic attitude. You feel the weight of responsibility that comes with taking systems into production. You easily switch between scripting and structured programming in typed languages. You understand cloud, provisioning and automation. And you know how to build robust systems.



How you will help to create value with Data & A

IAt Xebia we build strong Data & AI practices to deliver value to our clients and their customers. In the past, our team of data professionals has predicted the daily demand for millions of loaves of bread, built advanced energy-saving algorithms to nationwide scale, and set up data innovation labs at large multinational corporations. We enjoy great success in making top companies AI-driven ‚Äî just think of what more we can achieve when YOU join our team!


In Switzerland, our journey is just beginning, collaborating closely with the Xebia Data Community in the Netherlands and Poland. This presents a lot of opportunities for you to actively influence and shape our initiatives within an innovative team characterized by a flat hierarchy. You'll have the chance to make a real impact and contribute to our growth from the ground up!


What your work as a Data Engineer Consultant will look like

As a Data Engineer Consultant, you will work on the backbone of the data infrastructure. You will help our clients to make the right design decisions and implement data pipelines. There is lots of data to store, many jobs to run and schedule, much configuration to be dealt with. You typically work at the client in teams that are a mix of people from Xebia Data and the client.


When you‚Äôre working on-site with a client you may come across something that is really difficult to solve. We‚Äôve got your back as we at Xebia Data work as a team and will help you solve your problems, because everybody at Xebia Data is just a quick message away and ready to help at any time.


Who Are We Looking For?

The Data Engineer Consultant role is a senior position with a central role in our clients‚Äô teams, and therefore we require at least 2 years of relevant professional experience. Having said that, we like to be amazed: so if you have done something outstanding during your studies, like contributing to open source projects or starting your own company, we encourage you to apply no matter what the level of your experience is.

Title: Junior AI Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Nexthink is the global leader in digital employee experience management. Our products allow enterprises to create highly productive digital workplaces for their employees by delivering optimal end-user experiences. Through a unique combination of real-time analytics, automation and employee feedback, Nexthink gives IT teams the insight they need to empower people at work.

Headquartered in Switzerland with US headquarters in Boston, Nexthink also has offices in France, UK, Germany, Spain and UAE. Our growing team of Nexthinkers is proud to be making the digital work lives of nearly ten million employees across 1,000 customers more productive.

At Nexthink, we believe actions are stronger than words when it comes to diversity, inclusivity, and equity in the workplace. Nexthinkers are multinational and multilingual, and come from all walks of life. We are committed to hiring a genuinely representative workforce that can create solutions and foster innovation for the modern digital employee experience. Join us today!

Job Description

We are seeking a Junior AI Engineer with foundational knowledge in AI, GenAI, and Machine Learning. You will join one of our AI teams and assist them in prototyping, maturing, and shipping AI features to a production-ready level.

You are a pragmatic, results-driven engineer who is eager to learn and understands modern AI stacks but thinks in terms of software reliability, performance, and user impact. You focus on creating scalable, observable solutions that solve real-world problems for our customers.

Because the role is cross-functional, the ability to communicate complex concepts in simple ways is essential. You will collaborate with product, design, front-end, and infrastructure teams to bring delightful AI features to life.

Responsibilities

As part of the AI team at Nexthink, you will:


Assist in implementing new AI features with high-quality coding standards and automated test coverage.
Support solving the engineering challenges behind data collection, retrieval, evaluation, and inference at scale.
Help build and maintain CI/CD pipelines for AI components, ensuring safe, repeatable deployments.
Instrument robust online/offline evaluation metrics and dashboards to monitor quality in production.
Proactively propose new product capabilities or improvements based on user data and technology advances.
Stay current with the rapidly evolving AI engineering ecosystem and share knowledge with the Nexthink community.
Communicate effectively with (non-technical) stakeholders such as product managers and UX designers.


Qualifications


BSc/MSc in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related field
0-3 years of professional software-engineering experience, including internships or projects.
Basic experience in integrating with LLMs (e.g., Prompting, Evaluation, Observability).
Demonstrated interest in delivering AI-powered features that serve real users at scale (e.g., retrieval-augmented search, Generative AI assistants, predictive analytics).
Fluency in Python or at least one strongly-typed language (TypeScript or Java), with clean-code and testing discipline.
Understanding of cloud-native architectures (AWS or comparable), containerisation (Docker), and orchestration (Kubernetes / ECS).
Hands-on experience with MLOps: reproducible pipelines, automated evaluations, feature stores, CI/CD for models or prompt/embedding configs.
Strong data intuition: ability to inspect raw logs, design metrics, and quickly identify quality regressions.
Product mindset and empathy for end-users; able to translate fuzzy product requirements into incremental engineering plans.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills in English (spoken & written).


If you‚Äôre excited about joing one of the top companies working on AI and pushing the boundaries of AI we‚Äôd love to hear from you! Even if you don‚Äôt meet every requirement, we encourage you to apply‚Äîwe value expertise, passion, and the drive to learn.

Additional Information

We are the pioneers and trailblazers of a global IT Market Category (DEX) that is shaping the future of how the world works, giving our customers‚Äô IT Teams total digital visibility across their enterprise. Our innovative solutions integrate real-time analytics, automation, and employee feedback across all endpoints. This enables our IT teams to solve complex technical challenges, create ever more productive workplaces, and deliver happy, satisfied employees in the digital workplace.

With over 1000 employees across 5 continents, Nexthink operates as One Team, connecting, collaborating and innovating to continuously grow. We call our employees ‚ÄòNexthinkers‚Äô and our commitment to diversity, inclusion, and equity is second to none. We currently have over 75 nationalities working with us, from all cultures and backgrounds, speaking many different languages.

If you are looking for a change and like a nice atmosphere, lots of challenges, and having fun while working, this is a great opportunity for you! Check what we offer:

üíº Permanent Contract and a competitive compensation package (including stock options).

üìç Very good location next to the Prilly-Malley train station.

üè° Hybrid work model balancing office and remote work, with a structured approach for new hires to foster connections and onboarding.

üèñÔ∏è Flexible Hours and unlimited vacation (employees have unlimited paid time off on top of the 25 days of holidays we offer) plus 3 company-paid volunteer days.

ü§∏ Free access to a fitness centre inside the building.

üöû Reimbursement of the half-fare travel card for public transport.

üßë‚Äçüè´ Reimbursement up to 50% of the cost of French classes.

üçâ Fresh fruit, cookies, and soft drinks as well.

ü§ù Regular company and team events like Voluntary Days, Pizza talks, Team Building activities, hosting Meetups at the office and more!

üì£ Bonuses for referring successful hires after three months of continuous employment.

üöö We offer a relocation package to people who are coming from another country.

Please note that NOT all the benefits listed above are available for temporary, contract, and internship roles. To ensure you have the most up-to-date information, we recommend checking with your Recruitment Partner.

Title: Procurement Data Analyst II
Description:
About Nubank

Nu was born in 2013 with the mission to fight complexity to empower people in their daily lives by reinventing financial services. We are one of the world‚Äôs largest digital banking platforms, serving millions of customers across Brazil, Mexico, and Colombia.

Our Procurement team

Our purpose is to support, influence and challenge Nubank business decisions by delivering value to the end-to-end sourcing processes through long-term & sustainable partnerships, all executed with efficient, agile and innovative technologies.

The Procurement team's BHAG (Big Hairy Audacious Goal) is to be the best and least bureaucratic Procurement area in the technology segment by promoting cost efficiency through strategic long-term & sustainable partnerships with the highest skilled, diverse and engaged team.

You will be responsible for


Lead the creation and establishment of a comprehensive Procurement KPI tracking framework.
Proactively identify opportunities for process and efficiency improvements through data analysis and Procurement/BI tools.
Contribute to financial and Procurement data reporting, ensuring the delivery of reliable and timely information for various stakeholders.
Engage with stakeholders (such as Finance, FP&A, Engineering, Risk and other teams) across the organization to map data sources and ensure accurate data representation.
Develop and maintain datasets in BI and Data tools, enabling scalable data manipulation and analysis.
Design and implement dashboards to provide actionable insights and support decision-making for the Procurement team.
Utilize SQL and other programming languages (e.g., Python) to extract, manipulate, and analyze large datasets for optimized financial and procurement strategies.


We Are Looking For a Person Who Has


Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable business insights.
Proficiency in SQL, Scala and/or Python for data analysis and experience with data visualization tools
Excellent communication skills with the ability to influence and collaborate across teams as well as practical knowledge on documentation techniques, and project management tools.
Experience with financial technologies and a strong passion for business, economy, finance, and technology.
Understanding of financial statements and accounting data structure.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic, and collaborative environment.
Familiarity with sourcing and procurement processes is a plus.
Language: Advanced proficiency in English; Spanish is a beneficial addition.


Our Benefits


Chance of earning equity at Nubank
Food/ Meal Card (Vale-Refei√ß√£o and/or Vale Alimenta√ß√£o)
Public Transportation Commuting Benefit (Vale-Transporte)
NuCare ‚Äì Psychological, Financial and Legal Assistance Program
Life Insurance
Medical Plan
Dental Plan
NuLanguage ‚Äì Language Course Program
Nucleo - Our learning platform of courses
Extended Parental Leave
Daycare Allowance
Parental Consultancy
Work-from-home Allowance
Gym Partnerships
30 days of paid vacation


Our Nu Way of Working

Our work model is hybrid and has cycles that can be from two to three months according to the business of expertise. For every eight or two weeks of remote work, one will be at the office.

Diversity & Inclusion

At Nu, we want to be sure that we're building a more diverse and inclusive workplace that reflects the customers we serve and seeks to empower. That's why we hire based on equality. We consider gender, ethnicity, race, religion, sexual orientation, and other identity markers as enriching elements to our company while ensuring neither of them represents a barrier when recruiting fantastic talent.
